Title: Data Analyst, Customer Service
Description:
Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services, with 283 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.

Summary Of The Role

As a Data Analyst, you’ll be a key player responsible for creating and maintaining Customer Service reports within BI tools. You will analyze diverse data sets, including workforce management forecasting and scheduling metrics, vendor performance, and customer experience metrics, to identify trends and deliver executive-level updates. Additionally, you will be responsible for providing user support to our vendor partners and triaging Customer Service data integrity issues with our engineering team. Lastly, you will work closely with internal CS teams and Vendor partners to ensure accurate, effective use of workforce management and operational data across the customer service function.

Responsibilities


Responsible for the creation and maintenance of Global Customer Service dashboards and reports for both internal stakeholders and vendor partners within various BI tools such as Tableau
Partner with the Netflix Data Visualization team to migrate ad hoc Tableau dashboards into Netflix's custom data visualization tools
Extract, manipulate, and analyze large datasets from various sources to identify patterns, trends, and anomalies in customer service data
Provide tier-one support to vendor partners data consumers. Collaborate with Data engineering teams to ensure timely resolution of data integrity issues
Educate and train users on how to most effectively utilize and interpret reports and data
Create and maintain up-to-date documentation, including data dictionaries, report definitions, and best practices
Partner closely with multiple cross-functional teams to understand reporting requirements, business processes, and KPIs
Prepare and deliver periodic exec-level updates on status, insights, and trends to help inform and guide critical business decisions
Develop and implement comprehensive and consistent strategies, tools, and processes related to dashboard maintenance and reporting support


Qualifications And Competencies


Bachelor’s degree in Math, Statistics, Business, Information Technology, or other demonstrated experience in a quantitative field or equivalent work experience accepted
5+ years of data analysis, reporting, and business intelligence, preferably in a customer service or related operational context
Proficiency in data manipulation and analysis using data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Demonstrated experience in designing and generating complex reports, dashboards, and visualizations that provide actionable insights to drive operational improvements
Experience working with large datasets and performing data cleansing, transformation, and validation to ensure data accuracy and integrity.
Project/program management, process development, influencing, modeling, and consulting skills
Communication, partnership, and interpersonal skills – ability to communicate complex concepts in simple terms, keeping diverse audiences in mind to drive results


Inclusion is a Netflix value and we strive to host a meaningful interview experience for all candidates. If you want an accommodation/adjustment for a disability or any other reason during the hiring process, please send a request to your recruiting partner.

We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.
Show more

Title: Data Analist / Business Analist
HTML:
Data Analist / Business Analist

Als Data Analist / Business Analist ben jij de schakel tussen onze data en de business. Met jouw kennis van zowel data tooling als bedrijfskundige processen zorg jij voor oplossingen die impact maken. Je analyseert de behoeften van de organisatie, vertaalt deze naar concrete oplossingen en creëert op basis hiervan interne data producten die het verschil maken.

Om jou werk zo effectief mogelijk te maken hebben wij sinds een aantal jaren een big data platform in Databricks ontwikkeld waar we continu nieuwe databronnen op aan kunnen sluiten.

Dit is een afwisselende functie waarin je onderdeel zal zijn van een centraal data team, waarmee je kan sparren over de technische oplossingen. Daarnaast zul je een groot deel van je tijd samenwerken verschillende stakeholders voor het inventariseren van hun wensen en problemen.


Wat ga je doen?

  • Vertalen van businessvragen naar interne data-producten;
  • Fungeren als sparringpartner voor de Bussiness bij data-gerelateerde vraagstukken;
  • Analyseren van bedrijfsprocessen en het identificeren van optimalisatiemogelijkheden;
  • Borgen van datakwaliteit door bijvoorbeeld het ontwikkelen van standaarden voor rapportages;
  • Ondersteunen bij het implementeren van nieuwe datatools en het begeleiden van de adoptie binnen de organisatie;
  • Identificeren van de benodigde databronnen die op ons centrale data platform aangesloten moeten worden.


Over CowManager

CowManager is een innovatief en wereldwijd opererend bedrijf in de agrarische sector, gedreven door big data en het welzijn van koeien. Als uitvinders van de eerste oorsensortechnologie voor melkvee blijven we continu innoveren met geavanceerde software en systemen. Door de hoeveelheid aan (sensor)data en complexiteit van het monitoren zijn we voorloper en constant op zoek naar super schaalbare en robuuste oplossingen. We vragen veel van je gedrevenheid, zijn ambitieus maar vinden het belangrijk dat je resultaten samen met je collega’s worden behaald.


Wat breng je mee?

Jij bent analytisch sterk, communicatief vaardig en beschikt over een groot probleemoplossend vermogen. Daarnaast weet je complexe data te vertalen naar heldere inzichten en begrijpelijke oplossingen. Je hebt affiniteit met zowel technologie als bedrijfsprocessen en schakelt moeiteloos tussen operationele en strategische vraagstukken.


Daarnaast breng je mee:

  • Een afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding in een relevante richting, zoals Bedrijfskunde, Informatica of Business Analytics;
  • Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring in een vergelijkbare functie;
  • Ervaring met SQL;
  • Ervaring met PowerBI en/of Databricks is een pre;
  • Ervaring met Python is een pluspunt;
  • Kennis van en ervaring met procesoptimalisatie en datamodellering;
  • Sterke communicatieve vaardigheden, zowel in het Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een proactieve houding en de drive om altijd naar de beste oplossingen te zoeken.


Waarom CowManager?

  • Een moderne werkomgeving met de nieuwste technologieën;
  • Variabele eindejaarsbonus tot 10% van je jaarsalaris;
  • 25 verlofdagen, met de optie om extra dagen bij te kopen;
  • Werken aan innovatieve technologie met direct zichtbare impact;
  • Maandelijks €50,- thuiswerkbudget (o.b.v. 40 uur);
  • €500,- budget voor een ergonomische thuiswerkplek;
  • Jaarlijks vitaliteitsbudget van €250,- (o.b.v. 40 uur);
  • Dagelijks gratis en vers fruit op kantoor.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Van Caem Klerks Group is seeking a Data Analyst/Analytics Engineer. You will be responsible for maintenance and further development of our Data Platform, reports and apps in Power BI, in-house built Python applications and user support.




Requirements

Fluent in English.
At least 2 years of experience as a Data Analyst/Analytics Engineer/Data Engineer.
Proficiency in SQL.
Data modelling knowledge.
Strong communication skills and the ability to work with people of different skill sets.
Knowledge of ETL/ELT.




Nice-to-haves

Experience with PowerBI.
Experience with dbt.
Experience with Azure.




Recruitment process

Get to know each other: you will have a 30-minute talk with our Analytics Engineer. This will lead to get to know each other and learning more about Van Caem Klerks Group and the Data Team's role within the company.
Technical assessment: during a longer assessment, around 1 hour, you will connect with our Analytics Engineer. You will discuss the technical side of the team's work. You also may be given a challenge, which can focus more on applying your skills than theoretical knowledge. For example, you may be asked to complete a SQL coding challenge.
Final call

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are Paula’s Choice Skincare, a global skincare company founded in the US (Seattle) in 1995. Paula’s Choice is an ambitious fast-growing brand with an inspiring mission: we uncover the truth about skincare and deliver smart, safe products based on scientific research, without gimmicks and misleading claims. Part of Unilever Prestige Brand since 2021 where we are proud to present our core values and continue to grow together with our sister brands.




Our European headquarters are located in the Netherlands (Amersfoort) and local offices in the UK, France (Paris) and Germany (Berlin). We market our skincare via different business models: direct-to-consumer via our own websites (in UK, Germany, France, The Netherlands, Italy, Spain, Sweden, Denmark), via marketplaces (Amazon and Bol.com), via selected retail partners, including Galeries Lafayette, Space NK, Selfridges, De Bijenkorf, Douglas, and via selected e-tailers including Skincity and CultBeauty.




We are a fast-growing scale-up with a young employer base and a high-energy culture. We adopted an agile way of working and thrive on change. Agile lives and breathes in our full organization, this makes us move fast and grow even faster. We are proud to consistently show high double-digit growth. Our main business (75%) is direct to consumer via our e-commerce business making us a fast-paced profitable organization.







Paula’s Choice is committed to diversity! Our customers come from all walks of life and so do we. We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it’s the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger. If you share our values and our enthusiasm for empowering people to achieve their own definition of beautiful, Paula’s Choice could be a wonderful fit for you.




Does this sound inspiring? That’s great! Because we’d love to get to know you.




We are looking for a

Data Analyst




Full Time | Amersfoort




As a Data Analyst, you will focus on translating our data into actionable insights and building robust data models for our data team.




You will be the data team member who continuously raises the effectiveness of our initiatives by providing data-driven insights and advising on how to improve further. You will constantly work on obtaining an in-depth understanding of the business challenges from your stakeholders and using these insights to develop (data-driven) solutions while always thinking customer-first (internal and external). The data intelligence consists of designing, building and maintaining reporting (PowerBi) as well as analyses to (dis)prove hypotheses or evaluate initiatives from the business.




Furthermore, you will work on designing, developing, and maintaining data pipelines and analytics solutions. You will work closely with data teammembers and business stakeholders to understand the requirements and translate these into a data model. You are responsible to ensure that data is accessible, reliable, and actionable.




In this role, you will report directly to the data team manager. You will mainly support all different types of functional domains, but the main focus is on marketing areas such as Retention, Online Marketing and eCommerce. As our data team is consistently evolving, hardly anything is set in stone, and you will be challenged to be innovative and creative in finding innovative solutions.




What will you be doing:

Work with various stakeholders from several departments to perform data-driven analyses, transform the results into actionable insights, and communicate the results to the stakeholders.
Design and implement scalable data pipelines to collect, process, and store large volumes of data.
Develop and maintain ETL (extract, transform, load) processes to ensure data quality and integrity.
Develop, maintain, and update Power BI dashboards containing customer metrics and KPIs used by various internal stakeholders.
Educating teams on data-informed decision-making and advocating the work of the data team across the business







What will you bring?

At least 4+ years of relevant working experience as business/data analyst/analytics engineer or any other relevant data role, preferably in Marketing, retail, e-commerce or other related business function
Experience in building and maintaining data models
Master’s degree, preferably in business, statistics, marketing, IT or a relevant related field
Natural tendency to always want to raise the bar and put the customer first (internal and external)
Thrives on working with a multi-disciplinary group of stakeholders and enjoys presenting insights to business partners
Analytically strong data addict, gets energy from quickly creating insights and translating these into actionable improvement suggestions.
Self-starting and able to balance thoroughness with speed and focus on delivery
Experience with SQL, Python and version control system like GIT. Databricks, PowerBi, Apache Spark, Microsoft Azure are a plus
Fluent in English




Do you recognize yourself in the above and do you enjoy working in a dynamic and informal work environment? Then we’d love to get to know you and hopefully welcome you to join our enthusiastic team soon. We look forward to receiving a motivation together with your Curriculum Vitae.




Our culture is the result of our behaviors, our personal commitments, our willingness to collaborate, listen and learn. If you recognize yourself in our values, you will feel at home at Paula’s Choice:

Each of us is powerful on our own, but together we are unstoppable.




BUILD TRUST: We set the standard for skincare, transparency and shared knowledge

BE BOLD: We lead through innovation and disrupting the status quo

ACT WITH KINDNESS: We operate out of respect and care for our customers, our colleagues, and the planet

CREATE COMMUNITY: We build a welcoming and inclusive community with a culture of growth and empowerment

Show more

Do you recognize yourself in the above and do you enjoy working in a dynamic and informal work environment? Then we’d love to get to know you and hopefully welcome you to join our enthusiastic team soon. We look forward to receiving a motivation together with your Curriculum Vitae.

Title: Junior Analyst
Description:
Junior Analyst

Processing data is our core business. We use data to develop, train, and implement models while creating a deeper understanding of business processes for our clients. We believe that data should never be processed in isolation or without the proper context. That’s why we provide contextual analytics—taking into account what the data represents, rather than just analyzing numbers or text stored in a file or database.

And yes, we also develop and train AI/ML models, but only if they add value to what our clients expect from us.

Role

As a Junior Analyst, you will work closely with senior analysts and managers to collect, process, and define data for various projects. This involves conducting detailed data analyses to determine data quality, performing fit-for-purpose assessments, and designing and implementing data pipelines.

To ensure high-quality and meaningful results, you will continuously validate outputs and underlying assumptions. This is achieved by reviewing relevant documentation and discussing findings with internal or client subject matter experts.

Key Responsibilities:

Extract, process, and classify data from structured sources
Develop models to extract data from unstructured sources
Build models to forecast (financial) metrics
Create key metrics to identify patterns and insights
Develop dashboards for (senior) management
Define implementation strategies for productionizing analyses

What We Offer

We value individual contributions and encourage professional growth. We enjoy working together and learning from each other. Our clients benefit from our expertise, and our colleagues develop as professionals.

Our assignments are challenging and diverse, meaning no two days, projects, or clients are the same.

Benefits:

Competitive salary with a bonus scheme
Hybrid & flexible working options, plus 30 vacation days
A young, dynamic, and diverse team with passion and ambition
Two additional leave days per year for volunteering
Choice of a company car or public transport card
Laptop, phone, and internet allowance (also for personal use)

Your Profile

We are looking for ambitious individuals with a strong understanding of mathematics and its applications. You should have an intrinsic drive to learn and understand business processes, as well as the ability to analyze and interpret data in a meaningful way.

Education:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Economics, or Quantitative Finance

Required Skills:

Basic programming knowledge (Python, R, SQL)
Ability to design and implement mathematical models
Strong foundation in statistical analysis

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you passionate about leveraging data to drive meaningful insights and business decisions? Do you want to contribute to a company that helps individuals achieve their professional goals? If so, this Data Analyst role could be the perfect fit for you!




Your Role as a Data Analyst

As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in shaping data-driven strategies by analyzing complex datasets and delivering actionable insights. Your work will directly impact product development, marketing strategies, and overall business performance. Additionally, you will help optimize internal processes and enhance platform efficiency through data-driven solutions.




Key Responsibilities

Database Optimization: Design and maintain scalable database structures for analytics and insights.
ETL Processes: Develop and manage ETL pipelines to integrate and transform data from multiple sources.
Data Visualization: Create interactive dashboards and reports using tools like Looker Studio to support business decision-making.
User Behavior Analysis: Analyze user engagement, cohort behaviors, and platform performance to improve the user experience.
Payment Data Analysis: Work with payment gateway data (e.g., Stripe, PayPal) to monitor subscription trends and revenue performance.
Collaboration: Partner with cross-functional teams, including development, marketing, finance, and product, to meet data needs.
Compliance: Ensure data handling aligns with GDPR and other relevant regulations.




Who You Are

You are an analytical thinker with a keen eye for detail, capable of translating raw data into meaningful insights. You enjoy working collaboratively but can also drive independent projects to completion. Adaptable and curious, you’re always eager to enhance your skills and contribute to a data-driven culture.




Your Skills and Qualifications

Technical Skills:

Strong proficiency in SQL and Python.
Experience with Looker Studio, BigQuery, and other data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Hands-on experience with ETL tools like Apache Airflow, dbt, or Fivetran.
Familiarity with analytics platforms such as Google Analytics, Mixpanel, or Amplitude.




Education & Experience:

Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
3–5 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within a SaaS or tech-driven environment.

Bonus Skills:

Experience with machine learning, predictive analytics, or API integrations.
Understanding of career platforms and job seeker behavior analytics.




What’s Offered

A competitive salary based on experience.
25 annual leave days, including your birthday off.
A modern office space with on-site amenities such as a gym, game room, and social areas.
Comprehensive benefits, including meal provisions and transportation support.
A wellness budget to support gym memberships or personal hobbies.
Regular team activities, outings, and networking events.
Opportunities for professional development, including certifications in tools like Looker Studio and BigQuery.

Show more

  • Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
  • 3–5 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within a SaaS or tech-driven environment.

Bonus Skills:

  • Experience with machine learning, predictive analytics, or API integrations.
  • Understanding of career platforms and job seeker behavior analytics.


What’s Offered

  • A competitive salary based on experience.
  • 25 annual leave days, including your birthday off.
  • A modern office space with on-site amenities such as a gym, game room, and social areas.
  • Comprehensive benefits, including meal provisions and transportation support.
  • A wellness budget to support gym memberships or personal hobbies.
  • Regular team activities, outings, and networking events.
  • Opportunities for professional development, including certifications in tools like Looker Studio and BigQuery.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a skilled Data Analyst to support financial and regulatory reporting. You will work with large datasets, optimize data processing, and ensure compliance with financial regulations. This role requires strong SQL skills to analyze and transform data, but it is not a hardcore programming position. You will collaborate with Business Analysts, Data Engineers, and Reporting Specialists to deliver accurate financial reports.




Key Responsibilities:

Analyze and process financial datasets for regulatory reporting.
Develop and optimize SQL queries for data extraction and structuring.
Ensure data quality, resolve discrepancies, and validate reporting outcomes.
Translate reporting requirements into structured data attributes.
Support compliance with IFRS, Basel III/IV, Solvency II, ECB/EBA regulations.




What We Are Looking For:

3+ years of experience in data, finance, or IT analysis.
Strong SQL skills (MS SQL Server, Oracle, PostgreSQL).
Experience with data warehousing, ETL, and financial reporting tools.
Experience with Power BI is a plus.




What's in for you:

A challenging large-scale project.
International work environment and collaborative colleagues.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
We help companies modernize business operations, adopt intelligent automation, deliver real-time performance insights and connect the enterprise - accelerating the impact of digital transformation. Founded in 1987 and recognized as a trusted advisor, HSO is one of the world's top business solution and implementation partners, large enough to serve, small enough to care. We are 100% dedicated to Microsoft technology, with practices that offer our clients a complete set of Microsoft cloud solutions from a single global partner. HSO is a proven global leader with unique delivery capabilities offered from our dedicated Microsoft practices in more than 30 offices across the Americas, Europe, Australia and Asia.

HSO is a Gold Certified partner since 2002 and since 2006 has been a part of the Microsoft Dynamics Inner Circle, a prestige reserved for just 1% of Microsoft partners worldwide. Within HSO you'll work with Microsoft Dynamics 365, Azure cloud platform and our unique, industry-specific solutions.

We are a dynamic and innovative company dedicated to leveraging data to drive business insights and decisions. Our team is passionate about technology and data, and we are looking for a talented Data Engineer / Data Analyst to join us.

Key Responsibilities


Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines and ETL processes
Analyze complex datasets to derive actionable insights and support decision-making
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver solutions
Develop and maintain data models, databases, and data warehouses
Create and manage dashboards and reports to visualize data trends and metrics
Ensure data quality and integrity through rigorous testing and validation
Optimize data processes for performance and scalability



Requirements


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field
Proven experience as a Data Engineer, Data Analyst, or in a similar role
Proficiency in Fabric, SQL, Python, and data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI)
Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) is a plus
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities



Benefits

Why choose HSO?

Freedom and flexibility

An organization with a lot of professional freedom and flexibility where we make the best choices together to optimize your development process during your career.

Culture

An open and accessible work environment full of colleagues who are always there for each other. We are one big HSO Team. Because without cooperation and fun, there is no success!

Development and growth

A job with plenty of growth opportunities in an organisation with an eye for your talents, ambitions and the things that drive you.

A good remuneration package

An excellent salary and fringe benefits include a laptop, mobile phone, flexible incentive plan, large office offering a collaborative environment with a modern design and free parking in Amsterdam.

Do you want to be part of a fast-growing company and work with many international colleagues? Then you can apply immediately!
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst / Hybrid Amsterdam / 6 + months Freelance Contract / Start ASAP




Rate: €46 per hour




Experience: 7 years




The scope of the consultant services:




In this role the candidate will help develop internal systems and tooling to scalable process and release 1,000,000+ 3D assets of 3D experiences. Title: Business Intelligence Specialist
HTML:
Wat ga jij doen?

Als Business Intelligence Specialist (BI Specialist) weet jij wel raad met het verzamelen, integreren en verspreiden van data. En dat klinkt ons als muziek in de oren! Met een analytische blik en ervaring met BI-tools en data engineering technieken ben jij de specialist die wij zoeken. Kom jij ons bestaande team van 8 personen verder versterken?


Met jouw proactieve houding en probleemoplossend vermogen analyseer je verzamelde gegevens en zet je deze om in bruikbare, volledige en betrouwbare informatie. Daarnaast denk je mee over nieuwe oplossingen en producten, en ontwikkel je datawarehouse oplossingen vanaf de externe bron tot aan het eindproduct. Je werkt nauw samen met partners en ondersteunende afdelingen en hebt veel contact met de Data & Analyse Specialisten. In deze rol rapporteer je rechtstreeks aan de Manager Metrics. Het team waarin je gaat werken bestaat naast BI specialisten ook uit Data & Analyse Specialisten en Data Scientists.


Jouw verantwoordelijkheden in het kort omschreven;


  • Ontwerpen, realiseren en testen van managementrapportages in Qlik;
  • Ophalen en verwerken van externe databronnen d.m.v. API’s;
  • Beheren van het datawarehouse (SQL Server) en ETL processen (SSIS);
  • Ontwerpen en bewaken van de structuur van datamodellen en bijbehorende KPI definities;
  • Je bent betrouwbaar in het opleveren van de gevraagde inzichten en durft je uit te spreken over bijzonderheden die jou opvallen in het resultaat;
  • Samenwerken met partners, ondersteunende afdelingen en de Data & Analyse Specialisten.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een bruto startsalaris vanaf € 3.500 per maand op basis van 40 uur per week;
  • Een OV-businesscard voor zakelijke reizen;
  • 25 vakantiedagen op basis van 40 uur per week;
  • Een uitdagende functie met ruimte voor eigen inbreng en kansen om jezelf verder te ontwikkelen;
  • Een laptop en telefoon in bruikleen;
  • Toegang tot ons Yource Spaarsysteem ("Yource Coins") voor leuke uitjes en cadeaus.


Wat vragen wij?

  • Je kunt data omzetten in bruikbare en betrouwbare inzichten voor de organisatie;
  • Je hebt ervaring met Qlik of een andere BI tool en kunt dit aantonen;
  • Je beschikt over HBO werk- en denkniveau in de vorm van relevante werkervaring of een diploma;
  • Je hebt een goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal en bent communicatief sterk.

Title: Data Analist | PowerBI
HTML:
Ben jij een Data Analist en heb je veel verstand van Data en PowerBI? Wil jij je inzetten voor de Nederlandse vluchtelingensector? Vind jij het leuk om met veel verschillende stakeholders te schakelen en te werken aan een BI Competence Centre? Lees dan snel verder!


Dit ga je doen


Jouw taken als Data Analist bestaan uit:

  • Het zorgdragen voor de juiste implementatie van het BICC;
  • Het in kaart brengen van wensen uit de business;
  • Het meedenken over datamogelijkheden en waar nodig deze vertalen naar beleid en/of actiepunten;
  • Het schakelen met diverse stakeholders;
  • Actief meedenken over verbetermogelijkheden over de data-omgeving.


Hier ga je werken


Deze organisatie in Utrecht, waar jij als Data Analist komt te werken, vormt een onmisbaar onderdeel in de Nederlandse vluchtelingenopvang. Dag in dag uit werken de beste (zorg)professionals samen om vluchtelingen hulp te bieden.


De organisatie is momenteel druk bezig om een Business Intelligence Competence Center (BICC) op te zetten om als interne hub op het gebied van BI te acteren. Dit maakt het voor hen mogelijk om grote hoeveelheden data en processen op de juiste manier te centraliseren en daar de business optimaal te ondersteunen. Hier werken momenteel twee collega's, een kwartiermaker en een externe leverancier aan, maar kunnen hier nog extra ondersteuning in gebruiken.


Als BI Specialist zorg jij dat het BICC op de juiste wijze wordt opgeleverd. Je zorgt voor goede interne en externe communicatie rondom de data-ontwikkelingen. Jij vormt de brug tussen de business en het platform, waardoor je schakelt met stakeholders om wensen in kaart te brengen en deze te vertalen naar concrete BI-oplossingen. Daarnaast denk je actief mee hoe je met behulp van de beschikbare data de business optimaal kan ondersteunen. Samen met de IT Manager en Informatiemanager werk je aan het databeleid voor de komende jaren. Gezien dit een relatief nieuwe rol is, is er veel ruimte voor eigen initiatief en verantwoordelijkheid.


Je vervult een brugfunctie tussen IT en de organisatie en weet precies hoe je met data je doel kan bereiken, hopelijk ook gepaard met een gezonde dosis humor!


Dit doe je uiteraard niet alleen. Je werkt samen in het IT-team dat dagelijks verantwoordelijk is voor de strategie en operatie op IT-vlak en daarnaast kun je altijd terugvallen op je collega's binnen het BI domein.


Ben je enthousiast geworden over deze leuke uitdaging of wil je toch nog wat meer weten? Neem dan gerust telefonisch contact op óf stuur mij een berichtje via Whatsapp.


Dit neem je mee


Als Data Analist neem je tenminste mee:

  • Een achtergrond in Data Analyse of BI Development;
  • Ervaring met het in kaart brengen en verbeteren van processen is een pre;
  • Hbo werk/denkniveau;
  • Affiniteit met de zorg, overheid of de vluchtelingensector;
  • Communicatief vaardig met een pro-actieve houding;
  • Ervaring met stakeholdermanagement tot aan directieniveau.


Dit krijg je


De arbeidsvoorwaarden voor deze functie bestaan onder andere uit:

  • Vakantiegeld;
  • Reiskostenvergoeding;
  • 13e maand;
  • Opleiding- en begeleidingmogelijkheden;
  • Thuiswerkmogelijkheden.

Title: BI-consulent
HTML:
Welkom in de wereld van datagedreven mogelijkheden, waar elk inzicht een verhaal vertelt en elke analyse grip op performance brengt. Bij Kasparov BI wachten mooie uitdagingen op een Medior/Senior BI Specialist zoals jij, die de fijne kneepjes van Business Intelligence (BI) al beheerst, maar nog hongerig is naar meer.


Stel je voor: een wereld waarin je niet gebonden bent aan één enkele rol, maar de vrijheid hebt om jouw expertise te delen met diverse opdrachtgevers. Bij ons combineer je de stabiliteit van een vaste baan met de dynamiek van afwisselende projecten. En dat is nog niet alles. In onze Performance Akademy onthullen we geheimen en delen we kennis om een echte BI-professional te worden én te blijven.


Maar wat staat je te wachten in deze boeiende rol?

Als Medior/Senior BI Specialist navigeer je door uitdagende opdrachten op het kruispunt van data, rapportage en analytics. Jij bent de sleutel tot het implementeren en optimaliseren van BI bij onze opdrachtgevers. Dankzij jouw ervaring word je de ideale partner, die data ontsluit, optimaliseert en omzet in doordachte rapportages en aantrekkelijke dashboards. Je adviseert klanten over het slim inzetten van data voor analyses en rapportages, waarbij je niet alleen oog hebt voor technologie maar ook voor de organisatorische kant van BI-implementaties.


Wat neem je mee op dit avontuur?

  • Een afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding;
  • Minimaal 2 tot 4 jaar ervaring als BI Specialist of data/business analist met een focus op BI;
  • Ervaring met Power BI en managementdashboarding;
  • Vaardigheid in SQL en databases;
  • Kennis van het Azure Data Platform is een pré;
  • Communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Het vermogen om standpunten overtuigend te onderbouwen;
  • Accuraatheid en projectmatige vaardigheden;
  • Beschikbaarheid van 32-40 uur per week.


Maar waar zal dit avontuur plaatsvinden?

Kasparov BI is jouw toegangspoort tot de wereld van BI, Data & Analytics. Vanuit ons kantoor in Breda bedienen we meer dan 70 organisaties in verschillende sectoren. Denk aan namen als Tony’s Chocolonely, Boskalis, Smurfit Kappa, Roompot Vakantieparken en Nationale Nederlanden. Je hebt vaak de flexibiliteit om (deels) vanuit huis te werken of vanuit ons kantoor in Breda. Samen bekijken we welke opdracht het beste aansluit bij jouw ambities en persoonlijke ontwikkeling.

Bij Kasparov BI vormen we een hecht team waar kennisdeling tussen collega's centraal staat. We gaan regelmatig gezamenlijk op pad, combineren inhoudelijke evenementen met plezier, rennen samen de Singelloop en genieten zo nu en dan van een gezellige avond bij NAC.


Maar wat staat er tegenover jouw bijdrage aan dit avontuur

  • Een competitief salaris tussen € 4.000, - en € 6.000, - bruto per maand, afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring;
  • 25 vakantiedagen en de mogelijkheid om 5 extra dagen bij te kopen per jaar;
  • 8 tot 10 studiedagen per jaar en de mogelijkheid om je in onze Performance Akademy verder te ontwikkelen (volledig vergoed!);
  • Een leaseauto die je ook privé mag rijden (heb je al een auto, dan ontvang je een mobiliteitsvergoeding van € 450, -);
  • Coaching en begeleiding door een ervaren Managing Consultant BI en een Manager Carrières, gericht op jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling;
  • 6-wekelijkse teamsessies waarin we kennis en ervaringen uitwisselen uit de praktijk;
  • Een telefoonvergoeding en een laptop voor zakelijk gebruik;
  • Wij betalen € 15,- per maand mee aan jouw sportabonnement, want zowel fysieke als mentale gezondheid vinden we belangrijk!
  • De mogelijkheid om je thuiswerkplek in te richten via ons HomeworK pakket, inclusief bureaustoel, beeldscherm en headset.


Dus, ben jij klaar om de volgende stap te zetten in jouw BI-avontuur bij Kasparov BI? Als het antwoord ja is, willen we graag met je in contact komen! Bel Stephanie Neutel, voor meer informatie over het werk als Medior/Senior BI Specialist op 06-48167069. Het avontuur roept!

Title: Associate, Revenue Analytics - EMEA
Description:
Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services, with 283 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.

The Revenue Analytics team provides the company with insights into what drives our past and current revenue and membership trends as well as an outlook on future growth. Internally, our analytical insights help inform our growth and monetization strategy. Our revenue and membership forecasts are critical components that feed into the corporate planning process for spending and resource allocation across content, commerce, and technology.

Netflix is looking for the best and brightest candidates to use data and business insights to inform and drive key strategic decisions. We believe that we derive a significant competitive advantage from the highly analytical approach we take to managing the company. Senior management relies heavily on the Revenue Analytics team to develop a data-driven perspective on the company's growth, and the outcomes of our analyses play a critical role in how we plan for and execute on the company's business objectives.

This role is based out of Netflix’s EMEA headquarters in Amsterdam. The role will include occasional travel to Netflix’s global headquarters in California.

Responsibilities


Support strategic value-added analyses to understand the drivers behind membership and revenue growth in the EMEA markets, derive actionable insights and feedback to collaborative cross-function stakeholders (Content, Partnerships, Ads, Payments, Product, Consumer Insights, Data Science etc.)
Assess and communicate the impact of business decisions such as price changes, content launches, and product innovations to facilitate planning and operational decisions
Analyze and evaluate the business impact of key external events such as competitor moves or country-specific events
Research, track and generate insights about the membership growth landscape
Be a key contributor to in-region pricing decisions, compiling internal and external intelligence to inform price and plan strategy
Collect cross-functional inputs to inform and support the revenue and membership forecasts (acquisition, retention, and market penetration)
Support efforts to centralize and standardize revenue performance reporting, helping identify cross-region best practices to enhance scalability and consistency in business analytics


Qualifications

A successful candidate should have the ability to combine comprehensive data analytics with sound business intuition and judgment, and effectively communicate analytical insights to stakeholders. Given the questions asked of our team are often urgent in nature and have an immediate impact on how the business makes decisions, the individual coming into this role must be able to deliver accurate results promptly. They must thrive in a fast-paced environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, focus on generating results, and exhibit the highest personal and professional standards of integrity and ethics.


3+ years of experience in a quantitative role (e.g. business analytics, management consulting, banking, investment management, etc.)
Bachelor’s degree with an emphasis on quantitative coursework
Proficiency in MS Excel & SQL required
Experience building quantitative models in Excel or other modeling tools
Experience writing complex SQL queries to analyze large data sets
Other coding and technical experience (e.g. VBA, Python, Tableau, etc.) is a plus, but not a prerequisite
Ability to independently extract, explore, and analyze big data from both internal and external sources to guide the analysis of complex issues
Possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, discipline, and flexibility
Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Highly skilled in preparing effective presentations (Google Slides, MS PowerPoint) with a clear narrative and impactful visuals
Team player with strong interpersonal skills and a proven ability to build successful relationships at all levels
Experience and knowledge with various EMEA markets is preferred, but not required

Inclusion is a Netflix value and we strive to host a meaningful interview experience for all candidates. If you want an accommodation/adjustment for a disability or any other reason during the hiring process, please send a request to your recruiting partner.

We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.
Show more

    • Experience building quantitative models in Excel or other modeling tools

    • Other coding and technical experience (e.g. VBA, Python, Tableau, etc.) is a plus, but not a prerequisite
  • Ability to independently extract, explore, and analyze big data from both internal and external sources to guide the analysis of complex issues
  • Possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, discipline, and flexibility
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Highly skilled in preparing effective presentations (Google Slides, MS PowerPoint) with a clear narrative and impactful visuals
  • Team player with strong interpersonal skills and a proven ability to build successful relationships at all levels
  • Experience and knowledge with various EMEA markets is preferred, but not required
Inclusion is a Netflix value and we strive to host a meaningful interview experience for all candidates. If you want an accommodation/adjustment for a disability or any other reason during the hiring process, please send a request to your recruiting partner.

We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst




A great opportunity has opened for a Data Analyst for a leading Financial Services Client of ours in Amsterdam, Netherlands.




Contract Duration: 8+ months (potential extension)

Start date: April (flexible)

Location: Amsterdam, Netherlands

Working Pattern: Hybrid

Hours: 40




What you will do:

As a data/business analyst you will be part of the Captivate scrum team.
Your main objective is the configuration, maintenance, and implementation of solutions in Selligent and Tealium (CDP), that enable our data analysts and marketing teams to make the best and most relevant customer selections.
During one sprint, you might for example work on the enrichment of the Selligent data model; in another sprint you might gather requirements to set up a connector in Tealium that enables a new use case; and in other sprints you might support and train end-users to get the most out the solutions.




We're looking for a Data Analyst with a strong background in:

Experience as a data/business analyst in the database marketing or marketing automation field.
Marketing Automation: Proven experience with Marketing Automation or other Martech solutions. Working experience with Selligent or Tealium (CDP) is a plus.
Data Management: Advanced knowledge of SQL is a must. Experience with a CDP, Databricks or Python is a plus.
Other technical Skills: Knowledge of REST APIs and Git. Knowledge of JavaScript and Web Development is a plus.
Agile Methodology: Experience with Agile Scrum and DevOps practices.
Requirement Gathering: Ability to quickly understand a complex IT landscape, gather requirements, translate them into solutions and user stories, and manage stakeholder interactions.
Problem-solving skills: Ability to troubleshoot and resolve issues related to the SaaS application, it’s code or other issues and queries of end-users.




Ihab Nasheh

Gazelle Global

Tel: +31 85 009 0526

WhatsApp: +44 (0) 7983 597170

ihab@gazellegc.com

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
About Us

Founded in 1999 and listed on NASDAQ in 2003 and HKEX in 2021, Trip.com Group is a leading global travel service provider comprising of Trip.com, Ctrip, Skyscanner, and Qunar.




Across its platforms, Trip.com Group integrates travel resources from industry partners and helps travellers worldwide pursue the perfect trip with exceptional travel products and services.




We have four Customer Service Centres for Trip.com established in Japan, Korea, the UK, and the Philippines, providing 24/7 customer service in 19 different languages.




We have more than 30,000 employees scattered across 30 countries in Asia, Europe, the Americas, and Oceania, striving to expand our global markets and aiming to be the world’s leading and most trusted family of online travel brands that aspire to deliver the perfect trip at the best price for every traveller.




As a Marketing Data Analyst in our Partnerships and Affiliate Marketing team, you will play a critical role in supporting the success of our affiliate programs and partnerships. We are looking for someone who takes initiative, actively seeks out opportunities for improvement, and is eager to contribute to our team’s success.




In this Role, you’ll get to:

Monitor and Analyse Performance: Track key performance indicators (KPIs) across various channels, identifying trends, and communicating to the team any anomalies, and opportunities for optimisation.
Generate Insights for Campaign Optimisation: Assist in analysing data to provide insights that help improve campaign performance, ROI, and overall marketing effectiveness.
Develop and Maintain Dashboards: Contribute to the creation and maintenance of dashboards that provide real-time insights into program performance, making it easy for stakeholders to understand key metrics and trends.
Support Partnership Strategies: Work with business developers and learn about the effectiveness of different partnerships, contributing data-driven recommendations for future collaborations.
Take Initiative in Problem-Solving: Proactively identify issues or opportunities for optimisation and develop strategies that improve overall performance.
Collaborate Internationally: Work alongside marketing teams based in Shanghai and other global locations, ensuring that efforts align with broader marketing strategies and global business goals.
Assist in Conducting Experiments: Support the design and analysis of experiments to test new strategies, creatives, or partnership models, contributing to data-driven decisions.




What you'll Need to Succeed:

Strong Analytical Skills: Ability to interpret data, identify trends, and provide actionable insights.
Communication Skills: Ability to translate data findings into clear, actionable insights for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Basic SQL Knowledge: Familiarity with SQL for querying and managing datasets is preferred, with a willingness to develop these skills further.
Experience with Data Analysis Tools: Strong skills in Excel or Google Sheets, including functions, data manipulation, and pivot tables. Experience with tools like Python, R, or BigQuery is a plus, offering opportunities to engage in more complex data analysis and automation.
Basic Data Visualisation Experience: Familiarity with tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar for creating dashboards and visual reports, with opportunities to develop proficiency.
Interest in Partnerships and Affiliates: A strong curiosity and willingness to learn about affiliate marketing and partnership strategies, and how different factors affect our KPIs.
Proactive, Collaborative, and Solution-Oriented: A self-starter who takes initiative in identifying opportunities for improvement and optimisation. You enjoy developing solutions and contributing to projects, while also working collaboratively with cross-functional teams across different regions to achieve shared goals.




Why Trip.com Group

We offer a stage to unleash your full potential and drive global impact. As an international team, we embrace an open and inclusive culture that supports and respect team members in and out of the workplace. Everyone is on a trip, whether it's a career trip or a life trip. At Trip.com Group, you can define your own trip by setting a goal and celebrate your success by recognizing the progress you have made.

What’s more?




Our rapid business growth in global offers abundant career opportunities at various levels and in multiple functions
Internal transfer is encouraged, and global job rotation program enable you to pursue a global career path and make global impact
We provide learning opportunities to further your career in areas of leadership capability, soft skill and professional expertise.
We encourage flexible work arrangement.
Have fun with company-sponsored greetings and activities at holidays, birthdays, and colorful team events.




Click the link to learn more about What makes Trip.com Group a leading global travel service provider?




Click the link to learn more about This is a Trip Where Both Your Career and Life Can Flourish!




Find out more job opportunities at https://careers.trip.com




Have a good trip, and see you soon!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Logistics at full potential

We are recruiting for a Data Analyst for our Site in Venlo.

Do you love Data crunching and reporting? As a Data Analyst, you will interpret and analyze data using statistical reporting techniques.




You need to have an analytical mindset and an eye for detail with the ability to translate this to visual graphs.




Fluency in English, and Dutch would be beneficial
Strong expertise in Data analysis and reporting
SAP knowledge and extensive usage of Excel are a must
We are open to level experience; however, you must be data savvy and ability to present your findings




What You Do On a Typical Day

As a Data Analyst, we collect and combine datasets from various sources and provide the Site Controller/ Site Engineer/Customer and leadership with real-time data reports.
You derive insights on specific business questions and act upon them commercially
Focus on SAP with a strong connection to engineering
Interpret and analyze data using statistical techniques and analytics tools for frequent reporting to internal and external stakeholders.
Develop and implement data analysis, data analytics, and solutions that support the business needs.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends, patterns, and relationships in (complex) data sets.
Define, articulate, and create solutions that help make data interpretation and relationship identification manageable across many different data sources.
Locate and define continuous improvement opportunities.




What You Need To Succeed At GXO

Ability to work extensively with Excel
SAP knowledge and expertise is a must
Strong communication skills
Minimum requirement Vocational Education in Administration, Finance, or related field, Will accept any combination of education, experience, or training
Being fluent in English, and Dutch is beneficial




What We Offer You

Growth opportunity, this role is an excellent stepping stone to further your career in the future
GXO University
My Benefits discount scheme

Unlock the potential of your future!

Your work environment




Working at GXO Logistics means working in a dynamic and international organization. A fascinating environment with plenty of room for personal input and development. Employees at GXO Logistics are in charge of their own success. Whatever your position at GXO Logistics, you will face new challenges every day, which will enable you to develop optimally. We support you in your development, so that you can contribute to the entrepreneurship of our organisation.




GXO Logistics offers advanced supply chain solutions for the world's most successful companies in many industries, like e-commerce, food & retail and industrial multinationals. In the BeNe region (The Netherlands and Belgium) GXO BeNe operates from +30 different locations with its headquarters in Eindhoven (NL).




Want to know more about GXO Logistics?

Watch the video below or visit our website gxo.com

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3P7NC8gl3bg




In short, this is the next place you want to work!

For more information, please contact Debbie Haywood, Corporate Recruiter, she/her can be reached via email to debbie.haywood@gxo.com.




Interested?

Apply via the button and leave your recent CV

Acquisition in response to this vacancy is not appreciated.




GXO is a leading provider of cutting-edge supply chain solutions to the most successful companies in the world. We help our customers manage their goods most efficiently using our technology and services. Our greatest strength is our global team – energetic, innovative people of all experience levels and talents who make GXO a great place to work.




The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All employees may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed. Review GXO's candidate privacy statement here.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Ben jij een gedreven Data Analist met een passie voor de financiële wereld die graag de cruciale rol heeft in de transformatie van onze opdrachtgevers naar het worden van meer data-driven? Wil je impact hebben door data te vertalen naar waardevolle inzichten en besluitvorming? Dan is deze rol als Data Analist binnen onze organisatie iets voor jou!




Data Analist




Als Data Analist speel je een cruciale rol in de transformatie van onze opdrachtgevers naar data-gedreven organisaties. Je identificeert de informatiebehoeften van de business en vertaalt deze naar relevante data-oplossingen. Met jouw technische expertise verzamel en analyseer je data en zet je deze om in waardevolle inzichten.

In jouw rol ben je verantwoordelijk voor het integreren van klantdata met andere databronnen en het omzetten van deze gegevens in actionable insights. Je ontwikkelt en optimaliseert zowel nieuwe als bestaande dashboards die onze opdrachtgevers ondersteunen. Hierbij identificeer je nieuwe databronnen, valideer je de verzamelde data en presenteer je deze op een overzichtelijke manier. Dankzij jouw analyses en inzichten kunnen onze opdrachtgevers hun proposities en processen verder verbeteren.

Je werkt nauw samen met je eigen team en diverse teams bij onze opdrachtgevers, waarbij je hen ondersteunt en adviseert op zowel tactisch als strategisch niveau.




Wat bieden we jou?




Jouw gedrevenheid binnen Novisource wordt beloond. Wij vinden het belangrijk dat jij je kunt blijven ontwikkelen en kunt doorgroeien. Jij bent daarin altijd in de lead! Naast vakinhoudelijke opleidingen bieden wij ook cursussen en trainingen op het gebied van diverse methodieken en vaardigheden aan. Daarnaast:

Een salarisrange van € 4.500,- tot € 6.500,- bruto per maand (afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring) en een aantrekkelijke bonusregeling
Een persoonlijk opleidingsbudget
Laptop, vaste onkostenvergoeding en telefoonvergoeding
Direct een vast dienstverband
Leaseauto of reiskostenvergoeding
Verbinding is één van onze kernwaarden, we investeren dus gedurende het hele jaar in inhoudelijke, inspirerende en vooral leuke events
Een hybride werk cultuur. We vinden elkaar zeker op ons gezellige kantoor in Amsterdam (vlakbij station Bijlmer Arena), maar stimuleren eigen verantwoordelijkheid en flexibiliteit




Wat neem je mee?




Je bent nieuwsgierig van aard, denkt graag in oplossingen en bent resultaat gedreven. Uiteraard heb je een goed ontwikkeld organisatiebewustzijn en daarnaast neem jij onderstaande mee:

HBO/WO gediplomeerd
Minimaal 4 jaar ervaring binnen de financiële dienstverlening op het gebied van data
Je hebt een sterk analytisch denkvermogen en bent communicatief vaardig
Je hebt eerder gewerkt in een Scrum/Agile omgeving (sterke pré)
Je beheerst de Nederlandse en Engelse taal in woord en geschrift
Aantoonbare ervaring met de financiële sector
Ervaring met het werken binnen multidisciplinaire teams




Over Novisource

Novisource is een kleinschalige, ambitieuze en persoonlijke consultancy-organisatie. We bemiddelen intelligente, gedreven en gepassioneerde consultants die meebouwen aan de (digitale) verandering van morgen. Vooralsnog met name in de financiële sector, maar we werken hard aan uitbreiding van onze klantenportefeuille. We geloven dat onze expertises ook in andere sectoren hard nodig zijn en willen zo meer diversiteit bieden aan onze consultants wat betreft werkomgeving en opdrachten.

Daarnaast zitten we als organisatie zelf ook in een veranderproces, waarin we professionaliseren om de volgende stap te kunnen zetten in kwaliteit, zowel richting onze mensen als richting onze klanten. Houd je van ondernemen, meebouwen, de dynamiek die hoort bij groei en van direct verschil en resultaat zien van het werk dat je doet?

Dan is deze rol geknipt voor jou.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst/BI Developer
Description:
We're looking for a skilled Data Analyst / BI Developer to join our team for a 3-month contract to design and build cutting-edge Power BI dashboards for the Deepturn product.




The newly created insights will help stakeholders to understand and improve their process performance based on a set of KPIs related to the turnaround process.




Key Responsibilities:

Transform complex raw back-end data into clean, usable datasets for Power BI.
Design and model tables and relationships for an efficient and logical data structure.
Write powerful DAX measures and calculations to bring your data visualizations to life.
Ensure your dashboards meet user needs with thoughtful functionality and structure.
Apply the best data visualizations to communicate insights and drive better decision-making.
Optimize Power BI performance while handling large datasets with ease.




What We Need from You:

3+ years experience in SQL and Python for data processing and transformation.
3+ years experience with Power BI, including solid expertise in DAX and data modeling.
Proven track record of designing intuitive, interactive dashboards.
Experience in translating business requirements into actionable data insights.
A proactive, independent mindset and ability to work collaboratively within a team.




This is your chance to make a real impact while enhancing your skillset in a fast-paced, high-impact project. Ready to bring your data expertise to the next level?




Apply now and take the next step in your Data Analyst / BI Developer career!

Show more
HTML:
We're looking for a skilled Data Analyst / BI Developer to join our team for a 3-month contract to design and build cutting-edge Power BI dashboards for the Deepturn product.


The newly created insights will help stakeholders to understand and improve their process performance based on a set of KPIs related to the turnaround process.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Transform complex raw back-end data into clean, usable datasets for Power BI.
  • Design and model tables and relationships for an efficient and logical data structure.
  • Write powerful DAX measures and calculations to bring your data visualizations to life.
  • Ensure your dashboards meet user needs with thoughtful functionality and structure.
  • Apply the best data visualizations to communicate insights and drive better decision-making.
  • Optimize Power BI performance while handling large datasets with ease.


What We Need from You:

  • 3+ years experience in SQL and Python for data processing and transformation.
  • 3+ years experience with Power BI, including solid expertise in DAX and data modeling.
  • Proven track record of designing intuitive, interactive dashboards.
  • Experience in translating business requirements into actionable data insights.
  • A proactive, independent mindset and ability to work collaboratively within a team.


This is your chance to make a real impact while enhancing your skillset in a fast-paced, high-impact project. Ready to bring your data expertise to the next level?


Apply now and take the next step in your Data Analyst / BI Developer career!

Title: Data Analyst (Marketing)
Description:
TicketSwap is on a mission to become the world’s favorite marketplace to safely buy and sell tickets. With over 15 million fans across 36 countries, we’re building a platform that fans love and trust. As we expand and innovate, we’re tackling exciting challenges – from enhancing our fan experience to scaling our platform globally.

Driven by our passion for technology and live events, we are always looking for talented, data-driven individuals to help us shape the future of fan experiences. At TicketSwap, our fans are at the heart of everything we do, and we’re on the hunt for a data-savvy, organized, and proactive Data Analyst to support mainly our Performance Marketing and CRM efforts.

Are you ready to help elevate TicketSwap as the go-to destination for fans worldwide? Read on to find out more! 👇

Full-time


Amsterdam



What You Can Expect From The Work

Based in Amsterdam working from our HQ, you will:


Analyze the performance of paid campaigns across channels like Google Ads, Meta, Tiktok, Snapchat and more.
Measure and optimize the ROI of online and offline advertising initiatives.
Monitor and report on budget allocation, campaign performance, and ad effectiveness.



CRM And Retention Insights


Collaborate with the CRM team to analyze customer segmentation, retention strategies, and engagement patterns.
Identify data-driven opportunities to improve customer activation and retention across all stages of the lifecycle.



Cross-Team Collaboration


Work closely with marketing, analytics, and product teams to understand business needs and translate them into actionable insights.
Help prioritize and execute growth initiatives using data-backed recommendations.



KPI Reporting & Dashboards


Develop and maintain dashboards to track critical metrics, including conversion rates, customer acquisition costs, and website/app traffic.
Regularly report on marketing and CRM KPIs to guide strategy and execution.



About You


You are based in The Netherlands, are an EU resident, or have an existing visa to work here. A relocation package is not provided.



Educational Background


A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.



Professional Experience


2/3 years of experience in marketing, business, or product analytics, ideally in a fast-paced environment, marketplace experience is a huge plus.
Hands-on experience with analytics tools, including SQL and large datasets.
Hands-on experience with DBT or equivalent tool for data transformation



Technical Skills


Proficiency in data visualization tools like Looker, Power BI, Tableau, or Data Studio.
Knowledge of statistical and data modeling tools (Python is a strong plus).
Hands on experience with multi touch attribution models (Nice to have).



Marketing Knowledge


Familiarity with CRM data analysis and customer journey optimization.
Experience with ad platforms like Facebook Business Manager, Google Ads, or DV360.
Knowledge of CDPs or DMPs (e.g., Segment, Rudderstack) is an advantage.



Soft Skills


Exceptional attention to detail and problem-solving abilities.
Proven ability to work independently and proactively engage stakeholders.
Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.



Excited and ready to join our team?

TicketSwap is looking for the best and motivated talent out there no matter your nationality, gender, sexual preference or religious beliefs. 🚀

Research shows that women and those in traditionally underrepresented groups tend to apply only if they check all the boxes. That’s a shame, as we want to build a diverse and inclusive team. If you know you’ve got what it takes but don’t quite meet every requirement for the role, we still encourage you to apply.

Apply now – we'll take a look and get back to you as soon as possible! 💥

Proactive acquisition from 3rd parties is not appreciated.

Title: Data Analyst – Advertising
Description:
How do you delight our customers?

Bol is always advancing its platform to create a better tomorrow for over 13 million customers and 49,000 trading partners. Our advertising propositions help shoppers discover products and advertisers reach customers – this is where you’ll make a difference. You’ll use data to help our advertising customers inform decisions, frame conversations, and change perceptions. And you’ll ensure it’s used effectively and responsibly.

The biggest challenge

Advertising via Bol is growing fast and is becoming an increasingly important channel for our advertising customers. Their need for data and insights are no exception. They rely on us to provide them with meaningful metrics, insightful analyses, and reliable predictive models to keep investing effectively

What You’ll Do As a Data Analyst

You’ll join 15 analysts in Bol’s advertising analytics organization. Together you share a mission of making people performant through analytics. This role is for the versatile analyst who is equally comfortable working with data as engaging with stakeholders. You’ll work with stakeholders to identify high value use cases for analytics, use SQL, Python, Dbt, and Tableau to then create metrics, do analysis across petabytes of data, make meaningful predictions, to eventually help advertising customers make better decisions. Your work will be input for amongst others client meetings, white papers, webinars, and public industry appearances.


You work closely with internal stakeholders (Sales, Customer Success, and Marketing) and top advertising and agency customers to identify high value applications of analytics.
You’re curious and develop deep domain knowledge to create meaningful language around our data and insights for our customers.
You prioritize, design, and perform analysis and/or dashboards.
You deliver insights and predictions through engaging dashboards and presentations.
You develop extensive domain knowledge to effectively manage and analyse advertising KPIs.
You write high quality and easily interpretable SQL and Python code that can be reused by colleagues and scales easily as data volumes increase.


3 reasons why this is (not) for you Switch to find out


If you strongly value clarity No, if innovating, autonomy, and ambiguity sound terrifying to you.
You only want to process data No, if you only want to process data and prefer someone else to handle project and stakeholder management.
If you believe analysts don’t need domain knowledge No, if you don't want to dive into the world of advertising. Curiosity and willingness to learn about our domain and customers are key to your success.
You’re an analytics professional Yes, if you have 5+ year experience delighting decision makers with your analytical skills. SQL is a must, Python scripting is a strong plus.
Obsess over building the right things Yes, if you believe output does not equal outcome and judge success by value creation.
You get (and create) energy by working with others Yes, if you can translate technical information into language anyone can understand. You enjoy working with both data and people.


It is our responsibility to enable an environment that unleashes the power of diversity.
Show more

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Data Analist




Maak impact met data in de publieke sector! Wil jij met jouw analytische vaardigheden bijdragen aan betere zorg, onderwijs en overheidsdiensten? Bij Van Dam Datapartners zoeken we een Data Analist die data omzet in heldere inzichten en concrete adviezen.




Wat ga je doen?




Analyseren & inzicht bieden: je onderzoekt datasets van gemeenten, zorginstellingen en andere publieke organisaties om maatschappelijke trends en knelpunten te signaleren.
Datavisualisatie & rapportages: je bouwt dashboards en rapportages in tools zoals Power BI, Tableau, Qlik of Cognos, zodat besluitvormers direct aan de slag kunnen met jouw inzichten.
Adviseren & presenteren: je vertaalt data naar duidelijke en overtuigende adviezen en presenteert deze aan opdrachtgevers.
Samenwerken & verbeteren: je werkt in een dynamisch team, waarbij je samen met Data Engineers en BI-specialisten slimme data-oplossingen ontwikkelt.




Wie ben jij?

Minimaal 1 jaar ervaring binnen het publieke domein.
Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring met het analyseren van data.
Kennis van datavisualisatie, statistiek en SQL.
Goede communicatieve vaardigheden: je kunt complexe analyses eenvoudig uitleggen.
Je houdt van een uitdaging en voelt je thuis in een dynamische commerciële omgeving.
Je bent proactief en neemt het initiatief om met klanten in gesprek te gaan, zowel op inhoud als op de relatie. Je signaleert kansen en zoekt samen naar de beste oplossingen.




Wat bieden wij jou?

Je komt te werken bij een ambitieuze organisatie, waar je samen met een enthousiast team werkt aan projecten die ertoe doen.




Een marktconform salaris (€ 3.750 – €5.500 bruto per maand op basis van 40 uur per week), afhankelijk van jouw werkervaring;
8% vakantiegeld;
NS-Business Card of reiskostenvergoeding (€ 0,23 per km);
Een laptop en telefoon;
25 vakantiedagen;
De mogelijkheid om (maximaal 5) dagen bij te kopen of te verkopen;
Pensioenregeling bij Nationale Nederlanden;
Een thuiswerkvergoeding van € 2,40 per dag en de mogelijkheid om een thuiswerkplek in te richten;
Toegang tot de Academy en de mogelijkheid om een persoonlijk opleidingsprogramma samen te stellen.




Heb je nog vragen, dan mag je altijd contact met ons opnemen via werkenbij@vandamdatapartners.nl.

Show more

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Gezocht: Senior Data / Business Analist | Utrecht | Salaris tot € 90K




Tech: Azure | Data Vault | SQL | Python




Voor een toonaangevende organisatie in financiële producten, zoals verzekeringen, pensioenen en hypotheken, zijn we op zoek naar een ervaren Senior Data- Business Analist. Deze marktleider, die bekend staat om zijn sterke focus op duurzaamheid, bevindt zich momenteel in een complexe migratieperiode na de overname van een grote concurrent.




Als Senior Data- Business Analist maak je deel uit van het data-klantcontactteam, waar je verantwoordelijk bent voor het ophalen van business requirements en het vertalen hiervan naar Features/EPICS en User Stories. Je zorgt voor de automatisering van bedrijfsprocessen en bent op de hoogte van de lopende processen aan zowel de data engineering- als de businesskant.




Wij zoeken een kandidaat met:

Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring als Business Analist.
Meerdere jaren ervaring in een rol als data engineering of data-analyse met tools als SQL, Python, Data Vault en PowerBI
Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in het Nederlands.
Ervaring met SCRUM/Agile werken.




We komen graag met je in contact als je het leuk vindt om vanuit een technische data-achtergrond bedrijfsprocessen te verbeteren en de spin in het web te zijn tussen Data Engineers en Business Stakeholders. Solliciteer via nielsv@doghouse-recruitment.nl of via de "Nu solliciteren" button.




Salaris: Tot € 90K

Locatie: Utrecht (hybride)

Title: Data Analyst - Freelance - 4+ months - Amsterdam
Description:
A Data Analyst is invited to join the team at an international company in Amsterdam on a freelance assignment.



About the role:
Data Analysts are the drivers for analytics tasks such as reporting, visualization and analysis needs within their area. They have a high level understanding of the business problems in their area and collaborate closely with the business stakeholders to solve them through application of data analytics. They use their experience and consultation with stakeholders in problem-definition, setting success metrics and shaping the way forward through data insights and effective communication with their audience.

Responsible for owning the design and delivery of entire Data Analytics solutions based on business requirements, bringing them from the initial idea-generation phase to implementation independently.

Responsible for working autonomously on consuming data, preparing it for analytical use, translating business problems to data stories and leveraging input from business stakeholders to determine the right technical solutions to deliver customer value.

Responsible for working primarily within the scope of their team to deliver work that informs business decisions for a product / business topic in the area they work in, occasionally collaborating across multiple teams.
Responsible for being flexible in adopting existing internal and external Data Analytics approaches, proposing and spotting opportunities to apply new approaches and expanding their technical competencies and their peer's when a more efficient way presents itself.
Responsible for leveraging Data Analytics for impact while learning to incorporate scalability, reproducibility and long term orientation in their work.
Responsible for collaborating with peers in related crafts (ie.Data Engineering), anticipating data needs to ensure smooth progress of their individual projects.

Technical requirements: PySpark, SQL, Tableau, BigData exposure
Good to have: Snowflake, AWS, Airflow

Practical info:
Duration - 4+ months project
competitive rate: €70-75 hourly
hybrid: 2-3 days on site in Amsterdam,
40hours/week

Start date : 1 April 2025

Please apply via the form below!
NOTE: you must be located and registered in NL

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Vacancy: Senior Data Analyst




Tech: Azure | Python | SQL | PowerBI | Data modelling




For a giant in financial products such as insurance, pensions and mortgages we are looking for highly experienced Data Analysts. This leading company which acquired one of their biggest competitors is in the middle of a huge migration.




In the centralized digital and IT team you will, together with your team, be the bridge between multiple business teams and the data engineering team. To do so, you will oversee developing a new data environment in the Azure stack!




We are looking for someone with:

At least four years of experience as a data analyst;
Experience with Python and SQL (building databases);
Excellent communication skills.




It’s a big plus if you already have experience with Azure Cloud.




Responsibilities:

Gathering and analyzing data to advise colleagues;
Developing of a new data environment to promote a data driven approach;
Proactively looking for improvements for the data environment.




So, if talking to the business in combination with developing data solutions makes you happy? Then apply!




Nielsv@doghouse-recruitment.nl




Salary: up to 85K

Location: Utrecht (Hybrid)
