Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
About the Job




Want to be part of building the future of Sales for companies everywhere? Where AI Meets Human Communication!

Our client is spearheading a revolution in Sales by empowering sales agents to excel through automated personalized coaching powered by advanced AI technology.

They are on a mission to shape the future of sales for businesses globally, and are looking for talented individuals to join their amazing team of machine learning engineers, data scientists, software developers, designers, and more in their Stockholm office.

The company is transforming sales professionals' lives worldwide—building more connected and efficient teams at the intersection of behavioural science and automation.

The state-of-the-art AI technology is redefining how sales professionals learn to communicate with confidence and precision in every interaction. Monitoring everything down to the customer’s tone of voice, picking up buying signals and offering live advice to agents and managers.

The team previously built and held leadership roles at industry champions like Tink, Spotify, Shopify, Zettle by PayPal, Sana and EF. We’re now building a new category leader in AI, solving an age-old, trillion-dollar problem for businesses globally.

They are located in Stockholm, Sweden, and are backed by a global group of prominent and heavy-hitting tech entrepreneurs and investors.




Role and Challenges 🚀




Design and develop machine learning models to extract insights, predict sales outcomes, and optimize coaching recommendations.
Work with large-scale data sets, ensuring data integrity, feature engineering, and pre-processing pipelines.
Collaborate closely with software engineers and product managers to integrate AI-driven solutions into our core platform.
Deploy and optimize models in production, ensuring efficiency, scalability, and reliability.
Analyse model performance, troubleshoot issues, and iterate on improvements to maximize impact.
Contribute to research and development efforts to push the boundaries of AI in sales automation.
Stay current with industry trends in AI, data science, and machine learning, proposing innovative solutions to enhance our product offerings.




What We're Looking For 🤩




Proven experience as a Data Scientist or Machine Learning Engineer, with expertise in AI-driven applications.
Strong proficiency in Python and relevant libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, Pandas, NumPy).
Hands-on experience with cloud platforms such as AWS and/or GCP for deploying and managing ML models.
Experience in handling and analysing large datasets, developing data pipelines, and implementing feature engineering techniques.
Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate business challenges into data-driven solutions.
Familiarity with NLP, time-series forecasting, or recommender systems is a plus.
Experience in mentoring junior data scientists or leading projects is highly desirable.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively in a cross-functional team.
A proactive, self-driven mindset with a passion for continuous learning and improvement.




What’s On Offer? 👀




Competitive salary & equity package
Mobile phone reimbursement
Six weeks annual paid vacation
Wellness budget
Learning & development budget




This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We are currently looking for a assisting an exciting Prop-tech scale up with the hiring of an experience data engineer with a background in AWS.




Our client is currently on a journey to revolutionise how home owners can use data and information from their own home to become more efficient. The goal is to expose areas in houses were energy use is higher and using AI help the owner create solutions to help.




Requirements:




5 Years of Software development experience - Data Focused
Highly experience in AWS
Experience within DevOps / CI/CD
Need to be Swedish Speaking and working in Stockholm




You will be joining a smaller organisation where you will have a unique opportunity to have your voice heard. Later down the line their aim is to build a larger team around this, therefore this role is ideal for senior candidates who aspire to one day become tech leads.




We offer:




We offer a great work environment with an exciting work culture that puts flexibility first. Our unique space in Stockholm has been creative created with developers in mind to promote knowledge sharing, collaboration and social atmosphere.







Benefits Offered:

30 days holiday
ITP1 Pension
Education allowance
Wellness allowance




Unfortunately this opportunity cannot offer any form of VISA sponsorship and you need to speak Swedish.




If this role could be of interest to you feel free to get in touch

Title: Consumer Analytics
Description:
About The Role

At Instabee, the consumer is at the core of everything we do, and you will play a key role in understanding and enhancing the consumer experience. Your insights will shape how we approach consumer growth, loyalty, and feedback, ensuring we continuously improve our services.

As a champion for the consumer, you’ll work closely with teams across the company to define and measure success. This role calls for a mix of analytical expertise, business acumen, and a deep curiosity about consumer behavior.

You won’t just report on data; you will help drive smarter decisions that shape the consumer journey and improve how we serve millions of users.

What you’ll be doing


Analyze consumer behavior and engagement to uncover insights and trends.
Develop and maintain KPIs related to consumer growth and experience.
Work with large datasets to find opportunities to improve acquisition, retention, and conversion.
Collaborate with Product, Tech, and Operations to test and launch consumer-facing initiatives.
Translate data into clear recommendations that enhance the customer journey.
Challenge how we do things today and explore new ways to understand and improve the consumer experience.
Support A/B testing and measure the impact of new strategies.
Present findings and actionable insights to stakeholders at various levels of the organization.


About You


You’re passionate about creating great consumer experiences and curious about what drives people’s behavior.
You possess a unique blend of analytical expertise and business acumen, enabling you to translate complex data into actionable strategies that drive real impact.
You thrive on testing and pioneering new approaches, pushing the boundaries of traditional consumer analytics.
You are not afraid to develop and implement novel tools and technologies to uncover deeper insights and solve challenging problems.
You are comfortable challenging the status quo, constantly seeking innovative ways to measure and improve the consumer journey.


What We’re Looking For


A Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., engineering, IT, finance, economics, marketing, psychology).
2+ years of experience working with consumer data, such as segmentation, feedback, or behavior analysis.
Hands-on experience working with data tools like SQL, Python, Tableau, PowerBI, or similar.
Comfortable working with large datasets and performing data analysis.
Solid understanding of A/B testing and statistical methods.
Strong business sense and ability to translate data into actionable insights.
Experience collaborating across departments (e.g., tech, product, marketing).
Experience presenting findings to senior stakeholders.
Excellent communication skills in English.


If this is you then we can’t wait to meet you!

What you’ll get

We can promise you that you will be challenged, develop your skills and have the opportunity to work with truly amazing and competent colleagues. If you like changes and want to set new processes and ways of working - this is the place for you!

Benefits

Of course, we have all the necessary and standard benefits in place, but in addition to this, we can also offer:


🌇 Sky-High Office: Modern and newly renovated with a 360-degree view around Stockholm.
🐶 Puppy Friendly: Bring your dog to work - we've got a whole floor for our furry friends!
🍸 Rooftop Fridays: Chill out at our Friday rooftop bar with the best views in town
🏓 Fun & Games: Ping pong, Shuffleboard, Foosball, and even a Karaoke Room for your leisure time.
👶 Parental Pay for Six Months: Step away from work and provide the best care and love to your little one.
🎂 A Day Off on Your Birthday: We love to celebrate, so enjoy your birthday to the fullest with a day off each year!m for your leisure time.
⏰ Flexible Hours: Hybrid setup with working hours that adapt to your lifestyle.


Diversity and inclusion is very important to us and we are committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We want to be a workplace where everyone’s perspectives and opinions are valued, and we are dedicated to creating opportunities for all employees to thrive and reach their full potential.

Get to know us

In 2022, Instabee was founded after combining Budbee and Instabox - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox, and Porterbuddy. Instabee serves millions of consumers across Europe with convenient deliveries and is on track to become the leading European e-commerce enabler. Always with the consumer at heart.

We’re fast, both in terms of parcel delivery and when it comes to growing our business. So far our journey has taken us from Sweden to the rest of Scandinavia and parts of continental Europe, but we have no plans on stopping anytime soon. As we continue to expand, the complexity of Instabee grows in parallel. With that in mind, we’re now looking for you to help us on the journey ahead.

This recruitment process consists of background checks via Verifiera as a review of previous public criminal records. The result is public information that is handled confidentially. This is mandatory for all recruitment processes at Instabee in Sweden.

Instabee was founded in 2022 after combining Budbee and Instabox — two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox and Porterbuddy. Instabee is present in six countries, serving thousands of online merchants, including ASOS, Zalando, Inditex and H&M and is on track to become the most admired European e-commerce enabler.

Since the start, Instabee has focused on consumer-centric and sustainable solutions, offering deliveries to boxes and homes using muscle power, electricity, renewable diesel and biofuels. Through bespoke technical solutions, Instabee can guarantee optimal fill rates and routing, minimising any unnecessary transports. Instabee is backed by Kinnevik, Creades and EQT, among others.

Title: Impact Analyzer
Description:
At Nissan, we're not just building cars, we're revolutionizing mobility. We believe that every individual possesses a unique set of skills and passions that can be harnessed to drive innovation and shape the future of the automotive industry. Our global impact is fuelled by a force of over 160,000 dedicated minds, crafting and delivering innovation since 1933. For over 90 years, our core belief in doing what others don't has driven innovation and excitement for our customers, shaping Nissan into the business it is today. We are not just a company - we're a movement, pushing boundaries and embracing the spirit of "Defy Ordinary".

We are now looking for an Impact Analyser to join our newly created RBU. In this role, you will join the Analytics & Innovation team and report to the Analytics & Innovation Director.

How you can contribute and have an impact?


Follow and measure the impact of the incubators work and ensure the sustainability aspect within the projects and activities and to record/share learnings.
Impact Measurement: Develop and implement metrics and methodologies to measure the impact of incubator projects and activities.
Sustainability Assurance: Ensure that all projects and activities within the incubator are designed and executed with sustainability in mind.
Data Collection and Analysis: Collect, analyze, and interpret data to assess the effectiveness and sustainability of incubator initiatives.
Reporting: Prepare detailed reports on the impact and sustainability of projects, providing insights and recommendations for improvement.
Knowledge Sharing: Record and share learnings from incubator projects with internal teams and external stakeholders to promote best practices and continuous improvement.
Stakeholder Engagement: Work closely with project teams, mentors, and external partners to gather feedback and ensure alignment with sustainability goals.
Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for enhancing the impact and sustainability of incubator activities and implement necessary changes.


What we look for:


Proven experience in impact measurement, sustainability management, or a related role.
Bachelor's degree in Business, Sustainability, Innovation Management, or a related field. A Master's degree is preferred.
Fluency in English, other local languages are considered as an advantage.
Business viability mindset.
New business model experience
Customer journey understanding.
Lifecycle management.
New business model design, Pricing, Market sizing.
Workshop animation.
Strong analytical, project management, and communication skills.
Ability to work with diverse stakeholders and drive continuous improvement.
Detail-oriented, proactive, and passionate about sustainability and innovation.


Nissan believes the power comes from the inside, the diversity and well-being of its employees is key to success. People are our most valuable assets, and diversity and inclusion are the key to maximizing the power of each individual member of our team. Nissan is committed to be a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive company that empowers everyone to bring their best, most authentic selves to work. Respecting each person, their opinions and value is when we can drive innovations that make a difference.

Our future vision and ambition is "Together We Empower Mobility and Beyond" for a cleaner, safer and more inclusive world.

Amsterdam Netherlands


Show more

Nissan believes the power comes from the inside, the diversity and well-being of its employees is key to success. People are our most valuable assets, and diversity and inclusion are the key to maximizing the power of each individual member of our team. Nissan is committed to be a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive company that empowers everyone to bring their best, most authentic selves to work. Respecting each person, their opinions and value is when we can drive innovations that make a difference.

Our future vision and ambition is "Together We Empower Mobility and Beyond" for a cleaner, safer and more inclusive world.

Amsterdam Netherlands

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Trustly is leading the human-centric payments revolution. To us, this means passionately building the most convenient, intelligent and responsible way of paying for things online. Whether it’s for shopping, paying subscriptions, funding trading accounts, booking airfare, playing online games and much more – we’re all about a better way to pay. At our core, we are a tech company with industry-leading tech capabilities. But, it’s the ingenuity of our people that makes us leaders in our field. Thus, our appetite for innovation will never be anything less than fierce. Trustly is steadily growing as it connects thousands of businesses with hundreds of millions of people. And with a strong presence across Europe and the Americas, we are leading the human-centric payment revolution as a truly global team.




About the Data & Insights team

The Data & Insights team’s mission is to transform Trustly into a truly data-driven organization. We are responsible for every aspect of the data journey, from collection & modeling to analysis and visualization. We provide the whole organization with analytics artifacts aiming to improve our decisions, operations and the customer’s experience.

About the role

As a Senior Data Analyst at Trustly, you will look at the breadth of our data with a statistical mindset. Through your analytics skills and proficiency in handling data, you will uncover patterns and provide data-driven answers to complex strategic challenges. Depending on the stakeholder’s requests, you will choose adequate solutions to present your insights, ranging from dashboards in our BI tool to deep-dive analysis. In close collaboration with our data foundation team, you will be involved in building a strong and reliable data foundation that will support the analytics needs.




What you’ll do
Taking ownership of entire analytical projects, from defining objectives with our business stakeholders to delivering actionable insights and recommendations
Perform in-depth data analysis to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that drive business growth and efficiency
Choose adequate analytical methods and tools to convey complex findings in a clear and concise manner
Continuously contribute to improve our Analytics capabilities 
Actively participate in establishing the data-driven culture at Trustly





Who you are
A Master's degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics or similar field
At least 3 years of experience within the analytics field, experience with the payments industry is a plus
Having a high degree of autonomy and being able to work independently on complex analyses
Solid and broad analytical skills-set including the ability to use statistical methods
Solid SQL and Python skills
Experience working with BI tools such as QlikSense or Tableau
Excellent communication skills 
Thrive in in a fast growing company








Are you someone who voices new ideas and acts on them? Do you value great communication with all stakeholders? We are looking to strengthen the team with dedicated, highly motivated people who thrive in working with different areas across the organisation.

If you feel that your skill set and personality compliments the criteria above, apply now and kindly submit your CV in English.

Title: Analytics Specialist
Description:
📍Sthlm/Gbg/Cph/Ldn/Italy 📆 As soon as possible

👩🏽‍💻 Office: 3 Days a Week 📚 Our Recruitment Process

At Precis, we are a group of friendly experts in media buying, analytics & marketing science, creative and technology with a joint mission to help great companies thrive in the digital landscape.

Are you curious to learn more about us? You can meet some of our coworkers and read about our departments here. For insights into how is life at Precis and a peek at the perks of working with us, visit this page. In our Handbook, you can get a neat summary of who we are, our culture and our offices.

We’re looking for an Analytics Specialist to join our team at Precis, working with clients in finance and healthcare - industries that offer exciting and complex analytics challenges.

At Precis, we transform data into value, ensuring our clients have the insights they need for growth while prioritizing user privacy and ethical solutions. You’ll work directly with clients, solve analytics challenges, implement technical solutions, and contribute to commercial processes - all with a focus on data governance and compliance.

What You Will Be Doing


Tagging and analytics implementations.
Leading complex collaborations and driving your clients’ analytics roadmap.
Exploring new ways to support clients in regulated industries and drive value out of compliant data.
Delivering actionable insights and supporting your clients’ profitability with data and analytics strategy.
Building dashboards and reports.
Ensuring the best data quality for clients and recommending improvements.
Continuously learning and mastering the latest technologies and techniques in our industry.


What We Are Looking For


2+ years of work experience with Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager.
An understanding of data strategy and digital marketing.
Experience in data analysis and building insights out of extensive data sets.
An interest in privacy, data protection and data governance.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.
Previous studies in topics related to data, tech, analytics or business.
A friendly personality with good collaboration skills, plenty of ambitions, and a desire to become a real expert in digital marketing.
[Preffered] Knowledge of SQL and programming languages such as Python or JavaScript.


What We Offer

You can read our full offering in our handbook.


An intense learning environment where you will be able to grow and develop your skills and passions alongside some of the brightest minds in the industry.
A culture that is built on collaboration, trust and innovation. We value having fun together - that’s why we also have regular afterworks, team events and a yearly festival.
Transparent salary setting - you can find all our salary bands in our handbook. This role is an L2 role within the Analytics column. Check it out!
30 days paid leave, flexible public holidays, parental pay, a solid pension scheme and key insurance. Our different offices also offer different perks such as massage, health care contributions, free book orders, healthy snacks & great coffee, EAP programs and your choice of PC or Mac.
A diverse environment with a high focus on inclusion and belonging. We speak over 27 native languages around Precis and our internal inclusion score is 4.3 out of 5.


We are committed to building an inclusive and fair workplace that attracts talent and advances its people, regardless of their background, experiences or perspectives. We believe that a diverse set of minds will continue to contribute to our innovative culture and our ability to reinvent ourselves constantly.

We update all candidates on their application by email. If you don't receive an email from us, please check your spam folder.

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
About Kambi

Kambi Group plc is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed gaming operators. Our services provide an end-to-end solution for operators wanting to launch a standalone Sportsbook or bolster their existing offering with an innovative sports betting product. From front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling, all built on our in-house developed software, we strive to deliver the ultimate service and solution to our partners.

Our vision is to create the world’s leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.

Kambi are looking for a highly motivated and experienced self-starter to join our quantitative analysis team in central Stockholm. For the right candidate, the position will provide the opportunity to research and develop cutting-edge algorithmic solutions to support our B2B Sportsbook operations. You will take a leading role in cross-functional teams, building complete trading and risk solutions, and where your main responsibility will be to develop and maintain risk and sport models. You will report to the Head of Quantitative Analytics.

Main responsibilities:



Support and work in close collaboration with trading, risk and other areas of the business by providing algorithmic solutions
Responsible for the end-to-end process of algorithm development, from inception to deployment as well as maintenance
Analysis and interpretation of data to produce meaningful information, in particular changes in patterns and trends
Communicate results and ideas to stakeholders



Skills and experience:



An academic degree in a quantitative discipline (computer science, mathematics, physics, etc.)
Previous experience in a similar role designing predictive models for real-world business problems
Advanced knowledge of stochastic processes, mathematical methods and probability theory
Proficiency with C/C++ and Python, in particular having worked in software teams (git) is a plus
Experience using statistical and query computer languages (R/SQL) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Experience with cloud computing (AWS) is a plus
Familiarity with Apache Spark is a plus.
Skills in object-oriented programming is a plus



The successful candidate has:



Creative and experimental mindset to data mining
Strong problem-solving skills with an emphasis on product development
A drive to promote innovative algorithmic solutions and data driven decision-making
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate to both business and technical minded colleagues
Ability to handle multiple tasks and priorities



What's in it for you?



Opportunity to work in a fast-growing industry
A role within a highly ambitious team
Support for personal development
A fun and flexible working culture



We are curious about your story, if you are interested in meeting us please apply with your CV.

#wearekambi

Kambi's ongoing commitment to Diversity and Inclusion in the workplace

If you require any reasonable adjustment during the recruitment process, please notify your recruiter, who will assist you however they can. Diversity and inclusion is at the heart of who we are and who we aim to be. While we are proud of the positive and inclusive company culture we have created, we know we can do so much more. Kambi constantly evolves its Diversity and Inclusion strategy to ensure it becomes an even more inclusive and positive place to work, with the core management team reaffirming its commitment to delivering on employee feedback.

Creating an inclusive environment

We believe Kambi's greatest strength is the collective talent of our employees. Kambi is committed to ensuring we create an inclusive work environment where everyone can feel valued, thrive and achieve their potential, regardless of who they are or what their background is. We know that it is only by having a balance of different voices, values and opinions that Kambi is able to be the market leader it is today.

#wearekambi

Title: Salesforce Technical Lead
Description:
Job Title: Salesforce Technical Lead (Contract)

Location: Stockholm, Sweden (Hybrid)

Contract Length: 12 months (Contract-to-Hire)

Start Date: 31st March 2025

Rate: DOE




My customer in the Financial Services industry is seeking an experienced Salesforce Technical Lead to join their team on an initial 12 months contract to go permanent. You will play a key role in customizing and developing the Salesforce platform to meet business requirements, ensuring optimal integration with other systems, and working on the early phases of a major implementation project.




As part of a cross-functional team, you will collaborate closely with business stakeholders, product owners, and technical leads to drive innovation and efficiency in our Salesforce environment.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and customize the Salesforce platform to align with business needs.
Optimize Salesforce integrations with external systems using REST/SOAP APIs.
Work on data modeling to ensure efficient storage and access.
Collaborate with stakeholders to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
Participate in strategic technology decisions to ensure scalability and efficiency.




Your Experience:

At least 5+ years of experience in Salesforce platform development.
Salesforce certifications.
Strong experience integrating external systems, preferably using REST/SOAP APIs.
Data modeling expertise for efficient storage and access.
Fluent in Swedish (both verbal and written).




Good to haves:

Experience with Financial Services Cloud (FSC).
Previous experience in the insurance industry.







This is a Contract-to-hire opportunity, transitioning to a permanent role after 12 months.




Please reach out to Daniel Indranathan if interested.

Title: ESG Analyst
Description:
Explore exciting opportunities for professional growth and development in the ESG domain, and make a meaningful impact in sustainable investing with our dynamic team!




ESG ANALYST

Permian is a leading fund administration firm dedicated to providing comprehensive services to private equity investing firms and fund managers.




Role Overview:

Permian is seeking a motivated and detail-oriented ESG Analyst to join our growing ESG team. This role offers an exciting opportunity to contribute to ESG services, supporting data management, reporting, and operational processes while learning from teamwork with senior ESG experts.




Key responsibilities:

Assist in ESG data collection, validation, and reporting for clients, ensuring accuracy and compliance with regulatory frameworks (SFDR, CSRD, EU Taxonomy).
Support the implementation and maintenance of ESG reporting tools and software systems.
Collaborate with senior ESG specialists on ESG service delivery, including product development, client presentations, and data analysis.
Conduct research on ESG trends, regulatory updates, and best practices to keep Permian’s services current.
Develop and maintain ESG-related documentation, including reporting templates, KPIs, and client materials.




Qualifications:

A degree in Sustainability, Environmental Science, Finance, Business Administration, or a related field.
1-3 years of experience in ESG, sustainability, data analysis, or related roles.
Familiarity with ESG regulations and reporting standards is a plus.
Proficiency in Excel, PowerPoint, and ideally but not a must in ESG reporting tools or platforms.
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
Proactive mindset with a willingness to learn and grow in the ESG space.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple tasks.




Why join us?

Be a cornerstone of our ESG services and supporting sustainable investment practices for top-tier private equity firms.
Collaborate with a supportive and innovative team dedicated to excellence.
Opportunity for professional growth and development in the ESG domain.




Applications will be reviewed continuously as they are received. We look forward to your application!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Company Description

We are a consulting company with a bunch of technology-interested and happy people!

We love technology, we love design and we love quality. Our diversity makes us unique and creates an inclusive and welcoming workplace where each individual is highly valued.

With us, each individual is her/himself and respects others for who they are and we believe that when a fantastic mix of people gather and share their knowledge, experiences and ideas, we can help our customers on a completely different level.

We are looking for you who isimmediate joinerand want to grow with us!

With us, you have great opportunities to take real steps in your career and the opportunity to take great responsibility.

Job Description

Responsibilities:


Design, build, and maintain data pipelines on Google Cloud Platform (GCP) using services such as BigQuery, Dataplex, Dataflow/Dataproc, Pub/Sub, Cloud Functions, Cloud Run, Cloud Scheduler and Cloud Workflows.
Develop and implement data models using dbt (data build tool) to support analytical reporting and data science needs.
Collaborate with data analysts and business stakeholders to understand data requirements and translate them into data models.
Implement data quality checks and monitoring to ensure high quality of data in our data warehouse.
Optimize data pipelines and data models for performance and cost efficiency.
Document and communicate data models to the wider team and train them on how to use it effectively.
Good knowledge of Terraform
Experience in building CI/CD pipelines using GitHub Actions.


Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field, or equivalent experience.
Proven experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role.
Strong experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and its data services such as BigQuery, Cloud Run, and Pub/Sub.
Experience in data modelling and transformation using dbt.
Knowledge of SQL and good experience with Python.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to explain complex topics in simple terms.


Additional Information

Start:Immediate

Location:Stockholm, Sweden

Form of employment:Full-time until further notice, we apply 6 months probationary employment.

We interview candidates on an ongoing basis, do not wait to submit your application.

Locations:Stockholm

Note: Please apply only if you are currently residing in Sweden.

HTML:
Company Description

We are a consulting company with a bunch of technology-interested and happy people!

We love technology, we love design and we love quality. Our diversity makes us unique and creates an inclusive and welcoming workplace where each individual is highly valued.

With us, each individual is her/himself and respects others for who they are and we believe that when a fantastic mix of people gather and share their knowledge, experiences and ideas, we can help our customers on a completely different level.

We are looking for you who isimmediate joinerand want to grow with us!

With us, you have great opportunities to take real steps in your career and the opportunity to take great responsibility.

Job Description

Responsibilities:

  • Design, build, and maintain data pipelines on Google Cloud Platform (GCP) using services such as BigQuery, Dataplex, Dataflow/Dataproc, Pub/Sub, Cloud Functions, Cloud Run, Cloud Scheduler and Cloud Workflows.
  • Develop and implement data models using dbt (data build tool) to support analytical reporting and data science needs.
  • Collaborate with data analysts and business stakeholders to understand data requirements and translate them into data models.
  • Implement data quality checks and monitoring to ensure high quality of data in our data warehouse.
  • Optimize data pipelines and data models for performance and cost efficiency.
  • Document and communicate data models to the wider team and train them on how to use it effectively.
  • Good knowledge of Terraform
  • Experience in building CI/CD pipelines using GitHub Actions.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field, or equivalent experience.
  • Proven experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role.
  • Strong experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and its data services such as BigQuery, Cloud Run, and Pub/Sub.
  • Experience in data modelling and transformation using dbt.
  • Knowledge of SQL and good experience with Python.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to explain complex topics in simple terms.

Additional Information

Start:Immediate

Location:Stockholm, Sweden

Form of employment:Full-time until further notice, we apply 6 months probationary employment.

We interview candidates on an ongoing basis, do not wait to submit your application.

Locations:Stockholm

Note: Please apply only if you are currently residing in Sweden.

Title: Senior BI Consultant
Description:
Är du en fena på Power BI &/ Qlik och älskar att omvandla data till insikter? Vill du jobba i en flexibel miljö där du får stort ansvar och frihet? Då kanske du är vår nästa Senior BI Consultant!




Hos oss på Stormyran, ett ungt bolag inom Finance & Data, värdesätter vi frihet och eget ansvar. Vi tror att de bästa resultaten kommer när människor får jobba på sina egna villkor. Därför erbjuder vi en flexibel arbetsplats, där du kan arbeta remote eller från något av våra kontor i Stockholm, Falun eller Bollnäs.




Vad kommer du att göra?




Som BI-konsult hos oss kommer du att:

Designa, utveckla och underhålla dashboards och rapporter i Power BI som hjälper verksamheter att fatta smarta beslut.
Arbeta med datamodellering, DAX och SQL för att optimera prestanda och skapa robusta analyslösningar.
Samarbeta med kunder och kollegor för att förstå affärsbehov och omvandla dem till tydliga och användbara rapporter.
Bidra med din expertis kring best practices och strategier för BI-lösningar.
Om du har erfarenhet av Qlik, även få jobba med Qlik-lösningar för våra kunder.




Vem är du?

Du har minst 3 års erfarenhet av att arbeta med BI och datavisualisering.
Du har goda kunskaper inom DAX, datamodellering och SQL.
Relevant utbildning eller certifiering.
Erfarenhet av Qlik (t.ex. Qlik Sense, QlikView, Qlik Cloud) är meriterande men inget krav.
Du trivs i en roll där du får ta ansvar, driva projekt framåt och kommunicera med både tekniska och icke- tekniska stakeholders.
Du är nyfiken och gillar att lösa problem och hitta kreativa lösningar.
Extra meriterande om du har erfarenhet och förståelse för verksamhet och kan sätta dig in i olika affärs-modeller och processer för att kunna agera bollplank för kunden utanför det rent tekniska.




Vad erbjuder vi?

Flexibilitet – jobba remote eller från kontoret, du bestämmer.
Generösa förmåner och arbetsvillkor – vi tar hand om våra anställda.
Stora utvecklingsmöjligheter – hos oss finns det alltid utrymme att växa och påverka.
Ett ungt, framåtlutat team där vi värdesätter samarbete och delad kunskap.
En roll där du verkligen gör skillnad – dina insikter hjälper våra kunder att fatta bättre beslut.




Låter det intressant? Hör av dig så pratar vi vidare!

Show more

Title: Head of Data & Analytics
Description:
Welcome to Alf!

Hi there! We are Alf – a tech company born from the legacy of Länsförsäkringar Alliance, one of Sweden’s largest and most trusted financial groups, with over 3.9 million customers.

At Alf, we’re blending 200+ years of expertise with cutting-edge IoT technology to create a secure and sustainable way of living. Our mission? To empower customers to proactively care for and protect their homes, using smart solutions that make life easier and safer.

About The Job.

As Head of Data & Analytics at Alf, you will play a key role in shaping our data strategy and fostering a data-driven culture. This role blends technical leadership—working with our data platform, infrastructure, and tech stack—with strategic efforts to ensure that data is leveraged effectively to support business and product development.

You’ll work closely with our Analytics Engineer and tech team to develop and maintain our data platform, ensuring it evolves to meet future needs in a cost-efficient and scalable way. At the same time, you will be responsible for creating a data strategy together with leadership, product teams, and external stakeholders such as Länsbolagen and LF AB, ensuring that data insights help drive informed decisions.

Beyond technical and strategic aspects, you will act as an advocate for data-driven decision-making across the company, fostering a culture where data is accessible, useful, and embedded into our way of working. You will also support and grow our data team, which currently consists of one Analytics Engineer but is expected to expand over time. With a structured and proactive approach, you will help bridge business needs with technical solutions, ensuring that data plays a central role in LFTT’s success.

Key Responsibilities


Own and evolve Alf’s data platform, tech stack, and infrastructure—work closely with the Analytics Engineer and tech team to maintain and optimize the current solution, ensuring it remains cost-efficient, up-to-date, and scalable to support future use cases and business needs.
Identify and prioritize data use cases in collaboration with product teams, Länsbolagen, and LF AB, ensuring that data is used to support business development and product improvements.
Conduct workshops and training initiatives to enhance data understanding and adoption across the organization.
Develop and execute a data strategy and roadmap, working closely with the leadership team, architects, and other stakeholders to prioritize efforts based on business value and efficiency.
Stay at the forefront of industry trends by exploring new technologies and innovations that can optimize data-driven decision-making.
Support and grow the data team, structuring and expanding it as business needs evolve.


About You.

You have a strong technical background, likely with a master’s degree in computer engineering or a related field. A background in mathematics or another technical discipline is also relevant if you have developed the necessary skills through work experience or similar.

Your career has given you broad exposure to Data & Analytics, possibly as a Data Engineer, Analytics Engineer, Analyst, or Data Scientist, and you have experience with data platform architecture.

You have worked across business and product performance analytics (app and web analytics) and understand how data can drive improvements across multiple areas. Experience in a smaller company where you’ve had end-to-end responsibility is a plus, as is a commercial background. While experience in the insurance industry is beneficial, it is not a requirement.

We Are Looking For Someone With

Expertise in: Data modeling principles, SQL and dbt

Proficiency in: The Databricks platform (Unity Catalog, workspaces, notebooks, RBAC), orchestration tools such as Apache Airflow or Databricks Workflows, streaming platforms such as Apache Kafka, IaC frameworks such as Terraform, CI/CD principles and frameworks such as GitHub Actions, Apache Spark (PySpark), and visualization tools like Power BI, Looker, or Tableau.

Basic understanding of: Azure environments and services relating to data storage, processing and transfer such as Storage Accounts, Virtual Machines, Networking, IAM and Function Apps

Beyond technical skills, we are looking for someone who is analytical, curious, and a natural problem-solver. You enjoy working at the intersection of technology and business, translating complex data challenges into strategic opportunities. Your strong communication skills allow you to collaborate seamlessly with technical teams, leadership, and external partners. With a proactive and structured approach, you thrive in both high-level strategic discussions and hands-on problem-solving.

Fluency in Swedish and English, both spoken and written, is essential.

What You’ll Thrive On at Alf

At Alf, we embrace the guiding principles of empowered product teams to create an exceptional working environment:


Self-sufficient: Our teams have all the competencies they need to deliver on their objectives.
Autonomous: Our teams are self-directed with minimal top-down management. They have the flexibility to determine solutions and take ownership of their domain.
Responsible and accountable: Our teams’ work has a direct impact on Alf’s business and products.
Customer-focused: Our teams engage with customers continuously, uncovering opportunities and using that insight to inform their day-to-day prioritization.
Innovative: Our teams have dedicated time and space to experiment with new ideas.
Scalable: Our teams are responsible for their technical domain and work continuously to ensure scalability.


About Alf.

Länsförsäkringar embodies more than 200 years of dedication to create safety for our customers. With Alf, all that experience is being combined with innovative technology to cater the current needs of our clients. It’s a full-service solution providing personalized insights, advice and content, which enables the users to proactively take care of and protect their homes. With Alf and Länsförsäkringar, safety and sustainability go hand in hand.

Alf is operated by Länsförsäkringar Trygghetstjänster AB, a company owned by Länsförsäkringar Alliance. This provides a unique opportunity to become part of an engaged and fun team at an innovative tech company, characterised by the agile and dynamic essence of a startup, all while being supported by the stability and strength of Länsförsäkringar Alliance.

With Alf and Länsförsäkringar, you will get:

🏡 Work-life balance through a hybrid model

🏙️ Centrally located office in Stockholm

🤝 Collective agreement including pension and insurance coverage

🤸 Wellness allowance of 5000 SEK/year

💸 Special banking perks

🚀…and more but let us dive into that when we meet in person!

How to apply.

Apply by sending us your CV in Swedish or English. Our selection process is continuous, and we may move forward with candidates on an ongoing basis.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Help design, build and continuously improve the clients online platform.
Research, suggest and implement new technology solutions following best practices/standards.
Take responsibility for the resiliency and availability of different products.
Be a productive member of the team.


Requirements


At least 4+ years of hands-on experience as a Data Engineer working with GCP or other modern cloud data platforms, or advanced analytics environments.
Take full ownership of building, optimizing, and supporting both new and existing data products, aligning them with the defined target vision.
Champion a DevOps mindset, managing CI/CD pipelines, Terraform, and Cloud infrastructure, specifically within Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
Ensure data products are deployed as independent units and that non-functional aspects such as security, scalability, observability, and performance align with established standards.
Collaborate closely with the Product Manager and stakeholders to refine the vision for existing data products and identify new opportunities to meet customer needs.
Work with cross-functional product teams on topics related to the data mesh concept.
Continuously evaluate and drive improvements to reduce technical debt within the teams.
Stay up-to-date with the latest data, analytics, and cloud technologies.
Strong experience with cloud technologies and infrastructure.
Specific expertise with GCP tools, including Dataflow, Dataproc, and BigQuery.
Experience working with various data formats such as Parquet and Avro.
Proficient in data query languages (e.g., SQL or similar).
Strong background in data-centric programming, using Python, Java, or Scala.
Good understanding of various data modeling techniques and the trade-offs involved.
Familiarity with both NoSQL and RDBMS databases.


Benefits


A challenging, innovating environment.
Opportunities for learning where needed.

Title: System Engineer
Description:
Systems Engineer - Stockholm




Our client, a well-established Nordic IT organization, is looking for a Systems Engineer to join their team. This role is ideal for someone with a strong background in network infrastructure and IT security, who enjoys taking ownership of systems and working in a collaborative environment.




About the Role

The successful candidate will work alongside the senior network specialist to design, implement, and maintain the company’s IT infrastructure. This includes managing firewalls, switches, and wireless solutions, as well as contributing to overall IT security strategy.




Key Responsibilities:

Design, implement, and manage network infrastructure and services.
Configure and maintain network and server environments.
Work closely with the operations team to design and build integrated system solutions.
Play an active role in strengthening IT security across the organization.




What Our Client is Looking For




Must-Haves:

Passion for IT infrastructure and operations.
Strong problem-solving skills and a proactive mindset.
Experience with Fortinet (firewalls), Cisco (switches), and Meraki (wireless).
Fluency in English and at least one Scandinavian language.




Nice-to-Haves:

Certifications in Cisco (CCNP), Fortinet, or Microsoft technologies.
Experience with Azure or AWS environments.
A solid IT background with hands-on experience in networking and security.




Additional Details

Location: Stockholm (Hybrid - 3 days in the office, flexible days)
Salary: Up to 50,000 SEK/month (higher for cybersecurity/network specialists)
On-Call Bonus: Additional pay for both being on-call and handling calls (approx. 1 week per month).
Benefits: Pension, 6 weeks of holiday, and standard company benefits.




Interested?

If this sounds like the right opportunity for you, reach out to learn more! Our client is actively reviewing applications and will be conducting interviews on an ongoing basis.

Show more

Title: Data Modeller
Description:
Job Description

Insights & Data is a global business line within Capgemini, consisting of 27,000 experts. Our focus? To create groundbreaking machine learning and AI solutions with reliable and scalable data platforms. From business analysis to Gen-AI, we cover it all! We work across all industries and have a collaborative environment and culture where your unique perspective matters.

The places that you work from day to day will vary according to your role, your needs, and those of the business; it will be a blend of Company offices, client sites, and your home; noting that you will be unable to work at home 100% of the time. 

YOUR ROLE

We are now looking for an engaged Data Modeller with experience in the financial sector. In this role, you will work across multiple solutions and technologies within the team's scope and be responsible for data modeling and data architecture solutions.

Additionally, you will:


Create and maintain conceptual, logical, and physical data models for databases and data warehouses.
Optimize data structures for performance, scalability, and reliability.
Work closely with business analysts, data architects, and software developers to understand data needs.
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and analyze requirements for data-related projects.
Ensure data models align with organizational standards and governance policies.
Develop and enforce data modeling best practices and standards.


YOUR PROFILE

To be successful in this role, we see that you have approximately 5+ years of experience in data modeling with a background in the financial sector. You are proficient in gathering and analyzing requirements, creating conceptual, logical, and physical data models, and optimizing data structures using tools like Erwin, IBM Data Architect (or similar). You should also be familiar with ETL processes, data warehousing, and data lakes.

Additionally, we value:


A Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in information technology or computer science
Previous consulting experience
Excellent communication skills, fluent in English
A solid understanding of data governance frameworks and best practices
Familiarity with big data and relational database systems


About

WHAT WE BELIEVE YOU WILL ENJOY ABOUT WORKING HERE

We value the importance of flexible work arrangements to support our employees' daily lives. Whether it's remote work or flexible working hours, our goal is to create an environment where you can maintain a healthy work-life balance. At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our range of training, career programs, and various roles are designed to help you explore a world of opportunities. Whether you want to equip yourself with valuable certifications or develop your role as a leader, we want to ensure we offer what you need.

Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fuelled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.
Show more
HTML:
Job Description

Insights & Data is a global business line within Capgemini, consisting of 27,000 experts. Our focus? To create groundbreaking machine learning and AI solutions with reliable and scalable data platforms. From business analysis to Gen-AI, we cover it all! We work across all industries and have a collaborative environment and culture where your unique perspective matters.

The places that you work from day to day will vary according to your role, your needs, and those of the business; it will be a blend of Company offices, client sites, and your home; noting that you will be unable to work at home 100% of the time. 

YOUR ROLE

We are now looking for an engaged Data Modeller with experience in the financial sector. In this role, you will work across multiple solutions and technologies within the team's scope and be responsible for data modeling and data architecture solutions.

Additionally, you will:

  • Create and maintain conceptual, logical, and physical data models for databases and data warehouses.
  • Optimize data structures for performance, scalability, and reliability.
  • Work closely with business analysts, data architects, and software developers to understand data needs.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and analyze requirements for data-related projects.
  • Ensure data models align with organizational standards and governance policies.
  • Develop and enforce data modeling best practices and standards.

YOUR PROFILE

To be successful in this role, we see that you have approximately 5+ years of experience in data modeling with a background in the financial sector. You are proficient in gathering and analyzing requirements, creating conceptual, logical, and physical data models, and optimizing data structures using tools like Erwin, IBM Data Architect (or similar). You should also be familiar with ETL processes, data warehousing, and data lakes.

Additionally, we value:

  • A Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in information technology or computer science
  • Previous consulting experience
  • Excellent communication skills, fluent in English
  • A solid understanding of data governance frameworks and best practices
  • Familiarity with big data and relational database systems

About

WHAT WE BELIEVE YOU WILL ENJOY ABOUT WORKING HERE

We value the importance of flexible work arrangements to support our employees' daily lives. Whether it's remote work or flexible working hours, our goal is to create an environment where you can maintain a healthy work-life balance. At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our range of training, career programs, and various roles are designed to help you explore a world of opportunities. Whether you want to equip yourself with valuable certifications or develop your role as a leader, we want to ensure we offer what you need.

Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fuelled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.

Title: Salesforce Developer
Description:
You will be joining one of the largest financial based organisation within Sweden working with an extensive tech team delivering a first class product within Wealth management. This team is looking for developers with a strong background in Salesforce to join supporting a platform used globally.




The role:




Our client is on a journey to create a first-class platform supporting clients within the financial space. They are looking to find exceptional Salesforce Developers to join and play a vital role in this project. You will be involved with the technical design sessions, architect and document technical solution and identify gaps between current and desired end-states.




You will provide technical support in developing a world class application along side team members. Ideally you are updated with current Salesforce releases, features, and best practices, and make recommendations for process improvements.




2 Years + of experience in Salesforce developer
Have a knowledge of Software development (JavaScript, Java, HTML, CSS, API)
Experience within Apex, Visualforce, Lighting Components, and Salesforce Integrations
Experience within Salesforce Architecture
Salesforce Platform 1 and 2 Certificate will be highly preferred.




We offer




We offer a great work environment with an exciting work culture that puts team collaboration first. Our unique space in Stockholm has been creative created with developers in mind to promote knowledge sharing, collaboration and social atmosphere.




Benefits Offered:




ITP1 Pension
Education allowance
Wellness allowance




Unfortunately, this opportunity cannot offer any form of VISA sponsorship. You need to be able to speak Swedish and will require 3 days per week onsite in central Stockholm.




If this role could be of interest to you feel free to get in touch




tim.stokes@parallelconsulting.com

Title: Analytics Consultant
Description:
Vill du skapa förutsättningar för bättre datadrivet beslutsfattande? Då har du kommit rätt! Vi söker dig som vill utveckla morgondagens analysplattformar för att hjälpa organisationer att jobba mer datadrivet.




Om rollen som konsult inom Data & Analytics

Som konsult inom Data & Analytics hos Zington blir du en nyckelspelare i att hjälpa våra kunder att realisera sina ambitioner mot bättre datadrivet beslutsfattande. Ditt uppdrag är att omsätta affärsbehov till moderna och effektiva analyslösningar, oftast baserat på Microsofts molnplattform Azure. Med djup förståelse för kundens affär och processer hjälper du kunden att agera utifrån deras data, vilket skapar möjligheter att optimera verksamheten framåt. Vi bygger molnbaserade data warehouse-lösningar med hjälp av Microsoft Azure och Databricks som främsta verktyg. Vi utvecklar och implementerar lösningar från start till mål och kan även diskutera arkitektur samt för- och nackdelar med olika koncept.




Rollerna det talas mest om inom analysområdet just nu är Data Analysts, Data Engineers och Data Scientists, och vi ser behov hos våra kunder inom alla dessa kompetenser. I dessa roller kombineras teknisk skicklighet med strategisk insikt, helst arbetandes sida vid sida med dina kollegor på Zington. Vill du ta din karriär till nästa nivå? Välkommen att ansöka!




Dina kompetenser och egenskaper

Utbildning som ingenjör, ekonom eller arbetslivserfarenheter som demonstrerar en stark förmåga att sätta sig in i och lösa problem.
Tidigare erfarenhet av Microsofts produkter inom Data & Analytics, gärna inom moln och gärna i rollen som konsult.
+4 års erfarenhet.
Förstår vikten av göra det lilla extra när det behövs men kan samtidigt ge sig själv (och andra) en paus när det behövs.
Trivs i att verka i en föränderlig miljö och inser att flexibilitet är en superkraft.
Talar och skriver obehindrat på svenska såväl som engelska.
Vågar ta hjälp och även hjälpa andra.
Nyfiken.




Mer om rollen

Vi rekryterar löpande och ser gärna att du kan börja så snart som möjligt men månar om att hitta rätt person. Därför värderar vi dina personliga egenskaper och att vi trivs ihop högt.




Har du frågor eller funderingar? Kontakta rekryterande chefer Andreas Åkerblad, andreas.akerblad@zingtongroup.com alternativt Elin Hellström, elin.hellstrom@zingtongroup.com




Om Zington

Zington är ett konsultföretag med expertis inom Management, IT och Design. Vår resa började redan 2008 men idag är vi 250 medarbetare i Stockholm och fler än 4000 kollegor globalt inom VASS koncernen. Vi stöttar kunder som ex. Atrium Ljungberg, Axfood, Apollo och Fora i digital transformation genom att skapa tjänster, bygga lösningar och utforma strategier som driver affären framåt. På Zington ligger vår styrka i våra medarbetare. Oavsett om du är en specialist eller generalist kan vi som konsultföretag erbjuda dig en plats att växa och trivas på. Vi strävar efter att vara en plats där vi stöttar varandra, delar med oss av vår kunskap och utvecklas tillsammans. Vår framgång bygger på engagerade människor – när du växer, växer företag.

Show more

Title: Data Engineer at The Nutriment Company
Description:
About The Nutriment Company 

At The Nutriment Company, we are entrepreneurs, visionaries, and doers. We operate in one of the fastest-growing segments of FMCG –pet food – and we are proud to be Europe's leading company within the natural premium segment. With headquarters in Stockholm and Düsseldorf, we currently have over 650 employees across Europe.  

 

At The Nutriment Company, we have a highly motivated, ambitious, and fun team that aspires to take our company to the next level as we expand at a high pace, both through organic growth and acquisitions across Europe. 

 

The Role 

We are now looking for a Data Engineer to play a key role in scaling our eCommerce and data infrastructure. You will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining scalable data pipelines while ensuring seamless API integrations across multiple platforms. This position will play a critical role in our transition to Shopify, helping to migrate data efficiently while optimizing for performance and reliability.  

 

You will report to the Head of Data and collaborate closely with our data, engineering, and digital commerce teams. This role is based in our headquarter in Stockholm and occasional travel across Europe when necessary. 

 

Key Responsibilities 

Develop, maintain, and optimize API connections between internal systems, third-party services, and external platforms. 
Work with GraphQL and RESTful APIs, including Shopify, ERP systems, and internal data platforms. 
Lead the migration of our eCommerce platforms to Shopify, ensuring data consistency and minimal downtime. 
Develop data transformation strategies to migrate customers, orders, and product data accurately. 
Optimize database structures and data models to support Shopify’s ecosystem efficiently. 
Build and maintain ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) pipelines to collect and process data from multiple sources. 
Ensure high data availability, quality, and reliability for analytics, reporting, and business operations. 
Automate data processes to improve operational efficiency and reduce manual workloads. 
Work with Apache Airflow or similar workflow orchestration tools to manage data pipelines. 
Monitor system performance, troubleshoot API failures, and optimize data workflows. 
Provide technical guidance and best practices for API integration and data migration. 

 

Your Profile 

3+ years of experience as a Data Engineer, Software Engineer, or similar role focused on API integrations and data pipelines. 
Proven experience with Shopify migration projects, including data transformation and API-based integrations. 
Strong proficiency in Python, SQL, and data modeling for efficient ETL processes. 
Experience with GraphQL and RESTful API development, including working with third-party APIs (e.g., Shopify, ERP, and payment gateways). 
Experience with Apache Airflow or similar workflow orchestration tools for scheduling and managing data pipelines. 
Experience with cloud platforms such as Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud for managing data infrastructure. 
Experienced in writing code unit tests to ensure high data quality and accurate pipelines. 
Strong knowledge of databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL, BigQuery, or similar). 
Ability to work independently, troubleshoot technical issues, and optimize workflows. 
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a strategic mindset. 

 

What We Offer 

A high-growth company with an exciting role at the intersection of data, eCommerce, and technology. 
A unique opportunity to drive innovation and lead key data initiatives in a dynamic environment. 
Competitive salary, benefits, and flexible work arrangements. 
A supportive and ambitious team with opportunities for career progression. 
A collaborative, international work environment with exposure to executive management. 

 

Your Application 

If you believe The Nutriment Company is the right place for you, please send us your resume and a short cover letter today – no later than April 1st

 

Interviews take place continuously, and the position may be filled before the application deadline.  

 

If you have questions about the position, please contact Head of HR mette.schneider@nutriment.com 

 

We look forward to receiving your application! 

 

Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Senior Data Engineer (AWS) – Consultant Assignment

We are now looking for a Senior Data Engineer for an assignment where you will develop and optimize data workflows and infrastructure. You will handle large structured and unstructured datasets, ensuring efficiency, performance, and reliability while collaborating with various teams to build scalable and cost-effective solutions.




Location: Stockholm

We are looking for someone to start March 24 and are reviewing applications continuously.




About the Role

As a Senior Data Engineer, you will develope and maintain scalable data pipelines and transformation processes. The role involves optimizing data workflows, ensuring data quality, and solving complex data-related issues. You will work with cloud computing platforms and distributed computing frameworks while designing data models to support analytics, reporting, and machine learning applications.




Work Tasks

Develop and maintain scalable processes for ingesting, transforming, and storing structured and unstructured data.
Collaborate with various teams to ensure technical solutions align with performance, scalability, and reliability goals.
Optimize data workflows and infrastructure to enhance efficiency, performance, and cost-effectiveness.
Design and implement data models and schema structures for analytics, reporting, and machine learning.
Implement monitoring, logging, and quality checks to ensure data integrity and system reliability.
Diagnose and resolve complex data-related issues, including performance bottlenecks, inconsistencies, and system failures.
Work with cloud computing platforms, specifically AWS..
Handle real-time data processing, time-series data, and IoT applications.




We Are Looking For Someone Who Has

At least 5 years of experience in Data Engineering or a related role.
Professional communication skills in English and preferably Swedish, both written and spoken.
Experience with cloud computing platforms, primarily AWS (and/or Azure, GCP).
Strong programming skills in Python and SQL.
Experience with Linux environments, version control (Git), and CI/CD automation.
Knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases.
Experience in designing and implementing data-intensive software for distributed systems.
Expertise in workflow orchestration tools and data transformation techniques.
Knowledge of data serialization, transfer protocols, and file formats.
Experience with Kubernetes and/or serverless architectures.
Authorized to work in Sweden




It Is Meritorious If You Have

Experience with Python-based data analysis and visualization tools.




About Explore Consulting

Explore Consulting is a consulting and staffing company that connects skilled professionals with leading companies across various industries. We specialize in matching the right expertise with the right assignments, whether in IT, engineering, finance, or other business sectors. As a consultant with us, you gain access to exciting career opportunities, a strong professional network, and the support needed to succeed in your role.

Title: Data Engineer - AI
Description:
About Sana

We're on a mission to revolutionize how humans access knowledge through artificial intelligence. Throughout history, breakthroughs in knowledge sharing—from the Library of Alexandria to the printing press to Google—have been pivotal drivers of human progress. Today, as the volume of human knowledge grows exponentially, making it accessible and actionable remains one of humanity's most critical challenges. We're building a future where knowledge isn't just more accessible—it's a catalyst for achieving the previously impossible. If all of this sounds exciting, you’re in the right place.

The Role

Join the Sana AI search team to shape the future of knowledge work from enterprise search to intelligent agents. Our goal is to enable humans and agents to understand, find, and act on any piece of information, regardless of format. To achieve this we are reconsidering the traditional enterprise search stack from the ground up to be inherently multi-modal and leverage the latest developments in LLMs.

You’ll work on everything related to the data that powers both enterprise search and agentic workflows, including large scale ingestion, orchestration, and logging. This role requires a deep understanding of modern retrieval systems, data pipelines and solid data engineering/backend skills as well as an understanding of generative AI.

What You’ll Do


Build data ingestion pipelines to integrate and process data from various sources to ensure high-quality, consistent input for search systems.
Design and implement robust logging systems for data collection from Sana apps and backends.
Monitor, optimize, and troubleshoot data pipelines to maintain high performance and reliability.
Collaborate closely with other engineers on satisfying data needs for AI features.


Your background looks something like


Proven track record building distributed, data-intensive systems.
Skilled in optimizing performance, reliability and scalability.
Hands-on experience with data processing or workflow orchestration frameworks (e.g., Apache Beam, Hatchet, Temporal) and analytics databases (BigQuery).
Data-driven approach to problem solving with attention to reliability and data quality.
Strong experience in software engineering, ideally for AI systems.


What We Offer


Help shape AI's future alongside brilliant minds from Google AI, Spotify, McKinsey, BCG, and Slack.
Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
Swift professional growth in an evolving environment, supported by a culture of continuous feedback and mentorship from senior leaders.
Work with talented teammates across 5+ countries, collaborate with customers globally and work in our offices in New York, London and Stockholm.
Regular team gatherings and events (recently in Italy and South Africa)


Show more

  • Proven track record building distributed, data-intensive systems.

  • Hands-on experience with data processing or workflow orchestration frameworks (e.g., Apache Beam, Hatchet, Temporal) and analytics databases (BigQuery).
  • Data-driven approach to problem solving with attention to reliability and data quality.
  • Strong experience in software engineering, ideally for AI systems.

What We Offer

  • Help shape AI's future alongside brilliant minds from Google AI, Spotify, McKinsey, BCG, and Slack.
  • Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
  • Swift professional growth in an evolving environment, supported by a culture of continuous feedback and mentorship from senior leaders.
  • Work with talented teammates across 5+ countries, collaborate with customers globally and work in our offices in New York, London and Stockholm.
  • Regular team gatherings and events (recently in Italy and South Africa)

Title: Data processing/development
Description:
Data processing and software development

Do you thrive on building excellent client relations and have a passion for technology and transport?

Do you want to get grips with a software solution that makes a real difference to the success of complex organisations?

Our expanding transport technology business is looking to grow its team.

About Industrial Optimizers

Industrial Optimizers is a leading developer of advanced software solutions aimed primarily at the global transport sector, including airlines, airports, rail operators and bus companies. Our global network of clients uses our tools to plan and optimize their operation and make fact-based decisions that affect their bottom lines.

Our innovative team comprises specialists in IT, mathematics, software development and experienced professionals in transportation.

For our data processing and software development roles we need a person with proven analytical skills and a strong working knowledge of software development including good programming skills. All members of Industrial Optimizers’ development team are included in our Support services team and a successful candidate would be expected to also be included in the team, so any experience with customer support activities would be considered as a bonus for the applicant.

The work you would be expected to do includes; the running and monitoring of large-scale data processing services, involvement in all software development tasks including design, programming and testing, inclusion in Customer Support activities such as being in the Support Team, being on-call and able to understand and solve such issues that may arise, even those of a technical nature.

A good command of the English language is required, as we have most customers outside of Sweden.

The position is in Stockholm and requires shift work as the processing and support services are carried out 24/7.

The following skills are required:

-         Managing large scale server processing

-         An interest in Software development from the design to completion stages

-         Understanding of the Software Development life-cycle

-         Programming skills

-         Knowledge and experience in computer hardware

-         Knowledge and understanding of

o  Operating systems

o  Virtual environments (such as MS Azure or AWS)

o  IT Networks

o  IT Security as well as Cyber Security

o  Web applications and mobile apps

The following qualification and experience areas are advantageous:

-         Database management experience

-         Python, Matlab, SQL or similar analysis/development tools    

You have a background either in, or working with, one or more transport providers in the aviation or rail or shipping or bus sector. You will have knowledge about transportation and logistics.

You are prepared to travel.

You are a team player and enjoy working closely with both colleagues and clients with international backgrounds. You can also work independently and manage your time and tasks effectively.

Show more

Title: Data Steward | SEB, Stockholm
Description:
We are looking for a dedicated Data Steward to play a key role in advancing our data journey towards a sustainable reporting solution, with the opportunity to grow into a Data Owner role.

About the role:

Data Management is a function within Corporate & Investment Banking, Regulatory Reporting Office, that consists of a team of Data Owners and Data Stewards, located in Stockholm.

As a Data Steward, you will be responsible for defining, implementing, and executing data management processes within a new reporting solution built on Google Cloud Platform (GCP). You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams both within and outside the Markets Regulatory Reporting Tribe to enforce data governance policies, procedures, and standards.

Main responsibilities:


Support the Data Owner in implementing Data Management responsibilities
Collect and prioritize data requirements for the Regulatory Trade Reporting Data Area
Serve as a liaison between data producers and the Regulatory Trade Reporting Data Area to ensure alignment on data needs
Perform data modeling and define data-related requirements
Ensure data is accessible, usable, and of high quality for business users
Define, implement, and manage data quality controls
Ensure adherence to data policies and standards, driving continuous improvement
Identify synergies across use cases to enable scalable data product development
Facilitate the creation and maintenance of metadata in the Enterprise Data Catalogue for the Data Area


To thrive in this role, we believe you have:


Several years of experiences in the financial industry and deep understanding of the financial capital market products and regulations such as MiFID or Derivatives reporting as well as the experience in data management
Strong understanding of data management frameworks, best practices, and methodologies
Previous experience working within a Data or IT function as a Data Steward/Data Analyst or similar type of role
Practical experience with SQL, SPARX Enterprise Architect, or Collibra
Ability to perform data analysis tasks and assist the agile team in development of data flows
Strong ability to communicate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Ability to drive cross-functional efforts to deliver data solutions that meet regulatory and business needs
Experience with agile framework is an advantage
A team player mindset, can communicate on all levels and are able to take different perspectives into consideration


What we offer:


Friendly and welcoming culture
High pace with a constant inflow of regulatory and business changes
Chances to make an impact on regulatory industry challenges
International environment where we strive to adapt to agile and modern ways of working
Cross-functional collaboration across divisions, product areas, client teams, and support functions


Do you want to be part of SEB?

It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than 3 April 2025. If you have questions about the position, please contact Marcin Mazurczak at marcin.mazurczak@seb.se . We will not process applications via email.

Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and criminal records checks. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.

Learn more about working at SEB on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.

https://sebgroup.com/career

https://bit.ly/SEBcareer
Show more
