Title: Statistician
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
HTML:
About Agreena

Agreena is an exciting, dynamic, and purpose-oriented organisation united in a mission to mobilise farmers and corporations to unlock the value of nature and help restore the planet. While we’re rooted in agriculture, finance, and technology, our team of experts range from soil carbon scientists and software developers to market strategists and regulatory affairs experts. Over 230 employees across more than 40 nationalities are gathered under the common Agreena flag – either working from our headquarters in Copenhagen, offices in London, or remotely across Europe.

As a rapidly scaling climate agtech, Agreena provides solutions that drive both environmental and financial sustainability in farming. We have helped farmers across 20 countries in their journey from conventional agriculture to regenerative farming practices to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and remove CO2 from the atmosphere, storing it in soil. Our company offers a supportive and positive work environment with opportunities for learning, leading and growth no matter where you are in your professional journey. We believe in giving our employees a lot of responsibility, and we encourage new thinking, innovation and fun.

We are looking for an in-house statistician to assist our Programme and Data teams. Across both, we are looking to better understand and explain our data in order to bolster our scientific rigour. You will sit between both teams and should be confident working with different types of statistical analysis, process-based modelling, and sampling/stratification.

Equally, you should have a good understanding of statistical modelling and bring a fresh perspective to our machine learning and process-based approaches. Thus, you will be a strong communicator capable of translating complex analysis into simplified insights to both internal and external stakeholders.

The Programme and Data teams are integral to the scientific operations of the company, and you will work closely together with them and our Product teams to ensure state of the art science drives our world leading carbon platform. As such, you will be part of a dynamic and high-paced work environment constantly subject to innovation.

How Will You Make An Impact

  • Estimating uncertainty and error propagation in our models;
  • Applying Bayesian methods for the calibration of complex process-based models;
  • Designing sampling strategies for our data collection campaigns;
  • Evaluating the quality and quantity of our data;
  • Communicating and visualising key insights;

Who We’re Looking For

  • Self-driven individual capable of collaborating in a multi-disciplinary environment;
  • Minimum Bachelors in Statistics, Mathematics, or appropriate science/engineering field;
  • 3+ years of experience working in a relevant field, with experience in some or all of the following:
  • Statistical and data-sampling techniques such as regression, imputation, random forest, Monte Carlo, stratification, and/or clustering;
  • Working with temporal and spatial data;
  • Experience coding in R;
  • Strong scientific writing, report creation and communication skills to audiences with a range of technical expertise.

Bonus Points If You Have

  • Masters or PhD in one of the relevant Science fields mentioned above;
  • A baseline understanding of greenhouse gas accounting frameworks and methodologies;
  • Strong theoretical background in Bayesian Statistics;
  • Knowledge or experience working with crop, pedometrics, or process-based models;
  • Experience coding in Python;
  • Handling unstructured/imbalanced data.

What’s In It For You

  • A unique opportunity to join and help shape a fast-growing tech scale up with the determination and ambitious mission to reverse climate change;
  • A truly global environment where you can collaborate and socialise with diverse and passionate colleagues;
  • Competitive compensation package and holidays;
  • Centrally located modern office in Copenhagen or London and the option to work from home a couple days a week;
  • Team events throughout the year;
  • An exciting purpose-led culture and mission;
  • Open communication and supportive feedback culture.

🌱 Not quite what you're looking for?

Stay connected with us by following our Agreena LinkedIn page. It's the best way to stay updated on our latest content, articles, and exciting new opportunities.

Plus, if you want to be the first to know about job openings in the departments you're interested in, you can subscribe to our job alerts talent pool.

🌍 Be your best self every day at Agreena

At Agreena, we are devoted to building an environment that promotes equality, inclusion, and diversity. As we embark on our journey of expansion and growth, we recognise the value of celebrating and embracing everyone's uniqueness. This diversity is crucial to our success and innovation. We aspire to build a product that is loved by our customers and we want the same to be reflected in our teams.

With this in mind, we're dedicated to ensuring that Agreena remains a welcoming and diverse environment for all.

Title: Data Analyst, Supply Chain
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Supply Chain analyst with focus on Data to support Operations and inventory management.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

Other duties may be assigned.


Analyse business data to understand issues, trends, and patterns with a focus on product availability, improving the customer experience and cost reduction.
Identify issues, participate in the development and implementation of supply chain solutions, review data and determine how to solve problems and learn critical insights about our business.
Support Inventory strategy with the aim of controlling inventory value, analyze inventory turnover rate and reduce obsolescence.
Maintain accurate procedures for all inventory control processes and functions.
Build strong relationships with the team to identify and rectify key issues and challenges and provide analysis and insight that will add value to the team and wider business.
Develop, automate and generate frequently used KPI reports.
Improve existing reports and data for optimization within Operation. Support wider ops team with ad hoc tasks within the area of Purchasing, Sourcing and Manufacturing.
Build effective, accurate and value-adding reports and analytics.
Build dashboard in Power BI and Power point presentations.
QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE:
Degree in Information Systems, Supply Chain Management or related field.
Experience in strategic analysis, planning and logistic analytics.
Experience working in operations or supply chain management.
Excellent PC skills and systems knowledge. Super user in MS Excel (Macros), Oracle EBS, Agile.
Experience with Power BI, SQL and OBIEE.
Goal orientated with strong numerical and analytical skills.
With strong focus on the detail
Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
Ability to organise and work to tight deadlines.
Flexible, innovative and creative in attitudes to all issues and areas of the business
Excellent team player and willing to interact with internal teams, suppliers and freight carriers.
LANGUAGE SKILLS:
Ability to read, analyse and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals and technical procedures. Ability to write reports, business correspondence and procedure manuals.
Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers and the general public.
MATHEMATICAL SKILLS:
Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, percentages, area, circumference and volume.
Ability to apply concepts of basic algebra and geometry.
REASONING ABILITY:
Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists.
Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram or schedule form
PHYSICAL DEMANDS:
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit and talk or hear.
The employee is regularly required to work at a keyboard and computer.
The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 10 pounds, frequently lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.
WORK ENVIRONMENT:
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job.
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Work environment could include the following:
Airports
Home office
Driving in Traffic
Riding with District Sales Manger
Driving in adverse weather i.e. rain, snow, sleet
Hotels

Title: Reporting & BI - Product & Market, AS Performance
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Nissan, we're not just building cars, we're revolutionizing mobility. We believe that every individual possesses a unique set of skills and passions that can be harnessed to drive innovation and shape the future of the automotive industry. Our global impact is fuelled by a force of over 160,000 dedicated minds, crafting and delivering innovation since 1933. For over 90 years, our core belief in doing what others don't has driven innovation and excitement for our customers, shaping Nissan into the business it is today. We are not just a company - we're a movement, pushing boundaries and embracing the spirit of "Defy Ordinary".

We are now looking for a Reporting & BI - Product & Market, AS Performance to join our newly created RBU. In this role, you will join the Analytics & Innovation team and report to the Marketing Knowledge & Data Analytics Manager.

How you can contribute and have an impact?


Reporting & insights, trend visualization, AI modelling, performance analysis
Responsible for the preparation, extrapolation and analysis of product and market
Analyze product / aftersales performance based on specific reports (price position, trends, competitors' actions)
Frequent reporting of campaign performance
Media KPIs (GRP, reach, impressions, clicks, CPC)
Number of qualified visitors, cost per QVs
Showroom traffic
Captive bank data analysis based on request
Supervise and monitor quarterly and seasonal campaigns & action plans, execution of European Aftersales marketing strategies and programs, webpage development
Review AS campaign data and evaluate the results of the performed campaign, lead strategic direction for future campaigns
Ensure sufficient training (internal) for reporting
Control budget related to the dealer data and systems
Managing special projects and ad-hoc reporting and analysis for regional and national management


What we look for:


Minimum 5 years professional experience preferably within the automotive industry, EV experience is a plus
Experience within an international, matrix organization is highly advantageous
Experience in Data management / engineering
Higher education at Bachelors' level
Fluency in English, other local languages are considered as an advantage
Analytical skills
Advanced PC skills
Experienced MS Office user, especially in Excel
Presentation skills
Data-driven decision-making
Borderless and virtual mindset
Ability to simplify
Familiarity with data Management principles and practices
Experience creating and documenting policies and procedures
Ability to work with both business stakeholders and technical support teams to resolve data issues
Ability to communicate successfully with stakeholders at all levels to understand their needs and translate those needs
Ability to communicate with highly technical individuals about the desires, insights, and observations of the business and to ensure development and deployment of appropriate solutions


Nissan believes the power comes from the inside, the diversity and well-being of its employees is key to success. People are our most valuable assets, and diversity and inclusion are the key to maximizing the power of each individual member of our team. Nissan is committed to be a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive company that empowers everyone to bring their best, most authentic selves to work. Respecting each person, their opinions and value is when we can drive innovations that make a difference.

Our future vision and ambition is "Together We Empower Mobility and Beyond" for a cleaner, safer and more inclusive world.

Amsterdam Netherlands

Title: Remote Data Analyst
Description:
It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.

Siemens Gamesa har en vision for vedvarende energi: vi tror på kraften i naturen og på teknologi. Hjælp os med at blive klar til de energimæssige udfordringer i fremtiden og med at skabe grønne fodaftryk – bliv en del af et team, der arbejder for at forbedre fremtiden for os og for vores planet.

Vi fokuserer på at ansætte de bedste folk, hvor end de måtte være i verden. Vi sætter en ære i at tilbyde vores medarbejdere fleksibilitet og arbejder målrettet på at opbygge en arbejdsstyrke, som kan vokse med virksomheden. Siemens Gamesa sætter en ære i at tilbyde alle medarbejdere lige muligheder. Vi hylder diversitet og gør alt for at skabe et inkluderende miljø for alle medarbejdere.

Vores kultur er baseret på tillid og fokuserer på anerkendelse, diversitet og kontinuerlig læring. Det, der gør os til et globalt team, er, at vi værdsætter vores medarbejdere og at vores kollegers sikkerhed er en hjertesag for vores organisation.

Remote Data Analytics (RDA) holdet er på udkig efter en ny kollega, som har kendskab til Siemens' flåde af vindmøller. Holdet overvåger installerede møller og arbejder 24/7/365 på aktive alarmer igennem et lokalt on-line system kombineret med diagnostiske værktøjer, med det formål at spare teknikertimer og øge availability.

Du vil være en del af et hold bestående af 12 højt kvalificerede og dedikerede Remote Data Analysts, hvor du skal arbejde på skift sammen med 1-2 andre kolleger i et engageret overvågningsrum.

Stillingen er placeret i Brande.

Hvordan kan du bidrage til vores vision?

Dit job vil være at diagnosticere og fortolke remote indsamlet data fra fejlramte møller, hvor du på baggrund af det data, formulerer en fejlfindingsvejledning på engelsk, som du ”sender” til de serviceteknikere, som skal fejlfinde på møllen. Du sætter ære i at få stoppede møller op-at-køre, hurtigst muligt og på ansvarligvis – og at holde dem kørende. Du vil efter behov holder dig selv og teamet opdateret på alle platforme igennem on-site besøg og træning.

Du bliver en del af et 6-ugers ”rullende skift” bestående af: 5 hverdage (07:00 - 15:10), 5 hverdagsaftener (15:00 - 23:10), 5 hverdagsnætter (23:00 00 - 07:10), 2 weekenddage (07:00 - 19:10) og 2 weekendnætter (19:00 - 07:10). Du har så fri de resterende 2 uger og 5 hverdage af det ”rullende skift”. Der kan dog forventes lejlighedsvis betalt overarbejde.

Vi ser gerne, at du har en baggrund som troubleshooting/commissioning tekniker med praktisk erfaring fra Siemens vindmøller, men at du nu er på udkig efter et karriereskift i et kontormiljø.

Hvordan kan du være med til at gøre en forskel?

Du har en mekanisk og/eller en elektrisk uddannelse og gerne nogle års praktisk erfaring. Du kan formulere en skræddersyet fejlfindingsvejledning på engelsk, som er baseret på remote indhentet data kombineret med din viden om Siemens vindmøller (WTC-3, SICS, gearede og DD-platforme).

Du har erfaring med Office 365, og du har generelt god IT-forståelse.

Du er fleksibel, serviceminded og sætter en ære i at holde systemerne og møllerne i drift. Du trives i et hektisk og dynamisk miljø, hvor du er proaktiv i dit arbejde. Det vil være en fordel, hvis du har erfaring med WPS, cRSP og MORS (dog ikke et krav).

Som person er du analytisk, detalje- og resultatorienteret. Du er passioneret men uden at gå på kompromis med kvaliteten. Du har evnen til at arbejde selvstændigt og i et team, du er motiveret af rutinemæssige opgaver foran en computer. Du er en dygtig kommunikator og er flydende i engelsk verbalt, samt i teknisk skrivning.

Hvis du har erhvervet dine færdigheder på alternative måder, er din ansøgning også værdsat.

Til gengæld for dit engagement tilbyder vi dig...

At blive en del af vores mission for bæredygtighed: ren energi for kommende generationer. Vi er et globalt team med en diversitet af kolleger, som deler en passion for vedvarende energi og har en kultur af tillid samt mandat til at gøre vores egne idéer til virkelighed.

Vi fokuserer på personlig og professionel udvikling til at vokse internt inden for vores organisation. Siemens Gamesa tilbyder en bred vifte af fordele, herunder fleksible arbejdstider og muligheden for at arbejde hjemmefra, en arbejdsgiverfinansieret pensionsordning, en attraktiv lønpakke (fast/variabel) og lokale fordele som f.eks. en frokostordning, medarbejderrabatter og meget mere.

Bemyndiggørelse af vores medarbejdere

https://www.siemensgamesa.com/sustainability/employees

Hvordan forestiller du dig fremtiden?

https://youtu.be/12Sm678tjuY

Vores globale team er frontløbere, når det gælder om at takle klimakrisen og reducere CO2-udslippet – den største udfordring, vi står overfor.

Yderligere information

For yderligere information vedrørende rekrutteringsprocessen kan du kontakte manageren, Brian Schmidt-Bjørnskov, via +45 30 37 53 69 eller den primære rekrutteringskonsulent, Nisha Deshpande, via e-mail nisha.deshpande.ext@siemensgamesa.com . Husk venligst at anføre job-ID’et i denne e-mail. Job-ID’et ser således ud: R-08701.

Vi gør venligst opmærksom på, at denne e-mail ikke må bruges til at sende ansøgninger eller CV’er og at disse i givet fald ikke vil komme i betragtning.

Se venligst nedenstående link for mere information omkring vores arbejde i Danmark:

https://www.siemensgamesa.com/explore/journal/wind-engineers-in-denmark

Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a work environment that is free from discrimination and where employees are treated with dignity and respect. Employment at Siemens Gamesa is based solely on an individual's merit and qualifications, which are directly related to job competence. Siemens Gamesa does not discriminate against any employee or job applicant on the basis of race, ethnicity, nationality, ancestry, genetic information, citizenship, religion, age, gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, rules or regulations. We adhere to these principles in all aspects of employment, including recruiting, hiring, training, compensation, promotion and benefits.



We are driven by people - from more than 100 different countries, they build the company we are every day. Our diverse and inclusive culture encourages us to think outside the box, speak without fear, and be bold. We value the flexibility that our smart-working arrangements, our digital disconnection framework and our family-friendly practices bring to the new way of working.
Show more

Title: Unsolicited Applications
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you our new colleague?

Do you want to be part of an exciting journey where you will get plenty of responsibility and influence? Then you need to read on!

We are looking for passionate and curious people who want to drive and execute projects within the field of digital transformation. Our portfolio of customers is diverse from the life science industry to the entertainment industry – and still expanding. No project is the same, and the energy is high. You will have a dynamic work week where you will be responsible for driving projects, setting the agenda for our customers, and playing a pivotal role in executing project deliveries. We are a small family that typically works in cross-functional teams supporting with different capabilities to create greater value for our clients.

We are looking for strategic and technical wizards within the data and analytics sphere. If you are interested in working with us, don’t hesitate to send us an application.

What do we offer?

Intellishore has a flat hierarchy meaning that our Intellishorians will get the chance to take ownership of specific projects – both internal and external. You will experience a steep learning curve but with the great support of your fellow Intellishorians. We are a collective that believes in helping people and that working closely together across disciplines brings greater value than working in silos.

And do not worry about whether you have too much or too little experience. We are always looking for new passionate people to join our family, and your title will be matched your level of seniority and expertise.

Here is why Intellishore is a great place to work

1 | Challenging projects

Exciting and challenging consultant role in strategic and technical client projects

2 | Entrepreneurial work environment

A dynamic and entrepreneurial environment with ambitious colleagues

3 | Influence

Unique opportunity to influence our journey with your areas of expertise

4 | Strategic seminars

Strategic seminars (in previous years, we've been to England, South Africa, Japan, India, China, Iceland, and Germany)

5 | Sustainable consulting

A chance to build a sustainable consulting career with high levels of flexibility and many fantastic social events

6 | Data & analytics

Learn about the exciting and fast-changing industry of data and all the surrounding aspects

Apply now

If you are interested in working with us, please fill out the application form. Please note that we will only be able to respond to candidates whose profiles match our current requirements.

For more information, please reach out to Sofie Freund: sfr@intellishore.dk / +45 93 98 17 27.

At the moment, we are only accepting applications from applicants inside of the EU or the Nordics.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
It’s an exciting time to join Tactile. We're a diverse team of storytellers, puzzle enthusiasts and casual mobile game creators. Our story began in 2008 in the heart of beautiful Copenhagen, and since then we have experienced continuous growth, establishing ourselves as one of the largest gaming companies in Denmark. In more recent years, we have been scaling fast, in big part thanks to the success of a little game called Lily’s Garden. Now we’re on a mission to solidify our position as one of the leaders in creating out-of-the-ordinary casual puzzle games.







🚀 Your role & impact




We are currently growing our Analytics team and are on the search for Game Analysts to support our Product and LiveOps functions.




Our analysts are embedded directly within our game teams, ensuring each team has dedicated experts who understand the intricacies of data and their unique needs. Your role will be crucial in validating decisions with data, offering valuable insights to shape product roadmaps, and fostering a culture of backing up decisions with data. This means you will have a real impact on the game and contribute to enhancing our players’ experience.




So, if you are super passionate about games or mobile tech and have data deeply embedded in your DNA, then you might just be our missing piece! 🧩




📍 This role is based in our beautiful Copenhagen office, as we truly believe that when talented people work closely together, amazing things happen! Please note that we cannot offer relocation support or visa sponsorship for this role.




Here’s what you'll do on the day-to-day:

Analyse the performance of the game to help the Product/LiveOps team understand player behaviour, what to improve in the game and what is the estimated impact of each improvement
Create compelling dashboards to monitor key metrics of the game
Work closely with the Product/LiveOps team to design, analyse and derive conclusions from A/B tests
Help game designers and product specialists to balance game features
Work with developers to define the necessary tracking data points in the game
Present your findings to stakeholders (product or LiveOps team members) and propose courses of action or improvements to the game
Work closely with the rest of the game analysts on the team and brainstorm on how to solve problem




What we’re looking for:

Strong background in data analytics
Proficiency with SQL
High proficiency in presenting analyses and results to all audiences, from senior stakeholders to junior colleagues and in particular to non-technical teammates
Experience applying analytic techniques in order to understand user behaviour and their interactions
A good understanding of applied statistics (such as sampling, hypothesis testing and ab testing)
Experience with data visualisation tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau)




You'll make us extra excited if you also have:

Prior experience working within gaming/mobile apps
Python/R knowledge




What’s in it for you?

🌆 Beautiful office space with probably the best view in Copenhagen

🩺 Pension and private health insurance

💻 A chance to work with the latest tools and technology

📚 Opportunities for individual growth with development talks as well as workshops, books and courses

🌮 Daily, healthy organic breakfast and lunch prepared by our professional chefs in-house

🥳 Social activities, including game nights, book club, Friday bar and more

🔍 Free Danish lessons with our in-house Danish teacher







We look forward to receiving your application! 👋

Show more

Title: Data Analyst for Universal Music Denmark
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Universal Music Group is the world’s leading music company with representation in 71 countries. With legendary labels such as Def Jam, Capitol Records, Interscope, Island Records and Virgin, Universal Music has a unique mix of new talents, established artists and superstars.

The Commercial Department at Universal Music Denmark is UMG’s in-house Digital Marketing, Commercial, and Insights Hub. The Data Analyst position will be part of the Central North Europe (CNE) Analytics team, UMG’s hybrid full-stack analytics division covering the Nordic and Benelux regions.

As a Data Analyst you collaborate with the The Commercial team based in Copenhagen on supporting our labels and artists. You’ll be providing analysis and insights, that helps them make decisions on release- and marketing strategies.

The focus of the Data Analyst will furthermore be on supporting data projects across the organization with a particular focus on reporting and transforming data from a number of audience and commercial platforms, so that the output can feed into further process e.g. Machine Learning, reports and dashboards.

This role will help implement strategic data projects, as well as support day to day ad-hoc requirements. This may include building and maintaining data solutions, new workflows and ensure timely and accurate delivery of data across the business.

Responsibilities



Lead projects with hands-on analysis and modeling, drawing from multiple of analytical methods to choose the right tool and right level of complexity appropriate for the business challenges.
Engage broadly with the organization to identify, prioritize, frame, and structure analytics projects and/or tools.
Identify and communicate the challenges and opportunities found through data and translate these to non technical stakeholders.
Articulate business questions and use mathematical techniques to arrive at an answer using data. Translate analysis results into business recommendations.
Visualising data: to produce clear and engaging dashboards and reports.
Ensuring smooth handover of reports and dashboards as required: ensuring processes are repeatable and well documented.



Experience/Skills:

Necessary:



Bachelor degree in a field such as Machine Learning, Science, Applied Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, or Economics.
Fluency in a querying language (SQL, Hadoop/Hive)
1+ years of relevant working experience in an analytical role.
Experience processing, filtering, and presenting large quantities (Millions to Billions of rows) of from different product groups and business functions
Experience of cloud computing, ideally GCP with experience of uploading and creating tables of data within these platforms and optimizing tables for use by vizualisation and BI tools. Eg. Azure, Redshift, Snowflake or BigQuery.
Experience with dashboard tools like Looker Studio, Power BI og Tableau



Desirable:



Master’s degree in a field such as Machine Learning, Science, Applied Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, or Economics.
Knowledge in scripting or computing language (Python, R etc.)
Experience in the streaming media industry or other subscription-based service.



We encourage everyone to apply and we prefer applications written in english, but as we are a primarily Danish speaking company with a heavy focus on Danish language music, being native or having some Danish language skills is an advantage.

If you are interested, apply here. Salary is based on qualification.

The workplace is at our office in Copenhagen.

Start: June 1st (or earlier if possible)

Deadline for applying: April 9th.


Show more

  • Bachelor degree in a field such as Machine Learning, Science, Applied Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, or Economics.
  • Fluency in a querying language (SQL, Hadoop/Hive)
  • 1+ years of relevant working experience in an analytical role.
  • Experience processing, filtering, and presenting large quantities (Millions to Billions of rows) of from different product groups and business functions
  • Experience of cloud computing, ideally GCP with experience of uploading and creating tables of data within these platforms and optimizing tables for use by vizualisation and BI tools. Eg. Azure, Redshift, Snowflake or BigQuery.
  • Experience with dashboard tools like Looker Studio, Power BI og Tableau


Desirable:


  • Master’s degree in a field such as Machine Learning, Science, Applied Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, or Economics.
  • Knowledge in scripting or computing language (Python, R etc.)
  • Experience in the streaming media industry or other subscription-based service.


We encourage everyone to apply and we prefer applications written in english, but as we are a primarily Danish speaking company with a heavy focus on Danish language music, being native or having some Danish language skills is an advantage.

If you are interested, apply here. Salary is based on qualification.

The workplace is at our office in Copenhagen.

Start: June 1st (or earlier if possible)

Deadline for applying: April 9th.

Title: Junior Data Process Executive
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At YouGov, we aim to provide key insights into consumer behaviour, including who buys what, where, how much, how often, and most importantly, why (or why not). We pride ourselves on delivering high-quality, uninterrupted data, expert consultancy, and unparalleled expertise to help our clients enhance customer experiences at every stage of the shopper journey.




To achieve our mission, it's essential that our panel data meets the highest quality standards. The Junior Data Process Executive will support our Panel Management team in maintaining our panels in Denmark and Sweden.

The Junior Data Process Executive will enhance the efficiency of our team by streamlining processes and improving data quality. This position is perfect for someone detail-oriented, curious about automation, and driven to make a meaningful impact. The Junior Data Process Executive will collaborate with experienced panel management experts who will guide you through our processes.




You Will:

Panel Data Management: Organize, clean, and maintain panel data for analysis, including repetitive tasks that require consistent attention.
Process Improvement Collaboration: Identify repetitive tasks that could benefit from automation or optimization and support their implementation.
Support Data Quality & Validation: Maintain high data standards with automated quality checks and consistency monitoring.
Communication Support: Assist colleagues in their panel support tasks, including handling phone calls and emails.
Language Skills: Proficiency in either Swedish or Danish (knowledge of both is a plus). The official language of our company is English, and effective communication is expected. You should feel comfortable reaching out to colleagues in our expert centers across Europe.
Technical Skills: Interest in data handling, technology, and IT. Comfortable with Excel and basic knowledge of the Microsoft Suite. Familiarity with scripting/programming languages (e.g., Python, R), automation tools (e.g., Power Automate, Apache Airflow), and advanced Excel skills (e.g., macros, VBA, Power Query) would be considered a plus.
Educational Background: A bachelor’s degree in Data Management, Data Science, Automation, IT, or a related field is a strong asset, but a can-do attitude is most crucial.
Experience: Previous roles in data management, automation, software scripting or coding, or panel management is considered an advantage.




You Have:

Adaptable and Eager to Learn: Excited about evolving technologies and processes.
Tech-Savvy and Data-Driven: Enthusiastic about data, automation, and tech tools.
Detail-Oriented: Understand the importance of data accuracy and work carefully with information to solve challenges.
Independent and Solution-Oriented: Have a strong attitude towards finding solutions on your own and being self-reliant, while also knowing when to seek support from colleagues.




What We Offer:

Career Development: On-the-job training and professional development.
Full time position: a Danish employment contract with a standard 36-hour workweek
Flexible Work Environment: Hybrid work options, allowing flexibility between remote work and our new offices located in Copenhagen (Kødbyen), near the Central Station, making it easily accessible by train, including from Sweden (e.g., Malmö or Lund).
Growth Opportunities: Opportunities for advancement within the company.




Show more

Title: Senior Games Analyst - RMG
Description:
Carry1st is Africa's leading games publisher and monetization platform, helping top global companies grow players and revenue in high-potential markets. We operate the region's fastest-growing web shop for top-ups of digital content and a payment platform that boosts revenue up to 10x in markets with low credit card penetration but high demand for digital goods.

Our partners include Activision, EA, Riot Games, and Netease. Backed by investors like a16z, Bitkraft, Google, Konvoy, Riot Games, Sony, and Nas, we're solving hard problems at the intersection of gaming, fintech, and digital commerce.

As Senior Games Analyst, you will be responsible for driving enjoyable player experiences and sustainable player LTV by analysing in-game behavioural data, progression trends, and purchase propensities.

You will be the go-to analyst for generating efficient insights on games engagement and games economy - supporting our Product teams in driving game evolution to success. As a senior analyst in our Data org, you will work closely with our VP Data in developing frameworks for scaling games analytics as our titles multiply.

You will ...


Develop core framework - models, insights, metrics - for understanding the success factor of a game by exploring various methodologies of understanding player engagement, player retention, and game economics
Translate and tailor this framework for specific games to understand ongoing performance and long-term trends via effective dashboards - KPIs and visualisations
Develop behavioural and player value segmentations that drive deeper thinking about game economies and player lifecycles
Translate the previous into concrete strategies for driving deposit conversion, cross-game engagement; plus tactical optimisation of bonus deployment and user acquisition
Partner with Product stakeholders and take the technical lead in designing experiments that explore different scenarios and key dependencies
Bank general customer and game insights to drive Carry1st's strategic direction via new business models



Requirements

What makes you a great candidate?


Degree in Economics, Physics, Statistics, Complex Systems or similar
Minimum 3 years experience in mobile games analytics, with specific experience in real money gaming
Strong mathematical and statistical acumen
Solid SQL skills and practical analytics/data science experience with Python
Strong analytical and problems solving skills as a foundation for adaptability in an ambiguous and agile environment of diverse backgrounds
Ability to effectively communicate complex insights and hypotheses to business stakeholders



Benefits

What will it be like to work at Carry1st?

Carry1st is a fast-growing, dynamic place to work. And while we are laser focused on building the flagship mobile internet company in Africa, our team is fully remote and 100% global - with people in 25+ countries! At Carry1st, you will...


Build awesome, industry-changing products, every day
Grow with a VC-backed startup at the intersection of gaming, fintech, and web3
Work from anywhere in the world with international teammates
Own shares in the Company - enabling you to benefit from the value you create



Some Additional Perks...


Co-working excursions: Travel to meet your colleagues in cities around the world
Awesome equipment: Get everything you need to work effectively
Remote working allowance: Put an additional $600 / year to optimise your WFH experience
Learning and development: Attend courses, conferences and training events
Social events: Participate in regular company events to relax and connect with teammates
Birthday leave: Enjoy a paid day off on your special day


We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it's the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger. Join us!

Learn More About Carry1st...


Andreessen Horowitz shared why they invested in Carry1st
VentureBeat announced that Carry1st has raised $27 million to develop and publish mobile games in Africa
Remerge hosted Cordel on a podcast to discuss Carry1st and the African gaming market
Show more

Title: Student Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We’re searching for a Student Analyst to join our Commercial team based in Copenhagen Denmark!




About PureGym:




Founded in 2009, the PureGym Group is one of the largest gym operators in Europe and provides high-quality, low-cost fitness facilities. The Group has more than 2million members across 500+ gyms and holds market leading positions across the UK, Denmark and Switzerland. By providing quality gyms at affordable prices, and where everybody is welcome, we help more people in more places live healthier lives.




The Role




PureGym is looking for a Student Analyst (approx. 15-20 hours per week) to play a key role in supporting the business in making data-led commercial decisions. The essence of the role is to conduct performance tracking for us to spot and react to developments in a timely manner and to conduct ad hoc analyses to answer questions related to strategic or operational opportunities.




The Commercial Analyst will be part of a small but highly capable Commercial Management team, located in PureGym DK’s headquarters in Valby. However, you will be a part of the overall Group, which covers PureGym businesses in DK, UK and CH and a number of franchises around the world.

Therefore, the Student Analyst will have a broad interaction with colleagues from all functional areas as well as across different geographies.




Key Responsibilities:




The Student Analyst will have a leading role in the following:




Recurring performance reviews: Carry out recurring performance reviews, commenting on findings and trends
Commercial analysis: Support decision-making in the organization by conducting and presenting ad hoc analysis on business challenges
Price management: Support in generating overviews of prices, changes to member privileges and the associated performance
Execution of changes: Liaise with other teams (mainly IT, Marketing, Operations) to conduct tests to optimize commercial model/mechanisms and implement the resultant changes
Competitor analysis: Track trends in the industry and our competitive landscape




The Person




We are looking for an ambitious individual with the following core attributes:




Curious and driven: You constantly seek to learn and find new and better ways of doing things; not just solving problems but actively looking for how to improve any given situation
Love data crunching: You thrive working with large and complex data sets, finding the underlying patterns and insights
Highly structured: You enjoy bringing order to chaos and have an eye for detail – you probably like to organize your bookshelf by size or alphabet.
Operational mindset: You take pride in having a specific area of responsibility and working continuously on improving and executing this area over time.




The ideal candidate has the following qualifications:




At least one year left of study, preferably within an analytical area
Ideally has previous working experience from a full-time position, another student job or internship
Strong business acumen and a solid methodological toolkit from your studies, capable of reflecting and advising on the best approach from case to case
Ability to work with various data sources, ranging from BI data over surveys to more qualitative data
Experienced in Excel, working quickly and efficiency with all the main formulas
Speak and write English fluently
Ability to work on Mondays would be appreciated but not a necessity




Our Values




Make a difference. Excite and inspire others. ‘Own it’ and be the best we can be.

Stand Shoulder to Shoulder. Collaborate and share with each other. Include everyone and embrace uniqueness.

Focus on the detail. Care about the little things. Have determination and resilience to get the job done.

Play to Win. Improve and innovate – never get complacent. Challenge ourselves and each other. Celebrate our success.




** Please apply with your CV in English **




PureGym is proud to be an equal opportunities employer. Our company mantra is ‘Everybody Welcome’ and we are dedicated to promoting a diverse and inclusive place to work. From a hiring standpoint, we welcome applicants from all backgrounds and are committed to ensuring that our PureGym colleagues reflect the diversity of the nation as well as our millions of gym members we serve.

Title: Data Analytics Consultant
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
HTML:
Copenhagen, hybrid

This role is part of our Data team in Copenhagen. At DEPT®, we combine data, technology and marketing to solve brands’ business problems and drive revenue through a variety of digital solutions.

Job Purpose

As an Analytics Consultant at DEPT®, you work with our clients on the best data setup, implement these and educate the clients in the world of Analytics. Of course this role has its challenges. The death of the cookie is near, and in this role you will consult our clients to deal with this new reality. How do they need to set up their server-side measurement? Which new products and features should we test? How can we make the best use of Consent Mode, conversion uploads and more? And GA4. The end of the session, which is changing analytics like we know it. You like to dive into these questions and want to help our clients answer them. As an Analytics Consultant, you are the absolute expert in data collection and solving complex analytics cases. You know how to create and implement measurement setups, take care of server-to-server connections between owned and marketing platforms and help clients to implement the best data collection setup.

Key Responsibilities

  • Manage and configure tag management systems (eg. GTM) to ensure accurate data collection;
  • Develop measurement plans in collaboration with clients;
  • Troubleshoot and fix data discrepancies & tracking issues;
  • Conduct audits of data collection setups;
  • Collaborate with development teams to develop and maintain tracking across digital platforms;
  • Use data visualisation tools (eg. Looker Studio, Power BI) to present data in an easily understandable format;
  • Consult with clients and help them take their analytics setup to the next level.


What We Are Looking For

  • At least 2 years of experience in a data role, preferably at agency side;
  • Hands-on experience with Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager;
  • Are proficient in Javascript;
  • Maybe you don't have the technical skills yet, but are eager to learn more about SQL, Python and Cloud;
  • Full working proficiency in the English language - spoken and written (proficiency in Danish is considered a plus, not a requirement);
  • Somebody who can switch from serious to play in a heartbeat;
  • An analytical, technical, independent profile with good communication skills.


WE OFFER

  • A healthy, varied and delicious lunch at the office;
  • A lot of fun social events such as Friday bars, company parties, team events, etc.;
  • A flexible, hybrid working policy and a great workplace in our awesome office in Christianshavn;
  • A reputation for doing good. DEPT® has been a Certified B Corp® since 2021 and named ‘Agency of the Year’ at both The Lovies and The Webby Awards;
  • Awesome clients. Whether big or small, local or global — at DEPT® you’ll get the opportunity to work with clients of all sizes and across all industries;
  • The opportunity for possibility. We want to enable you to do what you do best and help you develop your skills further with training and development;
  • Stay happy and healthy with a contribution to your health through the OpenUp platform, gym and wellness discounts, and healthy lunches at the office;
  • Global annual DEPT® Cares Month in which employees come together and donate their skills to support local charities.


WHO ARE WE?

We are pioneers at heart. What does that mean? We are always looking forward, thinking of what we can create tomorrow that does not exist today. We were born digital and we are a new model of agency, with a deep skillset in tech and marketing. That’s why we hire curious, self-driven, talented people who never stop innovating.

Our culture is big enough to cope and small enough to care. Meaning, that with people across 30+ countries, we’re big enough to provide you with the best tools, global opportunities, and benefits that help you thrive. While acting small by investing in you, your growth, your team, and giving you the autonomy to solve our clients problems, no matter where you are in the world.

DIVERSITY, EQUITY & INCLUSION

At DEPT®, we take pride in creating an inclusive workplace where everyone has an equal opportunity to thrive. We actively seek to recruit, develop, nurture, and retain talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, with varying skills and perspectives.

Not sure you meet all qualifications? Apply, and let us decide! Research shows that women and members of underrepresented groups tend not to apply for jobs when they think they may not meet every requirement, when in fact they do. We believe in giving everyone a fair chance to shine.

We also encourage you to reach out to us and discuss any reasonable adjustments we can make to support you throughout the recruitment process and your time with us.

Want to know more about our dedication to diversity, equity, and inclusion? Check out our efforts here.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Hvidovre Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Data Engineer / Analytics Engineer




NTG Nordic Transport Group (NTG)

NTG is listed on Nasdaq OMX Nordic and is one of the fastest-growing freight forwarders in Europe. Since the Group’s foundation in Denmark in 2011, our unique partnering-model has successfully expanded NTG to a revenue of more than DKK 8 billion in 2023, presence in +30 countries and ~100 companies. Our culture is characterized as entrepreneurial, trusting, and accountable.




The Position

We are currently looking for a Data Engineer or Analytics Engineer to join our newly established BI team at our Global Headquarters in Hvidovre (Copenhagen), Denmark. Your main responsibilities will be:

· Develop and maintain our Data Warehouse platform

· Build and maintain data ingestion pipelines in DBT

· Design and create Analytics Models for consumption in PowerBI

· Collaborate with business users to create concise and meaningful data assets that fit our platform architecture

· Advise on the design, and optimization of our data storage solutions, ensuring best practices are followed and influencing the strategic direction of our Data Warehouse.

You will work closely with our Head of Group Business Intelligence to support our broader organization within IT, Finance and operations.




The Candidate

· Possess a strong analytical mindset

· Ability to work independently and as part of a team

· Solid communication and collaboration skills

· Previous experience with solutions like Snowflake, Databricks hosted on one of the big cloud providers (Azure, AWS or GCP)

· Proficiency with Python, SQL, dbt

· Data modelling and schema design for relational databases

· Fluent in English (Danish is a plus)

· Experience with PowerBI is a plus




How do I apply?

If you would like to join our team, apply for the position by clicking the button below. We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible.

We hope we got your attention and look forward to receiving your application!




If you have any questions about the position, please don't hesitate to reach out to Martin Staal-Olsen (mso@ntg.com), Christian Herskind Louring (clo@ntg.com) or Tomasz Kotarski (tko@ntg.com

Show more

Title: Studentermedarbejder: Business Intelligence i ambitiøst konsulenthus
Description:
Er du en analytisk og teknisk dygtig studerende med interesse for Business Intelligence, dataanalyse og datamodellering? Vil du udvikle dine færdigheder i Power BI, SQL og Python i et ambitiøst konsulenthus? Så er du måske den helt rigtige til Human Engage!

 

HVAD ER DET FOR ET JOB?

Human Engage er et konsulenthus, der arbejder med kvantitative og kvalitative analyser for at skabe indsigt og forandring i organisationer. Vi har brug for en studentermedhjælper ca. 10-15 timer om ugen til at styrke vores arbejde med dataanalyse og visualisering. Din primære opgave vil være at udvikle og optimere vores BI-løsninger, herunder:

·       Udvikling af dashboards og rapporter i Power BI

·       Datahåndtering og analyse med Python (fx pandas/numpy)

·       Datamodellering med fokus på Star Schema




HVEM ER DU?

·       Du er i gang med en bachelor- eller kandidatuddannelse inden for business intelligence, data science, datalogi, økonomi med fokus på BI eller et beslægtet felt

·       Du har erfaring med Power BI, SQL og Python (pandas/numpy)

·       Du har gerne forståelse for datamodellering, herunder Star Schema

·       Du arbejder struktureret og analytisk

·       Du kan tage ansvar og arbejde selvstændigt samt indgå i et mindre team

·       Du har interesse for at omsætte data til indsigt og beslutningsgrundlag




HVEM ER VI?

Human Engage er et ambitiøst konsulenthus med et ønske om at skabe forandring og udvikling i organisationer – altid med udgangspunkt i valid viden og klar data. Gensidig respekt, ønsket om udvikling og tillid til hinanden er essentielt for os, og vi ser en stor værdi i forskellighed og rummelighed.  Vi er et mindre team på under ti personer fordelt på to kontorer i henholdsvis Odense (havnen) og Århus (Store Torv), hvor arbejdspladsen er præget af store ambitioner, gode relationer og ikke mindst højt humør!

 

HVOR OG HVORNÅR?

Din primære arbejdsplads vil være på et af vores kontorer – vi ønsker den bedste kandidat.  

Vi vurderer indkomne ansøgninger løbende, og forventer opstart snarest muligt.

 

Læs mere om os her: https://hnengage.com/om-os/  

 

KONTAKT OS:

Partner Henrik Kjærgaard Clausen

Tlf.: 28 10 11 80

Mail: hkc@hnengage.com

Show more
HTML:
Er du en analytisk og teknisk dygtig studerende med interesse for Business Intelligence, dataanalyse og datamodellering? Vil du udvikle dine færdigheder i Power BI, SQL og Python i et ambitiøst konsulenthus? Så er du måske den helt rigtige til Human Engage!

 

HVAD ER DET FOR ET JOB?

Human Engage er et konsulenthus, der arbejder med kvantitative og kvalitative analyser for at skabe indsigt og forandring i organisationer. Vi har brug for en studentermedhjælper ca. 10-15 timer om ugen til at styrke vores arbejde med dataanalyse og visualisering. Din primære opgave vil være at udvikle og optimere vores BI-løsninger, herunder:

·       Udvikling af dashboards og rapporter i Power BI

·       Datahåndtering og analyse med Python (fx pandas/numpy)

·       Datamodellering med fokus på Star Schema


HVEM ER DU?

·       Du er i gang med en bachelor- eller kandidatuddannelse inden for business intelligence, data science, datalogi, økonomi med fokus på BI eller et beslægtet felt

·       Du har erfaring med Power BI, SQL og Python (pandas/numpy)

·       Du har gerne forståelse for datamodellering, herunder Star Schema

·       Du arbejder struktureret og analytisk

·       Du kan tage ansvar og arbejde selvstændigt samt indgå i et mindre team

·       Du har interesse for at omsætte data til indsigt og beslutningsgrundlag

Title: Business Intelligence Student Analyst
Description:
Drive Meaningful Change

Are you ready to support an agile and dynamic BI team and grow your skills in data-driven decision-making? Join our team at Abacus Medicine Group, where you’ll play an integral part in shaping business intelligence solutions and contributing to impactful projects. You will be part of a fast-paced, collaborative environment, gaining hands-on experience while enhancing your technical capabilities.




Get a Glimpse of Our World

The Business Intelligence team is a young, diverse group of professionals who are passionate about data and always eager to learn. We work closely with various departments and stakeholders across the organization, ensuring that data insights are delivered in a meaningful way. We value curiosity, innovation, and collaboration within our team, making it an exciting place to grow both professionally and personally.

As a member of the BI team, you’ll find yourself working alongside experienced BI developers and supporting various business units, all while contributing to high-impact solutions. If you’re looking for a team that’s flexible, fast-moving, and always adapting to new challenges, this is the right fit for you.




Realize Your Opportunities as BI Student Analyst

The Business Intelligence Student Analyst will support the BI team by managing incoming tickets and tasks, ensuring they are resolved or assigned appropriately. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work with a variety of stakeholders, assist in developing BI solutions, and enhance the existing technical infrastructure. You will also gain hands-on experience working with Power BI and cloud technologies, while collaborating on projects and participating in data analyses.




Your main responsibilities include:

Managing incoming tickets for the BI team and ensuring tasks are resolved or assigned as appropriate
Building and maintaining relationships with internal stakeholders, representing the BI team’s interests
Monitoring and maintaining the BI Power BI platform
Contributing to the development of technical infrastructure, including cloud environments and front-end tools
Participating in ad-hoc analyses and assisting with analysis projects in coordination with the manager




Fuel for Your Success in the Role

We are looking for someone who is proactive, curious, self-driven, and reliable, with the ability to work both independently and as part of a team. You should be eager to learn and adapt in a dynamic environment, with a strong understanding of data fundamentals.

Furthermore, we hope the following points describe you:

You are in the final year of a Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Economics, Information Systems or a Data- related field.
You might already have some relevant student job experience.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, etc.).
Familiarity with BI tools such as Power BI.
Basic understanding of SQL and data modeling techniques.
Exposure to cloud platforms like Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud is a plus.
Initial experience or coursework in data integration tools (e.g., SSIS, Data Factory, or Talend).




Would you like to know more about us?

If you want to apply for the position, please follow the link and attach your CV and cover letter.




Interested?

Follow us on Instagram and LinkedIn and get an insight into everyday life at Abacus Medicine. For job openings, check our Career page.




Moving Healthcare. Moving You.

In Abacus Medicine Group, you’ll experience the power of Moving Healthcare. With our change mindset, we're moving the industry and improving healthcare as we broaden access to medicine.

But it's not just about moving healthcare, it's about Moving You. You’ll be part of a caring community of more than 1,500 people across the World. With us, you will be valued, empowered, and have a direct impact on driving change. Let's access the future of medicine and make a difference together. Your move.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (Senior Foundations Analyst)
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious goal: to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together.

40% of all food produced in the world is wasted. And that has a huge impact on the health of our planet, with 10% of greenhouse gas emissions coming from food waste.

We’re more than an app: we are a certified B Corporation with a mission to empower everyone to take action against food waste, so alongside our marketplace app, we create educational tools, explore new business solutions - such as our Retail Technologies offering, and influence legislation to help reduce food waste.

We’re growing fast: Our community of 108 million registered users and 245,000 active partners across 19 countries, have together already prevented 395+ million meals from going to waste - avoiding over 1066.000 tonnes of CO2e!

Your mission

We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst (called "Senior Foundations Analyst" internally) to strengthen our use of data to inform our most business critical decisions. On a daily basis, you will be working with business leaders across various functional areas to inform how they measure success, how they use data to inform strategic decisions, and ensure they have the data visibility and tools they need to make progress on those strategies every day.

Your role


Support business leaders in identifying the right KPIs to drive business performance
Provide data-driven guidance to business leaders on key strategic decisions
Design and deliver self-service tools to various functional groups for operational excellence
Generate new ideas for how to leverage the data we have to drive business performance
Elevate data literacy across the organisation, with an eye toward consistency, ease of understanding, and educating on the right way to use data in each function
Elevate the Global Analytics team by sharing best practices and learnings and offering ad-hoc guidance to other team members on their projects


Requirements


You have previous experience in analytical roles overtime
You are strongly proficient in Looker
You are strongly proficient in SQL
You have a breadth of experience mapping business questions to data problems
You are a great communicator and storyteller - someone who enjoys helping non-technical audiences see what you see in the numbers!
You are driven by the “why” behind the work that you do, always eager to ask an extra question to make sure you’re solving for the right thing
You have experience managing multiple projects
You are passionate about data literacy
You have a proactive mindset and work well in a team environment


Our values


We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We believe in a #oneteam.
We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
We build a legacy: We’re proud of the change we’re driving.
We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.


What We Have To Offer


An opportunity to work in a global social-impact company and certified B Corporation! where you can see a real and tangible impact in your role.
To be an integral part of our Data & Analytics team. We are eager for you to make an impact and contribute to the role of analytics across key decisions and our solution processes. Your insights are valuable, and we are here to listen.
Work-life balance is important to us! Focus on the job to be done, not the hours spent, there is no need for overtime.
We trust in our employees and encourage an autonomous environment that provides several opportunities for employees to contribute, develop and take ownership of their work in a way that works for them.
To be part of an international company, with over 1,300+ colleagues across 19 countries that are on the same important mission.
An informal environment, working alongside 190+ passionate people within Tech & Product
We celebrate our differences and our successes and have a strong values-driven team culture.
We work in a hybrid set-up and value in office work weekly.
We may be able to support you with a working visa in Copenhagen, please be prepared to discuss this topic further as your first stage interview.


How To Apply


We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
Submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.


Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it’s only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we’re allowed to be ourselves, and we’re committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.


Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Azure Data Engineer




Som Data Engineer hos cVation bygger du dataplatforme, datawarehouses samt laver MLOps løsninger i skyen for vores kunder. Vi arbejder med en række spændende teknologier, herunder Databricks, Fabric, Azure Machine Learning, Data Factory, Azure Synapse og Spark, og laver ikke bare dataudtræk, men bygger ting, der skal i Prod. Vi leder derfor efter flere profiler med erfaring indenfor enten MLOps, datawarehouses eller dataplatforme, som har lyst til at bygge dataløsninger for vores kunder.




cVation er et dansk udviklings- og konsulenthus, som bygger avancerede cloudløsninger på Azure med afsæt i markedets hurtigste og mest agile metoder. Cvation blev stiftet i 2014, har modtaget tre Børsen Gazeller og vundet Microsofts Partner Award for App Innovation tre år i træk. Vi arbejder dedikeret med agile arbejdsmetoder, DevOps og Test Driven Development, og er på forkant med mange af de nye teknologier, herunder IoT. Vi sætter en ære i at levere software af den højeste kvalitet, og tager desuden principperne fra DevOps og software engineering med i vores dataprojekter, hvilket betyder, at tests, Infrastructure as Code og automatisering er i fokus.




Hvilken rolle får du?




Du kommer til at arbejde på et af vores dataprojekter med et projektteam bestående af arkitekter, software udviklere og DevOps specialister. Du vil have fuldt fokus på ét projekt og være tilknyttet ét team ad gangen.




Din rolle bliver at




rådgive om og bygge datamigrerings- og datamoderniseringsprojekter
rådgive om og bygge datawarehouse/dataplatformsløsninger i skyen
rådgive om og bygge løsninger indenfor MLOps
bidrage til design og implementering af den optimale Azure infrastruktur
sikre, at alt opsætning og provisionering sker som infrastructure as code
fuldautomatiseret overvågning og skalering af løsninger




Hvad forventer vi af dig?




Du har en videregående uddannelse i data engineering, data science, Human centered AI el lign. fra DTU, ITU eller KU
Du har enten fullstack MLOps erfaring og kan skrive Python - eller måske kommer du i stedet med erfaring i at bygge datawarehouse og dataplatforme. Vi skal nok lære dig det, du mangler på Azure, IaC, MLOps etc.
Du vil gerne arbejde med de nyeste teknologier i Azure
Infrastructure as code er måden du arbejder på, f.eks. Bicep eller Terraform
Du har erfaring med nogle - og vil gerne blive klogere på - flere af følgende teknologier: Data Factory - Databricks - Fabric - Azure Synapse - Azure Machine Learning - MLflow - Spark - Data Warehouse - Data platform - Python - Azure DevOps, Powershell, Azure CLI, ARM templates, YAML, Bicep, Terraform, Git
Du vil gerne indgå i et agilt setup, hvor krav og retning hurtigt kan ændres, men hvor medbestemmelse og frihed er i højsædet
Du er flydende i skrift og tale på dansk og engelsk, og trives med at have den daglige kontakt med kunden
Du har evnen til at omsætte kundebehov til handling




Det vil være en fordel, hvis:

Du er vant til at arbejde som konsulent i et udviklingsteam i tæt samarbejde med arkitekter og software udviklere




Som person er du selvstændig, ansvarsbevidst, initiativrig, eksekverende og serviceminded. Du er drevet af at lære nyt og vild med at holde dig ajour med de nyeste metoder og teknologier. Du er engageret og motiveret i alt hvad du foretager dig. Hvis du også er glad for at sparre med dygtige kollegaer og trives med at løfte i flok, vil du passe perfekt ind hos os.




Hvad tilbyder vi?




Du kommer til at indgå i vores voksende team, hvor høj faglighed, innovation og arbejdsglæde er i højsæde. Det høje faglige niveau blandt dine kollegaer giver en unik mulighed for at arbejde med de bedste, og vi tager din faglige udvikling alvorligt. Vi har en flad organisation med et minimum af administration, hvor ledelsens døre altid er åbne, og der er god plads til både bordfodbold, fredagsbar, frokost på kajen og et aktivt liv udenfor arbejdstid. Flere gange om året afholder vi hackathons, hvor vi i teams dykker ned i præcis de emner, som udviklerne finder interessante. En del af vores kultur er også, at vi gerne ser alle komme med input til hvordan vi kan optimere, udvikle og forbedre cVation.




Hvorfor vælge os som din nye arbejdsplads?




Vores fundament er løsninger bygget på Microsoft Azure Cloud. Alle vores medarbejdere mestrer cloud-native udvikling og DevOps. Vi arbejder i projekter og engagerer os hands-on i fælles teams med vores kunder for at sikre kvalitet og effektiv videndeling.




Vi er passionerede omkring at hjælpe vores kunder med at få det maksimale ud af cloudteknologien. For os er cloud ikke blot infrastruktur eller et nyt datacenter i skyen. Teknologien giver virksomheder mulighed for at skabe væsentligt mere værdi og arbejde med agilitet og innovation på en helt ny måde.




Vi har været med fra starten, da cloud blev udviklet og tilgængeligt. Vi tilbyder således vores årelange erfaring og dybe cloud ekspertise samt en værktøjskasse med alle vores best practices i form af accelerationsplatformen CADD. Den dækker over gennemprøvede værktøjer, rammeværk, effektive udviklingsmetoder og færdige automatiseringskomponenter. Alt dette for at sikre, at projekter kommer hurtigt og sikkert fra start.




Du vil blive en del af en virksomhed, som tror på, at alle har betydning, og at det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde hver dag. Du vil få kollegaer, der er interesseret i at lære og har ønske om at blive de bedste til det, de gør. Vi tilbyder derfor gode muligheder for at udvikle dig.




Interesseret?




Klik på Easy Apply knappen, hvis du vil arbejde med de nyeste teknologier. Vi behandler din ansøgning fortroligt og arrangerer løbende interviews.




Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, eller vil du høre mere om cVation, er du meget velkommen til at kontakte:




Maiken Pelby, Head of People & Culture, T/ 42612828, map@cvation.com




Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!

Show more

  • Du vil gerne arbejde med de nyeste teknologier i Azure
  • Infrastructure as code er måden du arbejder på, f.eks. Bicep eller Terraform
  • Du har erfaring med nogle - og vil gerne blive klogere på - flere af følgende teknologier: Data Factory - Databricks - Fabric - Azure Synapse - Azure Machine Learning - MLflow - Spark - Data Warehouse - Data platform - Python - Azure DevOps, Powershell, Azure CLI, ARM templates, YAML, Bicep, Terraform, Git
  • Du vil gerne indgå i et agilt setup, hvor krav og retning hurtigt kan ændres, men hvor medbestemmelse og frihed er i højsædet
  • Du er flydende i skrift og tale på dansk og engelsk, og trives med at have den daglige kontakt med kunden
  • Du har evnen til at omsætte kundebehov til handling


Det vil være en fordel, hvis:

  • Du er vant til at arbejde som konsulent i et udviklingsteam i tæt samarbejde med arkitekter og software udviklere


Som person er du selvstændig, ansvarsbevidst, initiativrig, eksekverende og serviceminded. Du er drevet af at lære nyt og vild med at holde dig ajour med de nyeste metoder og teknologier. Du er engageret og motiveret i alt hvad du foretager dig. Hvis du også er glad for at sparre med dygtige kollegaer og trives med at løfte i flok, vil du passe perfekt ind hos os.


Hvad tilbyder vi?


Du kommer til at indgå i vores voksende team, hvor høj faglighed, innovation og arbejdsglæde er i højsæde. Det høje faglige niveau blandt dine kollegaer giver en unik mulighed for at arbejde med de bedste, og vi tager din faglige udvikling alvorligt. Vi har en flad organisation med et minimum af administration, hvor ledelsens døre altid er åbne, og der er god plads til både bordfodbold, fredagsbar, frokost på kajen og et aktivt liv udenfor arbejdstid. Flere gange om året afholder vi hackathons, hvor vi i teams dykker ned i præcis de emner, som udviklerne finder interessante. En del af vores kultur er også, at vi gerne ser alle komme med input til hvordan vi kan optimere, udvikle og forbedre cVation.


Hvorfor vælge os som din nye arbejdsplads?


Vores fundament er løsninger bygget på Microsoft Azure Cloud. Alle vores medarbejdere mestrer cloud-native udvikling og DevOps. Vi arbejder i projekter og engagerer os hands-on i fælles teams med vores kunder for at sikre kvalitet og effektiv videndeling.


Vi er passionerede omkring at hjælpe vores kunder med at få det maksimale ud af cloudteknologien. For os er cloud ikke blot infrastruktur eller et nyt datacenter i skyen. Teknologien giver virksomheder mulighed for at skabe væsentligt mere værdi og arbejde med agilitet og innovation på en helt ny måde.


Vi har været med fra starten, da cloud blev udviklet og tilgængeligt. Vi tilbyder således vores årelange erfaring og dybe cloud ekspertise samt en værktøjskasse med alle vores best practices i form af accelerationsplatformen CADD. Den dækker over gennemprøvede værktøjer, rammeværk, effektive udviklingsmetoder og færdige automatiseringskomponenter. Alt dette for at sikre, at projekter kommer hurtigt og sikkert fra start.


Du vil blive en del af en virksomhed, som tror på, at alle har betydning, og at det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde hver dag. Du vil få kollegaer, der er interesseret i at lære og har ønske om at blive de bedste til det, de gør. Vi tilbyder derfor gode muligheder for at udvikle dig.


Interesseret?


Klik på Easy Apply knappen, hvis du vil arbejde med de nyeste teknologier. Vi behandler din ansøgning fortroligt og arrangerer løbende interviews.


Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, eller vil du høre mere om cVation, er du meget velkommen til at kontakte:


Maiken Pelby, Head of People & Culture, T/ 42612828, map@cvation.com


Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!

Title: Commercial Business Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Copenhagen, Denmark

We are looking for a proactive and results-oriented Commercial Business Analyst to join our Digital Activation Analytics team under Group Commercial at Saxo Bank. In this role, you will play a key part in analyzing data to understand customer needs and suggesting improvements based on your findings as well as understanding and optimizing the impact of our TREA inspirational content, measuring what content strategies work and for which clients.

The ideal candidate will need to have a strong background in commercial operations, data analysis and cross-functional collaboration.

Key Responsibilities


Analyze data to identify trends and insights that can help improve our products and services.
Create and maintain dashboards to visualize data and track performance.
Track our digital engagement efforts such as how TREA inspirational content is impacting key KPIs: %Clients Active, %Multi-Asset and %NFC->NTC.
Identify, define, and quantify clients’ needs. Develop and maintain global and local “client buckets” clustering clients in similar situations and similar needs.
Collaborate with cross functional teams and local offices to identify successful strategies and areas for improvement. Share best practices and drive continuous improvement across all locations
Proactively suggest solutions based on data analysis to meet customer needs.
Identify which of our products, solutions and services address persona buckets’ needs in the most commercially viable way
Contribute to the strategy and advocate for automation of processes and tooling improvements.
Promote the adoption of a data-driven mindset and the benefits of A/B testing by educating our local offices and internal stakeholders.


Ideal Candidate


Experience in a commercial or business development role, preferably in a global context
Excellent skills in creating dashboards and visualizing data to support decision making
Ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams and multiple offices
Excellent collaboration and communication skills
Proactive and results-oriented mindset.
Familiarity with statistics and econometrics.
Experience with performance tracking and dashboard management
Knowledge of SQL, Power BI, Databricks, Adobe CDP, or Adobe Journey Optimizer is a plus.


Why Join Us

At Saxo Bank, we value innovation, collaboration, and a proactive approach to problem-solving. Join our team and help us shape the future of finance by providing valuable insights and solutions based on data.

Does this look good to you? Is there anything else you would like to add or change?

We get curious people invested in the world

When you work at Saxo, you become a Saxonian and part of a purpose-driven organisation, where good ideas are always taken seriously, and where you can make a true impact. We are invested in your development, and you can expect a robust career from day one when you join Saxo – no matter which role you take on.

You will join 2,500 other ambitious colleagues across 15 countries and become part of an international organisation. Working in Saxo, you will get to meet colleagues from many different cultures and backgrounds, and you should know that we value diversity and inclusion and see it as a genuine source of strength to drive growth, foster innovation and position us for long-term success.

We encourage an open feedback culture and supportive team environments enabling employees to grow and fulfil their career aspirations.

When you bring passion, curiosity, drive and team spirit, your learning journey will be dynamic and your career opportunities in Saxo will be immense.

At Saxo we don’t just offer a job – we offer an opportunity to invest in your future!

How To Apply

Click here to create an account and upload your resume and a short motivation. We look forward to getting to know you better!
Show more
