Title: Game Analytics Team Lead
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
It’s an exciting time to join Tactile. We're a diverse team of storytellers, puzzle enthusiasts and casual mobile game creators. Our story began in 2008 in the heart of beautiful Copenhagen, and since then we have experienced continuous growth, establishing ourselves as one of the largest gaming companies in Denmark. In more recent years, we have been scaling fast, in big part thanks to the success of a little game called Lily’s Garden. Now we’re on a mission to solidify our position as one of the leaders in creating out-of-the-ordinary casual puzzle games.

With more than 350 talented individuals, we are a mix of over 55 nationalities and 43% women. We truly appreciate the richness of different experiences and perspectives that Tactilers bring to the game. This is why we foster a lean organisational culture, in which each individual is encouraged to take responsibility, be open and grow in their own way. We pride ourselves in cultivating a studio environment that stays away from crunch, that fosters your skills no matter what your discipline is, and one that gives you a place to be creative alongside other passionate and invested storytellers.

🚀 Your Role & Impact

We are currently growing our Analytics team and are in the search for the Lead Game Analyst.

In this key role, you will be responsible for ensuring that the foundation of our data infrastructure for Lily's Garden game is solid and consistent (from as early on as possible), as well as contributing to a broader vision for our game analytics as a whole. You'll lead a team of game analysts, shape the vision for analytics, provide data-driven insights to senior leadership, and drive initiatives to improve processes and solutions across the company.

So if you have prior experience in data analytics, team leadership, along with a big interest in understanding how games work and what makes them successful, then you might just be our missing piece! 🧩

This role is based in our beautiful Copenhagen office, as we truly believe that when talented people work closely together, amazing things happen! We therefore offer full relocation support to those coming from outside of Denmark. Here’s what you'll do on the day-to-day:


You will uncover insights, identify challenges and opportunities and develop strategies for improving our games
Enhance our capabilities in detailed game analytics and operational reporting by shaping our data stack and platform
Managing one of our talented Data teams
You will be collaborating closely with the rest of the game team to establish, measure and track key metrics for success
Communicating key insights and findings to cross-functional teams
Keeping an up-to-date knowledge of project KPIs
Stay on top of the current industry trends and best practices, applying them where appropriate to enhance product insights capabilities


What we’re looking for:


Strong background in leading strategic data projects and mentoring a diverse team of data analysts
You have a proven track record of working in a senior capacity with multiple stakeholders in fast paced environments.
You have a strong background in data analytics and a good understanding of applied statistics (such as sampling, hypothesis testing and ab testing)
Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data and effectively communicate findings to all audiences to drive informed product decisions.
Strong technical skills, with proficiency in SQL and Python or other scripting languages
Experience with large data sets and data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Looker, PowerBI)


You'll make us extra excited if you also have:


Experience with casual mobile games and an understanding of today’s casual mobile games market


What’s in it for you?

🌆 Beautiful office space with probably the best view in Copenhagen

🩺 Pension and private health insurance

💻 A chance to work with the latest tools and technology

📚 Opportunities for individual growth with development talks as well as workshops, books and courses

🌮 Daily, healthy organic breakfast and lunch prepared by our professional chefs in-house

🥳 Social activities, including game nights, book club, Friday bar and more

✈️ Relocation package if you are coming from outside of Denmark

🔍 Free Danish lessons with our in-house Danish teacher

Our interview process

Submit your application via the fill-in form at the top of this page. This is the easiest and fastest way to get in touch with our recruiters. We foster an inclusive culture and accessible workplace and want to make sure we provide everyone with the same opportunities for success. This is why we encourage you to apply regardless of your gender, sexuality, age, nationality, neurodiversity or disability. We review applications based on competencies and experience, so please do tell us about your favourite projects and technologies.

After we review your application, you can expect to go through the following conversations: ☕ Introductory chat with your recruiter to make sure we’re aligned on the scope of the role and your skillset and to provide more context for you. 🤝 Chat with a Data analytics leadership member. 🧪 A test assignment, to see your skills in action. 🤝 In this final step, you’ll be meeting with the team to present your test solutions and discuss the more technical aspects of the role.

We are pretty thorough with our hiring process. It is important to us that we choose new Tactilers carefully - just as it is vital to ensure that we are the right place for you.‍

We want to ensure you have a great candidate experience whilst in our recruitment process. We will do everything we can within reason to make sure that your interview takes place in an environment that fairly and accurately assesses your skills. If you need assistance or accommodation, please let us know. We look forward to receiving your application! 👋
Show more

Title: Register in our candidate data base
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Veo is a global leader in AI-based sports camera technology. Our innovative, fully automatic camera solution enables sports teams to record matches and training sessions without a camera operator. We’re democratizing the world of sports by granting video analysis for teams on all levels—a privilege that used to be only for the few. More than 40,000 clubs in 90+ countries record their games every week.

Growing as fast as we do in Veo means that every day is different, exciting, and challenging, both on the front line and in the back office.

But that’s not the most remarkable thing about us.

The coolest thing is our people. We’ve attracted some of the brightest minds in the industry. They are the reason we can create a great product and do it while enjoying ourselves.

Does your dream job at Veo not appear on the list, then sign up in our candidate data base and we will get in contact with you if the right opportunity arises for you.

At Veo, you'll be part of a thriving work environment where every day brings new excitement. Our rapid growth ensures a diverse and ever-changing atmosphere. We believe in work-life balance and providing a positive culture that allows you to thrive personally and professionally.

Our Copenhagen office mirrors our innovative technology – with an indoor ball court, rooftop terrace, and well-equipped gym. We have created a facility that supports connecting disciplines across the business, facilitates creative thinking, and gives the space to engage with colleagues, our global partners, and the entire Veo community.

Diversity and differences are valuable assets for us. We value diversity and inclusion and welcome people from all backgrounds. If you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we still encourage you to apply.

We’re committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. And you may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Still interested? Join us at Veo and become a part of a team that delivers greatness and has a great time doing it.

We will invite for interviews continuously, so apply with LinkedIn or your resume as soon as possible.
Show more

Title: Student Assistant – Communication, Data analysis and Documentation
Description:
Are you a student skilled in creative communication and with a structured way of working? Would you like to support our PLM journey through collaboration with business partners? Are you keen to support new users on how to use our systems and share the good stories from our existing users?

Then come join us as Student Assistant 10-15 hours per week where you will get practical experience with exactly this!

Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) is about how we best manage our product data in VELUX. We are looking for a Student Assistant to support our team mainly with communication, data analysis and documentation.

What You Will Do

Joining our PLM team in Østbirk, you will report to the Director of PLM and become part of our team of 12 within the organization of Technology and Modularisation.

As a Student Assistant you will support our team with projects from our PLM roadmap, in a combination of working from our office and your home office.

Your tasks can be tailored to fit your profile, but will include:


Creating communication initiatives and assisting with communication of ongoing projects
Updating and maintaining our PLM SharePoint Site
Creating small learning and training videos to support our users
Communicate training initiatives to our users
Working with tools such as Camtasia, Canva and VideoScribe
Creating PowerBI reports and sharing insights by data analysis
Analysing survey results into actions
Describing and documenting business processes within the organization
Ad hoc tasks depending on your skills, e.g. assisting with presentations and workshops


Who You Are

We seek a student assistant ready to engage, learn and make a meaningful contribution in a collaborative team setting. You are skilled within visual and written communication, work in a structured way and take responsibility for your own tasks.

It is important that you are comfortable with frequent interactions with and reaching out to internal stakeholders on your own initiative. Moreover, you take a meticulous approach to handling documents with a high attention to the small but important details and you can communicate clearly and precisely when speaking with our stakeholders.

Furthermore, you:


Are enrolled in a study programme in Denmark (bachelor or master) within a relevant field, e.g. communication, design, business, engineering or other relevant education.
Are proficient in PowerPoint and maybe even some video editing tools
Have advanced skills in written and spoken English
Have experience with Microsoft Office 365 and a solid proficiency in IT systems in general


What We Offer

Become part of a department of skilled specialists in a technologically advanced, international environment that is changing the way we handle product data in VELUX.

You will work in a setting where knowledge is shared, and responsibility is given to those who show readiness and enthusiasm. We work as a team with a flat hierarchy to accomplish our goals. Mutual respect, commitment and courage are just some of our essential values.

We will provide you with the opportunities and inspiration to build a future within VELUX. Additionally, if of interest, you will have a unique possibility to write your next exciting student project in collaboration with VELUX along with your activities as Student Assistant.

#StudentInVELUX

Interested?

Send us your CV and a motivational letter as soon as possible, as we will be conducting interviews on an ongoing basis.

Learn more about the VELUX Group at www.velux.com, where you can also read more about our company and what to expect from our recruitment process.
Show more

Title: Senior Consultant - Data & Process Analytics
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We're Celonis, the global leader in Process Mining technology and one of the world's fastest-growing SaaS firms. We believe there is a massive opportunity to unlock productivity by placing data and intelligence at the core of business processes - and for that, we need you to join us.

The Team:

Celonis Services is a strategic services organisation that focuses on the technical aspects of our customers' journeys, which includes Consulting Services, Academy and Customer Support. We are thought leaders with deep product, technical and domain expertise and focus on delivering Celonis implementations and driving product adoption for our customers. We achieve this by bringing together our best practices, delivery experience, award-winning enablement and support expertise.

The Role:

As a Senior Consultant, you will accelerate our customers’ digital transformation and drive Celonis’ international expansion. You identify our customers’ strategic priorities and develop data-driven process insights using SQL and create complex data models to ensure that customers receive maximum value. You will become an expert in all kinds of company processes such as Finance, Order Management, Procurement, Warehouse Management, Customer Service, Production, e-Commerce, Opportunity Management, Supply Chain Management. You leverage the newest features and functionalities of the Celonis software, such as Process Analytics, Process Automation, Task Mining and Machine Learning.

The work you’ll do:


Lead and drive the implementation process while delivering exceptionally high levels of service to ensure the optimal solution for our customers with our Celonis technology
Transform the customer’s data using SQL to create the data model for your process analysis
Design and implement innovative analyses and execution apps and enrich them with Machine Learning algorithms or Task Mining to make the customer’s processes transparent and automated
Analyze the data to identify process inefficiencies and understand the root causes to jointly suggest approaches to overcome them
Quantify the business and financial potential and present the most relevant KPIs to the management
Translate business requirements into technical specifications
Conduct value creation workshops and align measures to improve process inefficiencies
Set the foundation of the path to value to make the long-term customer success journey happen


The qualifications you need:


Min. 3 years working experience in IT-Consulting, Management Consulting, Process Improvement or a similar area
Proficiency with SQL or other programming languages (Python, R, Matlab...) and a strong interest in Big Data, Data Mining, and Process Mining
Strong communication skills in English and enjoy interacting with various customers to understand and interpret business processes
You are very dedicated and visionary and want to actively drive the Celonis Process Mining technology forward
Excellent analytical skills, well organised and known for being a quick learner


Successfully completed your studies in Business Informatics, Computer Science, Information-oriented Business Administration/ Economics, Mathematics or a comparable degree program

What Celonis Can Offer You:


The unique opportunity to work with industry-leading process mining technology
Investment in your personal growth and skill development (clear career paths, internal mobility opportunities, L&D platform, mentorships, and more)
Great compensation and benefits packages (equity (restricted stock units), life insurance, time off, generous leave for new parents from day one, and more). For intern and working student benefits, click here.
Physical and mental well-being support (subsidized gym membership, access to counseling, virtual events on well-being topics, and more)
A global and growing team of Celonauts from diverse backgrounds to learn from and work with
An open-minded culture with innovative, autonomous teams
Business Resource Groups to help you feel connected, valued and seen (Black@Celonis, Women@Celonis, Parents@Celonis, Pride@Celonis, Resilience@Celonis, and more)
A clear set of company values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our Future


About Us:

Celonis helps some of the world’s largest and most esteemed brands make processes work for people, companies and the planet. With over 5,000 enterprise customer deployments across nearly every industry, the Celonis Process Intelligence Platform uses process mining and AI to give you a living digital twin of your business operation. It’s system-agnostic and without bias, and empowers companies to reduce waste, create value and benefit people across the top, bottom, and green lines. Since 2011, the Celonis platform has enabled its customers to identify more than $18 billion in value. Celonis is headquartered in Munich, Germany, and New York City, USA, with more than 20 offices worldwide.

Get familiar with the Celonis Process Intelligence Platform by watching this video.

Data Privacy, Equal Opportunity, and Accessibility Information

Celonis is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment and equal opportunity in all aspects of employment. We will not tolerate any unlawful discrimination or harassment of any kind. We make all employment decisions without regard to race/ethnicity, color, sex, pregnancy, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship status, religion, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or any other factor protected by applicable anti-discrimination laws. As a US federal contractor, we are committed to the principles of affirmative action in accordance with applicable laws and regulations. Different makes us better.

Any information you submit to Celonis as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Celonis’ Statements on Data Privacy, Equal Opportunity and Accessibility.

Please be aware of common job offer scams, impersonators and frauds. Learn more here.

By submitting this application, you confirm that you agree to the storing and processing of your personal data by Celonis as described in our Privacy Notice for the Application and Hiring Process.

Title: VIE - Data Analyst, Denmark, Engesvang
Description:
How will you CONTRIBUTE and GROW?

Specialty Gases is a team of 7 experienced colleagues with different ages and gender. We work between 7:00-16:00 producing different mixtures every day were no day is as the previous one. The laboratory is a team of 3 experienced women with good routines and procedures. We work very close together and enjoy the work as well as the breaks.

The goal is to achieve an accreditation for ISO 17025 (Laboratory) & ISO 17034 (Specialty Gases) to provide a better variety of products with shorter leadtimes to our customers in the Nordics. This is important for Air Liquide to achieve profitable growth in the Nordics.

You will be the project manager on this way ensuring that we will stay on track, use our resources in the best way and bring the results and stakeholders together to achieve the goal. The main interactions will take place with the specialty gas team and the laboratory as well as the accreditation body but also colleagues and experts in Europe. The project will benefit from the experience of other plants in europe that already have achieved the accrediation.

The mission requires very good English communication skills in both verbal and writing with people at various level internally as well as externally.

___________________

Are you a MATCH?

Educational Qualifications:


Master’s degree in Chemical Engineering or a related field, with a specialization in chemistry, physics, mathematics, or similar disciplines.



Essential Skills and Competencies:


Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to convey complex information clearly.
Strong sense of responsibility, open-mindedness, and a results-driven mindset.
Highly motivated and committed to achieving project goals.
Proficient in uncertainty calculations and preparation of official reports.
Advanced skills in Google Sheets for data analysis and reporting.



Nice to have:


Strong interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with diverse stakeholders
Proven experience in project planning and leadership.
Expertise in data evaluation and analysis.
Familiarity with accreditation processes and standards.



Language:


Fluency in English (both written and spoken).
Proficiency in a Scandinavian language (Norwegian, Danish, or Swedish) is advantageous



Please send the CV and cover letter in English.

Position open only for candidates eligible to the VIE program. Therefore, only the applicants meeting the requirements of the French V.I.E program will be taken into consideration. Please visit this website for more information about these requirements

https://mon-vie-via.businessfrance.fr/en/what-is-the-vie-french-international-internship-program

The V.I.E., an international young graduate program, enables young professionals who are less than 28 and European Union nationals to work for a French company in any country of the world. Becoming part of this program means going abroad to carry out a professional assignment for up to 24 months whilst benefiting from social care coverage and an interesting salary, which depends on the host country.

Business France, the French agency for international business development, is in charge of all the administrative procedures of your assignment. For further information, please visit the following link:

https://mon-vie-via.businessfrance.fr/en

Our Differences make our Performance

At Air Liquide, we are committed to build a diverse and inclusive workplace that embraces the diversity of our employees, our customers, patients, community stakeholders and cultures across the world.

We welcome and consider applications from all qualified applicants, regardless of their background. We strongly believe a diverse organization opens up opportunities for people to express their talent, both individually and collectively and it helps foster our ability to innovate by living our fundamentals, acting for our success and creating an engaging environment in a changing world.
Show more

Title: Student Data Engineer
Place: Haderslev, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you ready to learn in the world of large datasets and complex SQL challenges? Then join our Data Engineering team for the chance to contribute to the development of a modern data warehouse, empowering data-driven decision-making, and make a real impact on our global supply chain.

If the above sparks your interest, then the role of Student Data Engineering within our Data & Reporting team is the perfect opportunity for you!

THE TEAM

As a part of the Logistics Data & Reporting team, you will get experienced colleagues that work with passion and commitment to drive innovation and lead the data path forward. We have the necessary priority and trust from the business that we support to execute on our ambitious goals. We must deliver one truth and data transparency, which requires us to test new technologies and ideas. All while balancing accuracy and continuous improvement, supporting BESTSELLER’s continued global success.

THE ROLE

As a Student Data Engineer, you’ll play an important role in supporting our journey towards data transparency. Your tasks will include:


Help build data transparency by supporting our Data Engineers investigating data logics
Writing complex SQL under good supervision from a Data Engineer
Verifying and cross-checking data to ensure accuracy and consistency
Extract data from a variety of data sources
Implementing monitoring mechanisms to improve data quality
Automating as much as possible


Your Benefits

Joining BESTSELLER Logistics and the Data & Reporting team gives you the opportunities to accelerate your career in an environment where the ambitions are high, and the opportunities are great. You will be backed by a team of skilled Data Engineers, and you will experience responsibility from day one and can set your mark on our supply chain. Your personal and professional development means a lot to us, which is why active learning is a part of our tasks.

YOUR PROFILE

We’re looking for someone who is curious, proactive, and eager to learn. Ideally, you’ll bring:


Current enrolment in a relevant programme, such as software engineering or data analytics
Strong software engineering skills with attention to detail
Proficiency in SQL
A desire to contribute and thrive in a fast-paced environment
Knowledge of Python, database administration and the Azure ecosystem is a plus, but not required


This is a fantastic opportunity to gain real-world experience and make a meaningful impact on our Logistics operation. If you’re ready to take on this exciting challenge, we’d love to hear from you!

WE LOOK FORWARD TO HEARING FROM YOU

If you have any questions about the position, feel free to contact Mikael Bertelsen at +45 30 85 37 15. If not, apply today with your CV and cover letter. We review applications on an ongoing basis, so don’t miss your chance to join our dynamic team – the deadline is April 6th 2025.

EMPLOYMENT

15-20 hours per week, with flexible working hours and expected presence in the office 1-2 days a week.

LOCATION

Your work location is our distribution centre in Haderslev.

About Bestseller Logistics

BESTSELLER Logistics is responsible for all inbound and outbound logistics in BESTSELLER Group. We operate five logistics centres in Denmark, with a sixth centre being constructed in the Netherlands. We have more than 400,000 m2 of warehouse space and import approx. 16 million boxes per year. More than 600 colleagues keep the wheels running and we offer career opportunities within Logistics Development, Customs, Shipping, HSE, Operations, Controlling, Facility Services and more.

Join us and become part of the worldwide fashion company BESTSELLER. For more information, please go to www.bestseller.com.

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Odense Kommune, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Would you like to drive data innovation in the automotive industry, leveraging cutting-edge technologies and big data solutions? Then you might be the Data Scientist we are looking for!




About Us

We are a global company specializing in online car auctions and IT solutions for the automotive industry. With more than 15 years of data across Europe, we are continuously growing and seeking a Data Scientist to help us commercialize our data and create value for our customers.




The Autorola Group is a global leader in online remarketing and automotive IT solutions, as well as business intelligence solutions for used vehicles and professional fleet management.

Headquartered in Denmark, the Autorola Group currently employs around 850 people and has branches in 19 countries across Europe, North America, Latin America, and the Asia-Pacific region.

Through an extensive network of companies, manufacturers, banks, leasing companies, and fleet managers, Autorola offers dealers worldwide the opportunity to acquire and market vehicles through auctions. Our product portfolio is complemented by our workflow management system, which enables the digital integration of individual customer processes throughout the entire vehicle lifecycle, as well as our artificial intelligence, which provides real-time indicators for developments in the used car market.







Your Role

Reporting to the Head of Data Science in our Business Unit, Indicata, you will play a key role in building and maintaining our big data platform, supporting various markets with data insights, Power BI dashboards, and developing data science solutions that enhance our appraisal engine and forecasting capabilities.




Your key responsibilities include:

Developing and maintaining our big data platform, including building out the data lake.
Engaging in platform discussions and collaborating on data architecture.
Utilizing SQL, Python, R, and Power BI for data analysis and dashboard creation.
Working closely with the Data Engineer to prepare datasets for analysis.
Designing and executing complex data analyses across multiple markets.
Commercializing data insights to add value to our customers.
Ensuring data quality and optimizing existing algorithms.
Supporting and potentially developing machine learning solutions over time.
Collaborating with stakeholders to gather requirements and deliver data-driven solutions.







Your Profile

We imagine you have at least 2 years of relevant experience, but we are also open to recent graduates with the right motivation and approach. Additionally, we expect you to have:

Proficiency in SQL, Python, R, and Power BI.
Experience with Spark and Databricks is a plus.
Strong commercial acumen and the ability to translate data insights into business value.
Experience in creating Power BI dashboards for complex data analysis and forecasting.
A methodological approach to problem-solving and improving data-driven solutions.
Familiarity with the “Team Data Science Process” or similar to be able to work structured and independently on own projects.
The ability to work both independently and collaboratively with stakeholders.
A willingness to learn about the automotive industry and its data ecosystem.







What We Offer

Autorola A/S is a global company with over 850 employees and 19 subsidiaries across Europe, Latin America, and Asia-Pacific.

You will get the opportunity to work for a fast-growing company that collaborates with some of the strongest brands in the automotive industry. Our environment is characterized by an informal and easygoing communication culture. Our headquarters is located right by the railway station at Skibhusvej 52 A, 5000 Odense C.




You will be included in the pension scheme and health insurance, as well as have the chance to participate in company social events. We offer a good lunch arrangement, a fitness room, and a Friday bar to end the week on a high note.




Want to Join the Team and Have an Impact on the Future?

We are looking to fill the position as soon as possible, so if you see yourself thriving in the above-mentioned tasks, we look forward to receiving your application.




Even if you do not meet all the ideal requirements, we encourage you to apply, as we strongly believe in inclusion and diversity.




We will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis and reserve the right to remove the advertisement once we find the right candidate.




If you have any questions about the position, feel free to reach out to Christian Gless, Tech Talent Acquisition Partner, at csg@autorola.com or by phone at +45 31624481.

Title: Azure løsningsarkitekt
Description:
Vil du gribe en spændende mulighed for at vokse professionelt og forme vores kunders cloud-rejse i samarbejde med vores internationale team?
Er du passioneret omkring Microsoft-teknologier og har lyst til at blive en del af et dynamisk og erfarent team med en kultur for vidensdeling?
Brænder du for at kommunikere den værdi, som Azure-teknologi kan tilføre vores kunders forretning, samtidig med at du hjælper dem med at optimere deres cloud- og softwareinvesteringer?




Praktisk information:

Placering: Søborg, Silkeborg, Aalborg, Danmark | Rapporterer til: Cloud & Security Advisory Lead| Sprogkrav: Flydende dansk og engelsk, skriftligt og mundtligt




Som vores nye Azure løsningsarkitekt, vil du på baggrund af dialog med beslutningstagere hos vores kunder gennem teknisk sparring og rådgivning, identificere cloud projekter og kommunikere Crayons services værdi i samspil med Azure teknologi. Din rolle vil være at drive pre-sales, definere og afgrænse, designe og optimere Azure-løsninger, samt udføre problemfri implementering og udrulning på tværs af forskellige kundesegmenter, direkte og eventuelt i samarbejde med vores internationale konsulenter.




Andre ansvarsområder:

Identificere kundespecifikke problematikker og designe lønsninger via Azure Cloud Adoption Framework og Azure Well-Architected Review for at sikre tilpasning til bedste praksis
Samarbejde med kunder om at definere projektets omfang, roller, ansvarsområder, indsatsestimater og succeskriterier
Holde dig opdateret om Azure-teknologier og bedste praksis for at kunne støtte kunderne bedst muilgt i projekterne
Lede proof-of-concept-initiativer, drive prospektering, kvalificere, præsentere, forhandle og dele produktindsigt gennem hele salgsprocessen




Dine kompetencer:

5+ års relevant erfaring med Azure technologier
Azure Certified Solutions Architect og andre relevante certificeringer
Kompetencer inden for teknisk sparring og rådgivning i forbindelse med implementering og udførelse af projekter
Specialiceret viden i at implementere Azure-infrastruktur
Specialiceret viden i migration fra lokal infrastruktur til Azure IaaS og PaaS-løsninger
Kompetence og evne til at identificere og kommunikere løsninger til kundernes smertepunkter




Om dig:

Uafhængig, vedholdende og drevet til at forfølge nye forretningsmuligheder, mens du rådgiver om teknologiens indvirkning på kundernes forretninger
Evnen til at sætte personlige mål og samtidig samarbejde effektivt for at nå team- og forretningsmål
Proaktiv og selvsikker i at tage føringen for at fremme muligheder og skabe resultater




En hos Crayon Danmark betyder også;

at du vil arbejde i en virksomhed hvis medarbejdertilfredshed er signifikant over gennemsnittet i Danmark
at du vil blive inddraget og have stor indflydelse på hvordan virksomheden udvikler sig
at arbejdstiden følger ’the new normal policy’, som er 2-3 dage på kontoret og ellers arbejde hjemmefra – vi er fleksible
at du altid kan finde Nutella, Cola og Cocio i køleskabet hvis du er sulten for sjov - og vores frokostordning vil du absolut ikke kunne klage over
at du vil blive inviteret til nogle fantastiske sociale events flere gange om året – vi holder altid nogle gode fester




Crayon har positioneret sig som Nordens førende indenfor Cloud-services, Software Asset Management og salg af software. Vores specialister leverer skræddersyende løsninger indenfor softwareleverandørstyring på tværs af Microsoft, Amazon Web Services, Google, Adobe, IBM, Oracle mv. – altså nogle af de største navne i branchen. Vi er en del af en børsnoteret koncern, som globalt beskæftiger mere end 4.300 medarbejdere på vores kontorer på tværs af landegrænserne. I Crayon Danmark er lige over 110 ansatte, fordelt på 3 lokationer, hovedkontor i Søborg, en lokation centralt i Silkeborg samt et kontor i Aalborg.




Hos Crayon Danmark vil du blive en del af et innovativt og dynamisk miljø, hvor vi har en meget åben og hjælpsom kultur. Dine kommende kolleger er enormt faglig dygtige, og er stærkt drevet af at gøre en forskel for vores kunder og partnere. Vi vil investere i dig via kompetenceudvikling, kurser, seminarer og certificeringer – og dine kommende kolleger vil rigtig gerne videns dele med dig.

Der er aldrig en typisk dag hos Crayon, vores DNA er noget helt særligt – og det er det vi elsker ved at være medarbejdere i Crayon.




At Crayon, we are deeply committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging (DEIB). We believe that diversity in all its forms strengthens our team and enhances innovation and effectiveness. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, regardless of race, color, age, origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender (identity), genetic information, neurodiversity, disability, or any other basis protected by local laws and regulations.

When filling vacancies, we prioritize equally qualified candidates who bring diverse backgrounds and experiences, helping to enrich our team dynamics and foster a vibrant, inclusive work environment.




If you require any assistance or reasonable accommodation during the application process, please let us know.

Title: Consultant / Senior Consultant – Data & Analytics
Description:
Are you passionate about helping leading companies to harness their data to become data-driven? Does consulting and solving challenging business problems appeal to you? Do you thrive in a collaborative, entrepreneurial, and supportive work culture?




Then join our growing consulting team in Copenhagen!




At BearingPoint Denmark, you’ll join an environment that brings together the best of both worlds—the agility of a fast-growing practice and the resources of a global consultancy. Since opening our Copenhagen office in 2021, we’ve built a team of 10+ professionals, working from a brand-new office in the heart of the city.




As we continue growing our business and team, you’ll have the chance to work with Denmark’s leading companies and collaborate with our international teams across the Nordics and beyond. We foster a dynamic and entrepreneurial environment where everyone plays a role in our shared success, shaping both our team’s future and that of our clients.




Your role:

As a Data & Analytics Consultant / Senior Consultant, you’ll deliver insights from data into concrete processes and decisions to create value for the customer. Working alongside our AI Lead in Denmark and collaborating with our Nordic team, you will for example:

Implement analytics solutions, to predict risks or perform simulations of financial scenarios, and forecast trends to improve our clients’ performance and profitability.

Deliver insights using machine learning models, static analyzes and optimization methods.
Conduct experiments, ensure that they are carried out correctly and analyzing the results.
Visualize and present data in an actionable and clear manner using tools like Power BI to support decision-making.
Contribute to business development, including creating client proposals, identifying opportunities, and developing our offerings and internal practices.




As your expertise grows, you'll take on bigger responsibilities—leading projects or project streams, working closely with clients, and driving business growth. Throughout the recruitment process, we’ll shape the role to match your expertise and experience, ensuring the best fit for all.




We are looking for:

A few years of prior experience in working with data (f.ex. as a Data Analyst, Data Scientist, consulting role or similar)
Analytical skills, such as mathematical modeling and statistical analysis
Proficiency in programming languages like Python
Experience with visualizing data (f.ex. Power BI, Tableau) and large datasets using SQL
Knowledge of and/or experience with relevant cloud technologies
Academic degree in a relevant field (for example computer science, data science, business analytics or related field)
Fluent communication skills in Danish and English, both written and spoken




As an advantage we see:

Experience in the financial sector or analytics, such as credit risk modeling, financial crime prevention, segmentation, or customer profiling
Previous client-facing role




In addition, we’re looking for strong problem-solving skills, proactive mindset and curiosity to learn. We hope you are a true team player, as collaboration is an essential part of our culture. An entrepreneurial mentality and commitment to contribute to developing our practice in Denmark will take you far in this role.




What you can expect:

Joining us isn’t just about the job—it’s about the opportunities, the people, and the impact you’ll have. Here’s what you can expect:




Steep learning curve & interesting projects: You’ll have the chance to work with leading-edge solutions and continuously develop your skillset as you work with diverse client projects together with a team of consultants. We have a vibrant global data & analytics community within the company to share and deepen your knowledge and collaborate with.
Entrepreneurial spirit and people-centric growth – We embrace an entrepreneurial mindset where dedication and teamwork are keys to our success. As a new practice with ambitious growth targets, we are committed to making our mark by building strong brand awareness through a people-centric approach.
Commitment and quality – We value those who actively contribute to shaping an environment where everyone is seen, heard, and engaged. With a long-term commitment and a dedication to quality in everything we do, we are creating something lasting—for our clients, our team, and our workplace.
Professional & personal growth – We invest in our people. Through regular discussions with your development manager, formal trainings and hands-on project work, we’ll support your personal and professional development every step of the way.
Competitive salary, benefits & flexible work options – We offer a competitive salary and benefits, along with hybrid working options to promote a healthy work-life balance. Our centrally located office offers a dynamic space for focus, collaboration, and connection.




If this sounds like the next step in your career, join us at BearingPoint!




We are looking forward to receiving your application by Monday 31st of March. For more information, please contact Sara Lyng (+45 29 91 68 92) during office hours. We review applications and may start the process before the deadline—so don’t wait to apply! This is a permanent full-time position.




BearingPoint is an equal opportunities employer. We’re all about helping people reach their full potential, and we know that the best ideas come from different perspectives and experiences. To learn more about us, you can visit www.bearingpoint.com, and follow our latest news on LinkedIn.




About BearingPoint

BearingPoint is an independent management and technology consultancy with European roots and a global reach. The company operates in three business units: Consulting, Products, and Capital. Consulting covers advisory business with a clear focus on selected business areas. Products provides IP-driven digital assets and managed services for business-critical processes. Capital delivers M&A and transaction services. BearingPoint's clients include many of the world's leading companies and organizations. The firm has a global consulting network with more than 13,000 people and supports clients in over 70 countries, engaging with them to achieve measurable and sustainable success.




We are guided by our purpose – Together, we are more than business.




It revolves around three key focus areas – More innovation, More for our planet, and More for our people. To make sure we live that purpose, we’re steered by a set of values that bring our purpose to life and are the essence of our culture – We are easy to work with, We create lasting outcomes, We empower people to succeed. We are a strongly purpose & values-driven organization, both today and as we forge our way into the future. Learn more about our purpose and values here. BearingPoint is a certified B Corporation, meeting high standards of social and environmental impact.

Title: Lead Data/IT Analyst - Payments Data
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job ID: 24876

At Nordea, we know our stakeholder needs are changing – and we’re deeply committed to meeting them with the solutions of tomorrow. We’re creating a new cloud environment where we’re harnessing the power of near real time data – one where you can make an impact. So bring your skills, ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll find plenty of opportunities to grow and make your mark on something bigger.

About This Opportunity

To strengthen our team we are looking for an experienced Lead Data/IT Analyst who has skills to do hands-on data and requirement analysis work. The right candidate also understands other aspects of software development: Are we making solid architectural decisions? Are we able to improve our tech stack? Are we focusing on right things?

As the Lead Data/IT Analyst, you’ll engage with many different stakeholders, so the person we are looking for, is an outgoing individual who is self-motivated and contributes to a good team spirit. You are an experienced and passionate analyst, always seeking the best solution.

Your main responsibilities will be around the consolidation and harmonization, sourcing, storage and distribution of Payments Data to other solutions. It also includes integrations supporting different End2End payment flows in Nordea´s target payment architecture.

What you’ll be doing:


Contributing to solution architecture, design and maintainability of applications
Designing, building and maintaining near real-time data pipelines
Interacting with product owners and stakeholders to clarify, elicit and translate requirements into implementation specifications
Data mapping, data modelling, solution design and working with Information architects
Performing quantitative data analysis with the aim to understand identified issues, and to explain implications and recommend solutions
Collaborating with developers and engineers and properly document your design and solutions
Eliciting requirements (functional and non-functional) by co-operating with different stakeholders in a complex environment
Be responsible for requirements documentation (inc. use cases) and quality improvement
Accessing complex and distributed datasets and perform statistical analysis


The role is based in Copenhagen / Taastrup.

Who You Are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:


Are a team player who takes ownership, builds cross-functional relationships and loves sharing knowledge
Have a consultant mindset – actively participate in multiple initiatives at once
Can communicate constructively, and contribute to a productive work environment and good atmosphere in the team


Your experience and background:


Expert in data modelling principles, data architectures and integration patterns
Expert in in requirement elicitation / analysis
Expert in SQL (Oracle, MSSQL or similar RDBMS)
Experience in one or more cloud platforms (AWS/Azure/Google)
Knowledge of the banking sector and payment domain (ISO20022 standard, SEPA and Swift messages)
Hands on knowledge of practices like Domain driven design, Event sourcing architecture patterns, microservices architecture and clean code.
Hands on knowledge of CI/CD, Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes, REST, Maven and JUnit and also to have experience building distributed, highly available and high throughput applications
Degree in computer science and engineering, mathematical modelling or similar
Excellent written and spoken English communication skills, and familiar with international collaboration with different stakeholder groups


If this sounds like you, get in touch!

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 31/03/2025. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Finn Abildgaard at finn.abildgaard@nordea.com

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.

If you are an external consultant interested in this role and wish to apply please contact the hiring people leader for separate instruction on how to apply.

If you are an external consultant interested in this role and wish to apply please contact the hiring people leader for separate instruction on how to apply.

Title: Web Analyst Intern
Description:
Are you eager to learn about and work with the latest technology in web analytics within an international company operating across 28 markets?




If yes, we are looking for a dedicated and detail-oriented Web Analyst Intern to join our UX and Insights team.




JYSK is in constant growth, and the same applies to our UX and Insights department. We have an increasing strategic focus on online data and insights and are always looking for new talents.




WHAT WE OFFER YOU

As a Web Analyst Intern, you will get a unique opportunity to develop your analytical skills and gain hands-on experience with advanced web analytics tools – primarily Google Analytics 4 (GA4).




In the Autumn of 2025, we offer a 4-6 months internship, where you will become an integral part of our UX and Insights team. Our expert in web analytics and data tracking will guide you and share their methodologies, helping you grow into a skilled web analyst.




You will have the chance to work independently on your own projects and contribute to the development of data-driven insights.




WHAT YOUR INTERNSHIP WILL BE ABOUT

Your tasks and responsibilities will include:

analysing user behavior and traffic data to optimize conversions and online performance
preparing reports that provide insights into our online performance
collaborating with internal teams on data analysis projects
identifying opportunities to improve our digital customer experience based on data




You can read more about our department here.




WHAT YOU SHOULD BRING

We are looking for an intern who:

is currently studying E-commerce, IT, Business Analytics, or related fields
has a strong interest in web analytics and digital user data, particularly with a focus on GA4
works independently and thrives in a dynamic and busy work environment
is detail-oriented and has a structured approach to tasks
has experience with or interest in tools like Google Tag Manager, GA4, and Excel
is fluent in English




IS THIS YOUR NEXT OPPORTUNITY? Apply today!

If you have any questions about the position, feel free to contact Senior Web Analyst, Thomas Lykke Sørensen, at +45 3125 4474.




Send us a short application along with your CV by clicking on “Apply.” We process applications on an ongoing basis and will close the recruitment process once we have found the right candidate.

The internship is set to start the 18th of August.




We offer flexibility to make sure you obtain the required 30 ECTS by attending an extra course during the semester or flexibility to prioritise writing days.




ABOUT US

We believe our employees are key to our success. That is why we strive to offer development and possibilities of growing and finding new challenges within JYSK. Since our founder, Lars Larsen, opened his first store in Denmark in 1979, JYSK has expanded our global presence with stores and web shops in countries around the world.




Our three fundamental JYSK Values – Tradesman, Colleague and Corporate Spirit – express the behavior and attitude that we can expect from each other. We trust each other, and we believe in Empowerment and freedom with responsibility. We also take pride in rewarding engagement and a great effort among our employees. With the right attitude, opportunities abound in JYSK.




JYSK wants to include everyone, no matter the age, gender identity, race, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, ethnicity, and experience. Together, we secure our inclusive culture that encourages, supports, and celebrates the diverse voices of our employees. Because a great mix of minds, talents and unique personalities makes us a stronger team.




For more information, please visit our career page.

Title: Junior data-engineer til grønne data
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
I Energistyrelsen arbejder vi for et grønnere samfund og en stabil forsyningssikkerhed, hvor data spiller en afgørende rolle i den grønne omstilling. Derfor søger vi en nyuddannet med passion for dataløsninger, der vil være med på Energistyrelsens omfattende digitaliseringsrejse.




Om jobbet

Brænder du for at arbejde med data og skabe værdifulde løsninger, der gør en forskel? Så er dette jobbet for dig!




Vi søger en junior data engineer, der vil indgå i et stærkt data-team i afdelingen IT, Digitalisering og Data (IDD). Energistyrelsen råder over store mængder data, som bruges i mange sammenhænge – både internt og eksternt. Derfor arbejder vi med at udbygge vores datavarehus, så flere kan få adgang til værdifuld data, der understøtter den grønne omstilling.

Du vil blive en del af arbejdet med dataintegrationer, modellering og rapportering.

Vores datavarehus er bygget on-premise på Microsoft-teknologistacken, og vi arbejder bl.a. med data om vindmøller, energimærkning, digitalisering af forsyningssektoren, tilskudspuljer og ledelsesinformation.

Som ny i teamet vil du få mulighed for at udvikle dine kompetencer inden for SQL, ETL-processer og Power BI. Vi sørger for, at du bliver klædt godt på til at arbejde med drift og videreudvikling af vores dataløsninger.




Dine opgaver

Du vil få opgaver indenfor områderne:

Vedligeholdelse og optimering af dataintegrationer og ETL-processer
Udvikling af datamodeller og rapportering i Power BI
Identifikation og håndtering af nye datakilder
Samarbejde med forretningen for at omsætte behov til brugbare dataløsninger.




Vi tilbyder en stærk faglig udvikling, et inspirerende arbejdsmiljø og en god work/life balance, herunder fleksible arbejdstider og mulighed for hjemmearbejde.




Om dig

Vi forestiller os, at du:

Har en nylig afsluttet bachelor eller kandidatuddannelse inden for fx datalogi, IT, softwareudvikling, ingeniørvidenskab, økonomi eller en anden relevant uddannelse
Har interesse for data og datamodellering – erfaring med SQL eller Power BI er en fordel, men ikke et krav
Er struktureret, analytisk og nysgerrig
Har lyst til at arbejde i et team, hvor vi hjælper hinanden og deler viden
Behersker dansk på et højt niveau, både skriftligt og mundtligt.




Om os

I Energistyrelsen gør vi en forskel hver dag. I Danmark og i lande verden over. Vores vision om at opnå et klimaneutralt samfund i vækst og balance er den største opgave, vi skal være med til at løse.

Vi ved, at vi skal tænke ambitiøst, og vi ved, at vi skal tænke nyt. Vores mål er en klog, grøn omstilling, hvor Danmark går foran, og danske erfaringer anvendes globalt. Hvor grønne løsninger, sikker og effektiv forsyning og økonomi tænkes sammen.

Vi har et job med mening. Vi er historien om de moderne nørder, stærke generalister og en ledelse, der vil motivere. Vi er 900 kolleger med en særlig holdånd. Vi er faglige. Vi er nysgerrige. Og så tager vi ansvar for fremtiden. For vi har dette til fælles: Vi gør en grøn forskel i hverdagen og for de kommende generationer.




Løn- og ansættelsesvilkår

Ansættelse og aflønning sker i henhold til den relevante overenskomst for akademikere i staten som fuldmægtig med rådighedsforpligtigelse eller anden relevant overenskomst.




Ansættelsesområdet er Klima-, Energi- og Forsyningsministeriet med tilhørende institutioner.

Supplerende oplysninger kan fås ved henvendelse til Jacob Marup-Lorentzen på telefon +4533927441.

Energistyrelsen betragter mangfoldighed som et aktiv og opfordrer alle uanset personlig baggrund til at søge stillingen.




Sådan ansøger du

Du søger via www.ens.dk/job. Benyt funktionen "Søg stillingen" på stillingsopslaget. Din motiverede ansøgning med CV, eksamensbevis inkl. karakteroversigt og eventuelle øvrige bilag skal være indtastet senest den 31. Marts 2025 Samtaler forventes afholdt i ugerne 15 og 17.

Kandidater til stillingen skal være indstillet på evt. at skulle udarbejde en opgave i forbindelse med rekrutteringsprocessen.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Data Scientist




Location: Copenhagen

Job Type: full-time




HELP ORGANIZATIONS WORLDWIDE TO REALIZE THE POTENTIAL OF AI WITH OUR AI PLATFORM, GRACE




Are you a highly ambitious and motivated Data Scientist interested in positively impacting the world with AI technology that you develop and deliver to clients worldwide?  If so, you might be the new colleague we at 2021.AI are looking for! 




2021.AI seeks a motivated Data Scientist to join our highly-skilled team of Data Scientists, working at the forefront of solving business challenges using statistical modeling, machine learning engineering, data engineering, etc.. In this role, you will participate in data science projects and deliveries. In addition, you will assist in the future development of different AI / ML and technology services on our GRACE platform. 




About You




You have high ambitions and want to positively impact the world with the AI / ML technology you develop and deliver to clients globally. This shines through in your ability to use statistical modeling, machine learning engineering, data engineering skills to deliver impactful and valuable business solutions across different industries in the private and public sectors.




You are independent, driven, motivated, and solution-oriented.




You work well with others. This entails teamwork with your internal team and with clients on- and off-site.




Your expertise is with data science, AI/ML, and related technologies, and you are passionate about delivering AI/ML solutions all the way from initial ML model research to implementing the working model in production. 




You have experience in independently developing AI/ML, or statistical models or LLMs that solve particular business challenges, including the process of preparing the models for deployment and production.




You are interested in working with one of the best data science teams on the planet, technology rock stars, and business magnates, all dedicated to responsibly and positively impacting the future with AI. 




About the Role




As a Data Scientist at 2021.AI, you will make your mark and directly influence the direction of data science in 2021.AI while delivering value with AI and ML to our partners and clients. 




You will participate as a Data Scientist in client projects and work closely with other teams in 2021.AI to improve our core product features, and demonstrate product value to clients on the GRACE Platform.




Key Responsibilities

Take part in projects developing AI and ML models for clients and partners
Embed those actions and insights into integrations and solutions for our clients’ businesses
Develop high-quality models with the business value behind in mind
Bring business objectives to the center of the ML development process




Skills and Qualifications:




M.Sc. or equivalent in Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field
2-3 years of hands-on, practical experience
Solid experience in Python programming combined with a mathematical/theoretical foundation in statistical modeling
Experience in writing production ready Python code
Data manipulation and visualization skills, including database handling and data cleaning/management
ML Engineering experience related to implementation and deployment of  AI and ML into production via, e.g. Flask, FastAPI or Docker
Knowledge in LLMs including  RAG construction and prompt engineering
Full working knowledge of English
Fast learning and a proactive mindset
Excellent presentation skills both toward business leaders and technical experts
Exceptional human and superb collaboration skills




Extra consideration is given to candidates with: 




The ability to identify potential use cases to create business value for our customers




About 2021.AI 




Founded in Copenhagen with several offices worldwide, 2021.AI is a fast-growing AI company focused on closing the gap between AI ambitions and real AI value for companies worldwide. Large private and public organizations globally trust us to help them stay competitive, compliant, and in control when applying AI. 




We are a team of passionate people who care deeply about the mission we are on; to positively impact the future with AI. Our tight-knit culture of camaraderie instills more than just a sense of belonging but great pride in our work. With high cultural ambitions, we expect you to bring lots of energy to the workplace and participate in company-related and social activities. In return, we promise great professional experiences and the freedom to tackle and own your tasks.




Supporting you professionally and personally

Professional Growth: Your CV will tell us where you've been, but we are also interested in where you want to go. We offer positions that will challenge your skills and let you grow. We trust our team members and give them autonomy to do their best work. We also support professional development and provide regular feedback.
Meaningful Impact: In our company, every job matters, and you can see almost daily that you are making a meaningful impact. Our feedback loops are fast, which means you will have the opportunity to learn and advance quickly, growing together with the company. 
Outstanding Team: Our AI platform GRACE helps companies and people cooperate across the board, and we apply this mindset to our own team. We have a highly collaborative, no-bureaucracy culture. 
Excellent Benefits: We offer competitive pay, a healthcare benefits package, and a positive work-life balance.
For Copenhagen employees, we provide the corporate equipment you need, flexible working hours, team buildings, a fantastic office location in Nørrebro, Friday bars, coffee, laughs, and cutting-edge industry knowledge!







Useful links to get to know us better:




2021.AI video introduction
Company brochure
 AI Platform brochure
Client cases page




2021.AI is an equal opportunity company. We welcome all applicants no matter their race, religion, color, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, criminal prosecution, judgment in a criminal case, or any other characteristic protected by law.




Questions & Support? Let’s connect. Please contact us: careers@2021.ai

Title: Customer Insights Analyst hos 3
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Som Customer Insights Analyst bliver du en del vores analyseteam på 3 personer inkl. dig, der leverer kundeindsigter til både 3’s privat- og erhvervsforretning. Vi arbejder tæt sammen med både marketing, produktudvikling, CX og digital for at forstå forretningens behov og understøtte med relevante kundeindsigter. Nogle undersøgelser opstår på teamets eget initiativ og andre ud fra en bestilling fra forretningen.

Dine primære opgaver vil være:


Drive nye kunde- og markedsundersøgelser fra start til slut - lige fra at identificere og forstå forretningsbehovet, definere metodologien, koordinere dataindsamlingen og analysere resultaterne.
Udarbejde rapporter og præsentationer med klare anbefalinger og konklusioner samt præsentere dine indsigter for relevante stakeholders.
Udvikle og analysere på vores eksisterende kundetilfredshedsmålinger for at forstå kundernes behov og identificere muligheder for forbedring af kundeoplevelsen.
Være en ambassadør for kundeindsigter på tværs af de kommercielle afdelinger og hjælpe dine kolleger med at identificere nye behov for kundeundersøgelser.


Hvem er du?

Vi er åbne overfor forskellige profiler, men forestiller os at du kan nikke genkendende til størstedelen af disse punkter:


Du har en kandidatgrad inden for fx marketing, erhvervsøkonomi eller lignende.
Du har minimum 2 års erfaring med dataanalyse og kundeindsigter, fx fra et analysebureau eller en lignende rolle i en større organisation.
Du har en stærk analytisk sans og en god forståelse for både kvantitative og kvalitative research metodologier samt basal statistik.
Du trives med at fordybe dig i data og arbejder selvsikkert i Excel med både databehandling, -analyse og -visualisering. Hvis du har erfaring med SurveyXact er det også et plus.
Du er en skarp formidler og god til at omdanne komplekse data til enkle og klare PowerPoint slides med konklusioner og anbefalinger.
Du får energi fra at hjælpe andre med at få de rette indsigter og er oprigtigt nysgerrig på at forstå vores kunder, konkurrenter og marked.


Hvad kan du forvente hos 3?

Hos 3 får du billet til et fællesskab bestående af 700 dygtige medarbejdere, som er dedikerede i en sjælden grad. Du får din daglige gang på vores hovedkontor i Carlsberg Byen, der er præget af mangfoldighed og mange forskellige personligheder samt en hverdag fyldt med både humor og ambitioner. Vi har – ligesom dig – gejst og viljen til at lykkes, og vi har både plads til forskellighed og store drømme. Vi tilbyder gode udviklingsmuligheder og medarbejderfordele, og så mener vi selv at have landets lækreste frokostordning.

Ansøgning og kontakt

Har du lyst til at blive en del af 3, så send din ansøgning og dit CV hurtigst muligt – vi afholder løbende samtaler, indtil vi har fundet den rette kandidat. Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, så kontakt Manager - Customer & Market Insights, Christina Haagh, på 31 200 532.
Show more
HTML:
Som Customer Insights Analyst bliver du en del vores analyseteam på 3 personer inkl. dig, der leverer kundeindsigter til både 3’s privat- og erhvervsforretning. Vi arbejder tæt sammen med både marketing, produktudvikling, CX og digital for at forstå forretningens behov og understøtte med relevante kundeindsigter. Nogle undersøgelser opstår på teamets eget initiativ og andre ud fra en bestilling fra forretningen.

Dine primære opgaver vil være:

  • Drive nye kunde- og markedsundersøgelser fra start til slut - lige fra at identificere og forstå forretningsbehovet, definere metodologien, koordinere dataindsamlingen og analysere resultaterne.
  • Udarbejde rapporter og præsentationer med klare anbefalinger og konklusioner samt præsentere dine indsigter for relevante stakeholders.
  • Udvikle og analysere på vores eksisterende kundetilfredshedsmålinger for at forstå kundernes behov og identificere muligheder for forbedring af kundeoplevelsen.
  • Være en ambassadør for kundeindsigter på tværs af de kommercielle afdelinger og hjælpe dine kolleger med at identificere nye behov for kundeundersøgelser.

Hvem er du?

Vi er åbne overfor forskellige profiler, men forestiller os at du kan nikke genkendende til størstedelen af disse punkter:

  • Du har en kandidatgrad inden for fx marketing, erhvervsøkonomi eller lignende.
  • Du har minimum 2 års erfaring med dataanalyse og kundeindsigter, fx fra et analysebureau eller en lignende rolle i en større organisation.
  • Du har en stærk analytisk sans og en god forståelse for både kvantitative og kvalitative research metodologier samt basal statistik.
  • Du trives med at fordybe dig i data og arbejder selvsikkert i Excel med både databehandling, -analyse og -visualisering. Hvis du har erfaring med SurveyXact er det også et plus.
  • Du er en skarp formidler og god til at omdanne komplekse data til enkle og klare PowerPoint slides med konklusioner og anbefalinger.
  • Du får energi fra at hjælpe andre med at få de rette indsigter og er oprigtigt nysgerrig på at forstå vores kunder, konkurrenter og marked.

Hvad kan du forvente hos 3?

Hos 3 får du billet til et fællesskab bestående af 700 dygtige medarbejdere, som er dedikerede i en sjælden grad. Du får din daglige gang på vores hovedkontor i Carlsberg Byen, der er præget af mangfoldighed og mange forskellige personligheder samt en hverdag fyldt med både humor og ambitioner. Vi har – ligesom dig – gejst og viljen til at lykkes, og vi har både plads til forskellighed og store drømme. Vi tilbyder gode udviklingsmuligheder og medarbejderfordele, og så mener vi selv at have landets lækreste frokostordning.

Ansøgning og kontakt

Har du lyst til at blive en del af 3, så send din ansøgning og dit CV hurtigst muligt – vi afholder løbende samtaler, indtil vi har fundet den rette kandidat. Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, så kontakt Manager - Customer & Market Insights, Christina Haagh, på 31 200 532.

Title: Student Worker in Data & Business Intelligence Support
Place: Vejle, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.

Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.

We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization. Read more about your future team and employees' stories in our brochure.

How To Contribute To Our Vision

We are looking for a self-driven student worker to support our Digital Solutions team in Vejle with a variety of tasks.

Being a Student Worker in Siemens Gamesa is an opportunity for you to develop your personal capabilities and build a professional and international network. You will get the chance to enhance your professional development and get relevant work experience in a global company.

Your Responsibilities Will Consist Of


Understand business requirements in BI context and design data models to transform raw data into meaningful insights.
Create dashboards and interactive visual reports by using Power BI.
Design, develop, test, and deploy Power BI scripts and perform detailed analytics.
Analyze current ETL process, define and design new solutions.
In collaboration with the rest of the team, help structure reporting portfolio to improve visualization and secure alignment across reports.
Assist with tasks around data quality, data collection, general queries from stakeholders in other teams, report maintenance, presentations, SharePoint updates etc.


What You Need To Make a Difference

Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. We are looking for someone who is currently enrolled at the university with at least one year left of their bachelor or master’s, studying Business Intelligence, IT, Business or Software Engineering (or similar). Please attach your transcript from your university as well as your CV.

To Be Successful In This Role, You Need/are


To be passionate about data analytics and visualization of data.
Knowledge of PowerBi, would be a plus.
Analytical thinking, troubleshooting, presentation, and communication skills with a drive for results.
To be fluent in English both written and spoken.
An open and collaborative mindset, willing to support and take on tasks where needed.
Team player attitude and to be eager to learn new things.


Beware, we are looking for a student worker who is able to come into the office in Vejle one time a week. In the beginning it is preferred that the student worker can come in more.

Most importantly, you challenge yourself and your colleagues to achieve the best results. You have a high professional competency, and you have a desire to develop your skills. You have good collaboration skills, and you can manage to act in different cultural contexts. To thrive in this position, you must have a strong result- and customer-oriented approach.

In return of your commitment, we offer you…

To become a part of our mission for sustainability: clean energy for generations to come. We are a global team of diverse colleagues who share a passion for renewable energy and have a culture of trust and empowerment to make our own ideas a reality. We focus on personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization. Siemens Gamesa offers a wide variety of benefits such as flexible working hours as well as home-office possibility for many colleagues, employer-funded pension, attractive remuneration package (fixed/variable) and local benefits such as subsidized lunch, employee discounts and much more.

Empowering our people

https://www.siemensgamesa.com/sustainability/employees

#Studentworker

How do you imagine the future?

https://youtu.be/12Sm678tjuY

Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions – the greatest challenge we face.

Other Information

For further information regarding the recruitment process, please contact the recruitment team via Maia Coombs on maia.coombs.ext@siemensgamesa.com. Please mention the Job ID in the email.

We kindly draw your attention to the fact that this email may NOT be used for sending applications or CVs for evaluation.

Please apply in English via the apply button with your CV and a motivational letter

Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a work environment that is free from discrimination and where employees are treated with dignity and respect. Employment at Siemens Gamesa is based solely on an individual's merit and qualifications, which are directly related to job competence. Siemens Gamesa does not discriminate against any employee or job applicant on the basis of race, ethnicity, nationality, ancestry, genetic information, citizenship, religion, age, gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, rules or regulations. We adhere to these principles in all aspects of employment, including recruiting, hiring, training, compensation, promotion and benefits.



We are driven by people - from more than 100 different countries, they build the company we are every day. Our diverse and inclusive culture encourages us to think outside the box, speak without fear, and be bold. We value the flexibility that our smart-working arrangements, our digital disconnection framework and our family-friendly practices bring to the new way of working.
Show more
