Title: Senior Data Strategist
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to set the strategic direction for our data architecture and collaborate with architects and cross-functional teams to integrate digital technologies, data management practices, and IT infrastructure? And do you want to develop yourself professionally and personally in a global conglomerate within hearing instruments, audio-, video-, and gaming equipment? Then you might be our new colleague.

As our Senior Data Strategist, you will be responsible for the design, implementation, and management of our data landscape. In this key position, you will ensure a scalable and robust architecture that aligns with, and empowers, our vision for the data domain.

This position is important for progressing key initiatives and improving our data-centric efforts throughout GN;

"This role is crucial in driving our data strategy forward, directly impacting our ability to innovate and remain competitive across our industries".


Elaborates, Ann Fogelgren, CIO of the GN Group.


The team you will be part of:

Based at our global HQ, located in Ballerup, Denmark, you will be part of our newly established Data & Intelligence domain– and report to Director Stefan Wideland.

As part of an innovative and collaborative team, you will transform our data architecture. You will thereby collaborate across the organization with other architects and experts within data management, data governance, platform development, data engineering, data activation, BI, Analytics, GenAI enablement, to name a few.

We are a diverse team tied together by the aspiration to deliver the best solutions together with our business partners across the organization – including the wider Global IT organization – Digital, Data and IT(DDI). With colleagues from across the world – and at different geographical locations – you are part of a collaborate, fun and hybrid work environment.

Your contribution is appreciated, and you will be directing efforts in the following areas:


Implementing Data Strategy: Directing the definition and operationalization of our Data Strategy, managing one or more workstreams in a cross-functional setting, with a focus on decentralized data architectures and data product thinking.
Directing overall Data Architecture: Develop and implement a comprehensive data platform architecture that aligns with the organization's strategic goals and establish the needed structures to facilitate decision-making - including domain data architectures.
Establish Frameworks for Data Distribution, Governance, and Activation: Develop and implement robust frameworks and principles to facilitate seamless data flows and accessibility. Focus on creating standardized processes and best practices for data integration and pipeline management. Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and compliance with regulations by setting clear standards. Leverage high-quality data through these established practices to consistently generate business value, including the use of data contracts, data federation and federated data governance.
Innovation and AI Integration: Stay updated on industry trends and technologies and manage the integration of AI into our strategic roadmaps to support future aspirations and enhance data capabilities.
Technical Teams and Manage Architecture Projects: Provide leadership and advisory to technical teams and guide architectural decisions across projects, ensuring they meet established standards and align with business objectives.


To thrive in the role, we imagine that you:


Extensive Knowledge of Data Technologies: You have comprehensive skills in data technologies, particularly around Cloud (Azure), Data Integration and Distribution technologies (Integration platforms, API’s, Data Products), Data storage and Management (such as, Data Warehouse, Data Lake, and Data Lakehouse), and possess a solid view of how to utilize and activate business value through Analytics and AI-technologies, with an emphasis on scalable data management.
Proficient in Data Management Principles and Best Practices: You exhibit deep knowledge of data management principles and industry best practices to develop robust and scalable solutions, for example the design and application of Data Mesh.
Communication and Collaboration Skills: Your communication skills effectively convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. You are comfortable communicating and collaborating with a wide variety of business stakeholders, including Executive Management on data strategy initiatives.
Innovative and Creative Mindset: You bring a creative approach to problem-solving, with a willingness to challenge established practices and secure innovation in data architecture and strategy.
Leadership and Project Management Abilities: You have the capability to inspire leadership, effectively guiding technical teams and overseeing architecture projects to ensure they align with business aims and are completed effectively.


We encourage you to apply

Even if you don’t match all the above-mentioned skills, we will gladly receive your application if you think you have transferrable skills. We highly value a mindset, motivation, and energy, that aligns with our core values, to not only ensure success for you, but for your team and the wider GN organization as well.

We are dedicated to an inclusive recruitment process

All applicants will receive equal consideration for employment. As such, we encourage you to submit your CV without a photo to ensure an equal and fair application process.

Should you have any special requirements for the Interview please let the hiring manager know upon accepting invitation to interview.

How to apply?

Use the ‘APPLY’ link no later 23rd of March 2025. Applications are assessed on a continuous basis, so don’t wait to send yours.

On a time crunch? Feel free to only submit your up-to-date CV including a few sentences outlining your motivation for applying – quick and easy.

If you would like to know more about the position, please contact Director, Data & Intelligence Domain, Stefan Wideland on LinkedIn.

Join us in bringing people closer

GN brings people closer through our leading intelligent hearing, audio, video, and gaming solutions. Inspired by people and driven by innovation, we deliver technology that enhance the senses of hearing and sight. We help people with hearing loss overcome real-life challenges, improve communication and collaboration for businesses and provide great experiences for audio and gaming enthusiast.

We hope you will join us on this journey and look forward to receiving your application.
Show more

Join us in bringing people closer

GN brings people closer through our leading intelligent hearing, audio, video, and gaming solutions. Inspired by people and driven by innovation, we deliver technology that enhance the senses of hearing and sight. We help people with hearing loss overcome real-life challenges, improve communication and collaboration for businesses and provide great experiences for audio and gaming enthusiast.

We hope you will join us on this journey and look forward to receiving your application.

Title: Student Analyst
Place: Haderslev, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about finding answers in our data and eager to gain hands-on experience in a dynamic, fast-paced environment? Do you want to contribute to a data-driven decision making at BESTSELLER?

If yes to the above, the role of Student Analyst within our Data & Reporting team is the perfect opportunity for you!

THE TEAM

As a part of the Logistics Data & Reporting team, you will get experienced colleagues that work with passion and commitment to drive innovation and lead the data path forward . We have the necessary priority and trust from the business that we support to execute on our ambitious goals. We must deliver one truth and data transparency, which requires us to test new technologies and ideas. All while balancing accuracy and continuous improvement, supporting BESTSELLER’s continued global success.

THE ROLE

As a Student Analyst, you’ll play an important role in supporting our journey towards data transparency. Your tasks will include:


Build Power BI reports in accordance with a specification
Supporting our full-time Analysts in understanding the data and build reports
Verifying and cross-checking data to ensure accuracy and consistency
Investigate reports that shows incorrect data
Creating and improving data visualisations and dashboards in Power BI for better user experience


Your Benefits


Gain practical experience in presenting and communicating data
Work alongside a supportive, experienced team
Develop and sharpen your skills in data analysis
Be part of a fast-growing, global fashion company


YOUR PROFILE

We’re looking for someone who is curious, proactive, and eager to learn. Ideally, you’ll bring:


Current enrolment in a relevant programme, such as supply chain management or data analytics
Strong analytical skills with attention to detail
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel
A desire to contribute and thrive in a fast-paced environment
Knowledge of MS Power BI, DAX or basic SQL is a plus, but not required


This is a fantastic opportunity to gain real-world experience and make a meaningful impact on our supply chain. If you’re ready to take on this exciting challenge, we’d love to hear from you!

WE LOOK FORWARD TO HEARING FROM YOU

If you have any questions about the position, feel free to contact Mikael Bertelsen at +45 30 85 37 15. If not, apply today with your CV and cover letter. We review applications on an ongoing basis, so don’t miss your chance to join our dynamic team – the deadline is April 6th 2025.

EMPLOYMENT

15-20 hours per week, with flexible working hours and expected presence in the office 1-2 days a week.

LOCATION

Your work location is our distribution centre in Haderslev.

About Bestseller Logistics

BESTSELLER Logistics is responsible for all inbound and outbound logistics in BESTSELLER Group. We operate five logistics centres in Denmark, with a sixth centre being constructed in the Netherlands. We have more than 400,000 m2 of warehouse space and import approx. 16 million boxes per year. More than 600 colleagues keep the wheels running and we offer career opportunities within Logistics Development, Customs, Shipping, HSE, Operations, Controlling, Facility Services and more.

Join us and become part of the worldwide fashion company BESTSELLER. For more information, please go to www.bestseller.com.
Show more

Title: Studiejob: kommerciel Data Analyst - 15 timer pr. uge
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Brænder du for at omsætte kundedata til nye strategier og tiltag?

Så er det dig, vi søger!

Med reference til selskabets ledelsesgruppe tilbydes du et spændende studiejob i en nyoprettet funktion.

I rollen som Data Analyst er dit primære ansvar at assistere og gennemføre forskellige typer af dataorienterede projekter. Med udrulningen af den internationale vækststrategi er dine arbejdsopgaver blandt andet kunde-, konkurrent- og markedsanalyser, at understøtte salgs- og marketingafdelingen i kampagner rettet mod eksisterende kunder samt analysere kundeadfærd.

Dine Primære Arbejdsopgaver Er Blandt Andet Følgende

Dataindsamling og rensning


Indsamle data fra forskellige kilder (databaser, API'er, Excel-ark osv.).
Rense og strukturere data for at sikre nøjagtighed og konsistens.


Dataanalyse og fortolkning


Udføre statistiske analyser og identificere mønstre og tendenser.
Bruge værktøjer som SQL, Python, R eller Excel til at manipulere data.


Visualisering og rapportering


Assistere i kortlæggelse og opbygning af modeller og dashboards til rapportering
Præsentere fund og anbefalinger til ledelsen eller andre teams.
Bidrage til strategiske beslutninger ved at give datadrevne anbefalinger.


Dine Faglige Kompetencer

Vi forventer, at du er i gang med en jobrelevant bachelor- eller kandidatuddannelse inden for Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics, Matematik eller et beslægtet felt kombineret med et par års relevant studieerfaring, hvor du har opnået følgende kompetencer:


Erfaring med Excel, SQL, Python eller R
Kendskab til datavisualiseringsværktøjer (f.eks. Power BI) er et plus
Interesse for kundedata, forretningsanalyse og datadrevet beslutningstagning


Dine Personlige Egenskaber


har stærke analytiske og problemløsningsevner
evner til at arbejde selvstændigt og håndtere opgaver effektivt
brænder for kundedata, forretningsanalyse og datadrevet beslutningstagning
har gode kommunikationsevner på dansk og engelsk
har en god kommerciel og forretningsforståelse


Vi er eSmiley!

Vi er eksperter i fødevaresikkerhed med erfaring fra køkkenet. Vi er kokke. Vi er tidligere tilsynsførende. Vi er eksperter i madspild. Vi er tech-ingeniører og kreative innovatører.

Sammen skaber vi en tryggere og mere enkel hverdag for mere end 17.000 køkkener gennem vores enkle IT-løsninger, viden og faglige support.

Læs mere på: www.esmiley.dk

Din Ansøgning

Human Power bistår os i rekrutteringsprocessen.

Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte Helle, Human Power, på 5152 6372.

Vi indkalder løbende til samtale.

HTML:
Brænder du for at omsætte kundedata til nye strategier og tiltag?

Så er det dig, vi søger!

Med reference til selskabets ledelsesgruppe tilbydes du et spændende studiejob i en nyoprettet funktion.

I rollen som Data Analyst er dit primære ansvar at assistere og gennemføre forskellige typer af dataorienterede projekter. Med udrulningen af den internationale vækststrategi er dine arbejdsopgaver blandt andet kunde-, konkurrent- og markedsanalyser, at understøtte salgs- og marketingafdelingen i kampagner rettet mod eksisterende kunder samt analysere kundeadfærd.

Dine Primære Arbejdsopgaver Er Blandt Andet Følgende

Dataindsamling og rensning

  • Indsamle data fra forskellige kilder (databaser, API'er, Excel-ark osv.).
  • Rense og strukturere data for at sikre nøjagtighed og konsistens.

Dataanalyse og fortolkning

  • Udføre statistiske analyser og identificere mønstre og tendenser.
  • Bruge værktøjer som SQL, Python, R eller Excel til at manipulere data.

Visualisering og rapportering

  • Assistere i kortlæggelse og opbygning af modeller og dashboards til rapportering
  • Præsentere fund og anbefalinger til ledelsen eller andre teams.
  • Bidrage til strategiske beslutninger ved at give datadrevne anbefalinger.

Dine Faglige Kompetencer

Vi forventer, at du er i gang med en jobrelevant bachelor- eller kandidatuddannelse inden for Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics, Matematik eller et beslægtet felt kombineret med et par års relevant studieerfaring, hvor du har opnået følgende kompetencer:

  • Erfaring med Excel, SQL, Python eller R
  • Kendskab til datavisualiseringsværktøjer (f.eks. Power BI) er et plus
  • Interesse for kundedata, forretningsanalyse og datadrevet beslutningstagning

Dine Personlige Egenskaber

  • har stærke analytiske og problemløsningsevner
  • evner til at arbejde selvstændigt og håndtere opgaver effektivt
  • brænder for kundedata, forretningsanalyse og datadrevet beslutningstagning
  • har gode kommunikationsevner på dansk og engelsk
  • har en god kommerciel og forretningsforståelse

Vi er eSmiley!

Vi er eksperter i fødevaresikkerhed med erfaring fra køkkenet. Vi er kokke. Vi er tidligere tilsynsførende. Vi er eksperter i madspild. Vi er tech-ingeniører og kreative innovatører.

Sammen skaber vi en tryggere og mere enkel hverdag for mere end 17.000 køkkener gennem vores enkle IT-løsninger, viden og faglige support.

Title: Data Engineer - Challenger Academy 2025
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you excited about transforming industries with cutting-edge data technologies? Imagine working with clients across various sectors, helping them harness the power of data to solve their toughest challenges. We are looking for Challengers ready to dive into exciting data engineering projects from day one, designing scalable data pipelines and turning raw data into actionable insights.




Perks of joining our amazing team

You will be joining our NewTech team, who drive business transformation through innovation, automation, and data-driven insights. Our team delivers impactful projects across industries, always pushing the boundaries of AI, automation, and strategic analysis to create real value for clients. Collaboration is at the heart of everything we do, with a diverse team of business analysts, automation experts, and technology enthusiasts.




We foster a supportive, open culture where new ideas are encouraged and valued. Our team thrives on collaboration and continuous learning, ensuring everyone has opportunities for personal and professional growth. Beyond work, we enjoy social events and team-building activities that strengthen our close-knit community.




What sets us apart is our relentless focus on innovation, consistently staying ahead with the latest technology in automation and AI. Through our hands-on "consulting-by-doing" approach, we provide real-world experience from day one, empowering our team to make a tangible impact while accelerating both professional development and client success.




KPMG Challenger Academy

Are you looking for a graduate programme? We think we have something better! At KPMG, you have the freedom to shape your own career. With endless opportunities to grow, learn, and take on new challenges, the KPMG Challenger Academy is where you build a future you are excited about. As part of the Academy, you set your own goals, work on interesting client projects, and get the best training to develop yourself. To make things even better, you get your own Koach (not Coach—we did spell-check this job ad, but KPMG’s equivalent of a performance manager) to help you reach your full potential and achieve your goals.




The Academy is designed for your early career after graduating your master studies. The Academy is split into 3 dynamic off-site modules, each designed to get you started in your new role and develop you as a consultant. Regardless of whether you are a recent graduate or bring previous experience, we ensure that everyone starts from the same point with equal opportunities to grow professionally.




Curious to know more about the KPMG Challenger Academy? You can read much more here.




Do you recognize yourself in the following?

You are passionate about building data systems that empower organizations through intelligent data use. You thrive when solving complex challenges, especially in designing and managing scalable data pipelines and architecture. You enjoy working with SQL, ETL processes, and cloud platforms, ensuring the seamless flow of quality data across systems. Python, Microsoft tools, and Git are part of your toolkit, and you’re excited to apply these skills to build resilient data environments. Above all, you have a deep interest in data as the foundation for AI and analytics, and you’re driven to explore how cutting-edge technologies can enhance data systems.




Examples of tasks that you will do:

Design and develop data pipelines that efficiently handle large datasets across multiple platforms.
Design, develop, and maintain data infrastructure to support operational processes, reporting needs, AI and machine learning models
Collaborate with cloud technologies (Azure, AWS, GCP) to build scalable data architectures.
Implement ETL processes to ensure smooth data integration and maintain data quality.
Work with Python, Microsoft tools, and Git for coding, automation, and version control.
Contribute to building a robust data foundation for AI and analytics solutions.




Are you ready to take on the challenge and become part of KPMG? Send your application today!

If you have any questions or would like more information, please contact Christian Dausgaard cdausgaard@kpmg.com or on phone +45 40 99 77 56.




We are excited to receive your application. The deadline for applying is 13 April or as soon as we have found our new team member. This might be before the final deadline since we invite candidates for interviews on an ongoing basis.




Please note that we do not accept applications by e-mail to ensure GDPR compliance.




At KPMG, we are committed to developing diverse talent at all levels. We encourage all interested candidates to apply, regardless of age, race, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, religion, or ethnicity.




We can’t wait to hear from you!

Show more

At KPMG, we are committed to developing diverse talent at all levels. We encourage all interested candidates to apply, regardless of age, race, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, religion, or ethnicity.


We can’t wait to hear from you!

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Aarhus Municipality, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
As a Data Engineer in the Data Engineering Chapter, you will collaborate closely with diverse product teams across the business. Your role involves leveraging a range of cloud technologies and tools tailored to the specific data products you are working on.

Digital Solutions & Development > Digital Solutions > Chapter - Data Engineering #1

The Data Domains and Products, a vital part of Digital Solutions, is dedicated to delivering accurate, available, and comprehensive data products to enable actionable insights. This newly established area is an integral component of Vestas' innovative Digital Powerhouse. Our mission is to empower customers, partners, and colleagues to seamlessly discover, access, and connect essential information for informed decisions and impactful actions.

Responsibilities

Your key responsibilities will encompass:


Designing, constructing, and maintaining scalable, reliable, and efficient data products
Managing, enhancing and monitoring data products using DevOps methods
Supporting the enhancement of the common information model across the Vestas data landscape
Supporting the translation of logical models into reusable and reliable physical model
Engaging in close collaboration with the data platform team


Qualifications

We envision that you possess experience in designing, building, and maintaining data products within diverse cloud environments. Additionally, you should identify with one or more of the following qualifications:


Proficiency in programming languages like SQL or Python or C#
Experience in the development, implementation and utilization of CI/CD
Expertise in working with various Data Warehouse solutions and constructing data products using technologies such as dbt, Snowflake & databricks
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, capable of troubleshooting and resolving complex data issues
Familiarity with agile development methodologies and DevOps practices
Understanding of the data mesh concept


Competencies

On a Personal Level, We Anticipate That You


Possess a collaborative and open-minded nature, eager to contribute to a globally diverse cross-functional team within the organization
Display curiosity and passion for developing innovative data products that generate value
Thrive in dynamic environments and exhibit flexibility in adapting to evolving conditions
Exhibit strong communication skills, coupled with a proactive, problem-solving approach to accomplishing tasks
Embrace a commitment to continuous learning and a desire to contribute to the collective success of the team


What We Offer

You will join a dedicated and passionate team committed to support the business through the development and scaling of data products. You will also have the possibility to be part of forming the chapter team charter and have your say in how to best build data products on a technical level. You will experience an environment that fosters continuous learning, enabling you to actualize your ambitions and get the chance to work in an agile office environment. While we hold our team members to high individual standards of collaboration, accountability, and meeting deadlines, we provide unwavering support to one another, collectively celebrating successes and addressing challenges.

Additional Information

Work location: DK, Aarhus.

Please apply no later than 19/04/2025.

BEWARE – RECRUITMENT FRAUD

It has come to our attention that there are a number of fraudulent emails from people pretending to work for Vestas. Read more via this link, https://www.vestas.com/en/careers/our-recruitment-process

DEIB Statement

At Vestas, we recognise the value of diversity, equity, and inclusion in driving innovation and success. We strongly encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply, particularly those who may hesitate due to their identity or feel they do not meet every criterion. As our CEO states, "Expertise and talent come in many forms, and a diverse workforce enhances our ability to think differently and solve the complex challenges of our industry". Your unique perspective is what will help us powering the solution for a sustainable, green energy future.

About Vestas

Vestas is the energy industry’s global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We are specialised in designing, manufacturing, installing, and servicing wind turbines, both onshore and offshore.

Across the globe, we have installed more wind power than anyone else. We consider ourselves pioneers within the industry, as we continuously aim to design new solutions and technologies to create a more sustainable future for all of us. With more than 185 GW of wind power installed worldwide and 40+ years of experience in wind energy, we have an unmatched track record demonstrating our expertise within the field.

With 30,000 employees globally, we are a diverse team united by a common goal: to power the solution – today, tomorrow, and far into the future.

Vestas promotes a diverse workforce which embraces all social identities and is free of any discrimination. We commit to create and sustain an environment that acknowledges and harvests different experiences, skills, and perspectives. We also aim to give everyone equal access to opportunity.

To learn more about our company and life at Vestas, we invite you to visit our website at www.vestas.com and follow us on our social media channels. We also encourage you to join our Talent Universe to receive notifications on new and relevant postings.

Title: (Associate) IT Officer and Business Analyst - based at our Luxembourg
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence. The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.

The EIB, the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Legal Directorate (JU) – Coordination Division (COORD) – at its headquarters in Luxembourg, an (Associate) IT Officer and Business Analyst* - This is a full time position at grade 4/5 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.


internal benchmark (Associate) Officer Business Support for IT Applications


Panel interviews are forseen as of March 2025.

Purpose

This role is based in the Coordination Division of the Legal Directorate. As an (Associate) IT Officer and Business Analyst, you will work in coordination with a Senior Legal Engineering and Innovation Officer to: (i) co-ordinate the prospecting of new applications suitable for the Legal Directorate, (ii) ensure maintenance, assistance, development and deployment of IT applications for the Legal Directorate, (iii) liaise with stakeholders in the Legal Directorate to ensure close alignment with business needs, and (iv) contribute to successful IT project delivery and change management. You will also contribute to the development and maintenance of the Legal Directorate’s intranet presence and to compliance with the Bank’s data governance and data quality frameworks.

Operating Network

You will report to and work under the supervision of the Head of Division of JU Coordination. You will work closely with the senior management team of the Legal Directorate, JU divisions and various other counterparts. You will cooperate with central IT Services with other Data Officers and with external consultants.

Accountabilities


Contribute to the development and deployment of new IT applications in the Legal Directorate to ensure broad-based, timely and efficient take up of new technologies
Provide support to internal clients concerning existing IT applications used by the Legal Directorate
Develop, deploy and provide ongoing support for the intranet presence of the Legal Directorate
Find new use cases for existing or new IT applications, taking into account the needs of the Legal Directorate relative to the overall IT environment of the Bank
Perform the role of JU Data Officer by: (i) taking the lead in matters related to compliance with EIBG’s data governance, data management and data quality framework, (ii) identifying and remedying data governance issues adversely affecting the functioning of the Legal Directorate; and (iii) participating in meetings of the Information Governance Steering Committee and analogous bodies to represent the interests of the Legal Directorate
Contribute to streamlining of JU internal processes and map, standardize, control, and automate legal workflows, documents, templates, and electronic records
Provide change management support to IT, Legal Tech & Innovation projects in the Legal Directorate


Qualifications


University degree, preferably in Business Administration, Computer Science/Engineering and / or in another area relevant to the job
At least 3 years of relevant professional experience in a role related to IT engineering and/or innovation
Familiarity with the SDLC (software development lifecycle), ideally at the EIBG or other relevant organization, is required
Business analysis and change management experience would be a strong asset
Knowledge of all or most of the following: Microsoft Sharepoint online, Business Object, Microsoft 365, OpenText Livelink, Smart-IT is required
Excellent organisational skills and ability to prioritise and meet deadlines, with strong result and customer orientation
Understanding of the EIB ’s mission, organisation and activities
Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (*) with a good command of the other. Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage


Competencies

Find out more about EIB core competencies here

To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here

(*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.

We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.

We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.

By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.

Deadline for applications: This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open positions. The campaign will remain open until position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.


Show more

As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.

We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.

We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.

By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.

Deadline for applications: This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open positions. The campaign will remain open until position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.

Title: Senior Product Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Veo is a global leader in AI-based sports camera technology. Our innovative, fully automatic camera solution enables sports teams to record matches and training sessions without a camera operator. We’re democratizing the world of sports by granting video analysis for teams on all levels—a privilege that used to be only for the few. More than 40,000 clubs in 90+ countries record their games every week.

But what truly sets us apart? Our people. We’re a diverse group of innovative thinkers, creators, and problem-solvers who believe in delivering an incredible product—and having fun while doing it.

The Opportunity

We're looking for a Senior Product Analyst to join our Product Analytics Team - a team focused on instrumenting and using data to enable better product decisions and opportunities.

You’ll be bringing your perspectives and recommendations on our business and customers to help drive better decisions for our product, and communicate and influence teams and stakeholders through close collaboration.

Veo is in a foundational stage in how we approach building a shared understanding of metrics, baselines and drivers, and so you will play a key role in ensuring proper instrumentation and tracking, as well as ensuring that teams have common metrics which best align with goals and are build with an eye towards reusability.

Key Responsibilities


Common Metrics & KPIs: Define, implement, and maintain the metrics that align with product goals—ensuring they’re reusable, well-documented, and widely understood across teams
Quantitative Research & Insights: Conduct deep-dive analyses and experiments to verify product opportunities, making data-driven recommendations that inform our roadmap
Instrumentation & Event Tracking: Oversee proper tracking for product features. Validate, test, and document analytics events to ensure accurate and consistent data collection
Cross-Functional Alignment: Ensure all relevant teams—product, marketing, engineering, etc.—have access to meaningful insights that guide decision-making and align with our business objectives




Requirements


5+ years of professional experience in a data analytics role, ideally within SaaS, sports technology, or other analytics-driven products
Proven ability to handle ad-hoc requests, manage stakeholder expectations, and deliver actionable insights
Solid experience with setting up event tracking and instrumenting features (we use Segment)
Strong experience based knowledge in SQL and Python (or similar language)
Acumen on product intuition
Experience with BigQuery, Looker, Amplitude, Segment or similar tools
Track record of translating complex analyses into actionable recommendations
Experience setting up and running experiments
Full professional proficiency in English




Our Copenhagen office mirrors our innovative technology – with an indoor ball court, rooftop terrace, and well-equipped gym. We have created a facility that supports connecting disciplines across the business, facilitates creative thinking, and gives the space to engage with colleagues, our global partners, and the entire Veo community.

We value diversity and inclusion and welcome applicants from all backgrounds, even if your experience doesn’t completely match every qualification listed. What matters most is your creativity, potential, and ability to contribute meaningfully.
Show more

Title: Student Worker with machine learning engineer profile
Place: Billund, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Are you interested in creating a new machine learning cycle to deliver cutting edge content and generate better data management?

Bring your enthusiasm, interest and curiosity to the table and help shape the digital platform that supports the health and safety for everyone in the LEGO Group.


Core Responsibilities

Key tasks





Understand the health and safety data.
Maintain the translation setup to adapt to new content (python).
Maintain current machine learning cycle.
Create new machine learning cycle to support decision making.
Identify future possibilities and the information that needs to be added for it to be achieved.




Purpose of the role

The EHS department has a basic data analysis setup based on information gathered from SAP. Though the current process is reactive, we have the ambition to go further and become more proactive in our approach and identify trends that are currently laying in the unstructured and nominal data (such as descriptions). This will allow us to answer new questions such as





What can we do to prevent the next (lost time) injury?
Which area should we focus on (campaign, training,…)?
Who is prone to incidents?




And also allow for an improvement of the quality of the information reported





Is the incident properly classified?




To reach that goal, we are looking for a Master degree student worker for a minimum of a year who will look into using machine learning cycles on the health and safety incident data.

All current development are made in Databricks in Python and deployed to the relevant environments by using GitHub. Descriptions are provided in multiple languages and translated automatically in Databricks. It will be important to maintain the current setup and build on it.

Play your part in our team succeeding

The department

The purpose of the global health and safety department (25 employees) is to set direction and ambition regarding health and safety in the LEGO Group and drive globalization and standardization of best practices across LEGO Group striving towards zero accidents. The global health and safety department acts as a center of excellence and supports the organization on several specialist areas within health and safety

This role is an excellent opportunity to be part of a team working cross-functionally with global responsibility focusing on the health and safety of all employees. The role gives an end to end understanding of the value chain and offers an opportunity to exercise influence through broad organizational exposure and to learn and get diverse insights to various parts of organization and most of the value chain. Employee health and safety is a high priority in the LEGO Group. The global environment is both fun and challenging. Collaborating across cultures and time zones is both demanding and rewarding by linking everyone together, finding best, suitable solution. Being in a global role facilitates the comprehension of the holistic picture of the company and put things into perspective.

Do you have what it takes?





It is a prerequisite that you are enrolled in an educational institution during your employment as a student worker.
Interest in Data Intelligence and its application in the business.
Basic knowledge Machine Learning pipelines.
Know Python.
Feels comfortable reaching out to people outside the direct team for guidance, help and support.
Experience with Business Intelligence tools (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Experience with data transformations and scheduling pipelines tools (Databricks).
Experience with GitHub.
Take initiatives and challenges the status quo.
English at fluent level is required as this is the standard office language.




Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

Research shows that women and people from different underrepresented backgrounds often only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the listed qualifications. For all candidates, if you dream of being a part of our team and you meet many, but not all of our listed qualifications for this role, please apply.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.
Show more

Title: Asset Performance Analyst
Place: Fredericia, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join us in this role where you’ll support UK West Nearshore Operations by providing detailed analysis of asset performance data to enhance reliability, efficiency, and safety of offshore operations. This role is responsible for gathering, interpreting, and reporting on performance metrics, identifying trends and areas for improvement, and supporting data-driven decision-making processes.

Welcome to UK West Hub / Region Europe Generation

You’ll be part of Asset Performance where you, together with your colleagues, will you’ll play a key role in enabling continuous improvement and operational excellence within the Asset Performance team. As a team, we prioritise collaboration, innovation, and the use of data-driven insights to drive performance improvements.

You’ll play an important role in:


gathering and analysing data related to performance, including reliability, downtime, maintenance efficiency, and other key performance indicators (KPIs)
monitoring trends in performance metrics, identifying potential issues, areas of concern, and opportunities for improvement
using statistical methods and data visualisation tools to interpret performance data, enabling clear insights and data-driven recommendations.
supporting the Head of Asset Performance in setting performance benchmarks, developing KPIs, and tracking progress against targets
communicating findings and recommendations effectively to stakeholders at various levels of the organisation.


To succeed in the role, you:


have proven experience in data analysis and performance reporting within an offshore or industrial context
possess strong analytical skills with the ability to use statistical methods and data visualisation tools.
demonstrate excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to present complex information clearly
are highly detail-oriented and capable of identifying trends and insights from large datasets
show a proactive and collaborative approach to problem-solving and continuous improvement.


Maybe you’ve read the above and can see you have some transferable skills, even though they don’t quite match all the points. If you think you can bring something to the team, we still encourage you to apply.

Shape the future with us

Send your application to us as soon as possible. We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we’ve found the right candidate.

As an applicant or employee, you may request reasonable work and position accommodation or adjustments via accommodation@orsted.com.

Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application via our online career pages and answer the screening questions relevant for your country. We don't take applications or inquiries from external recruiters or agencies into account for this position.
Show more

Title: Studentermedarbejder: Business Intelligence i ambitiøst konsulenthus
Description:
Er du en analytisk og teknisk dygtig studerende med interesse for Business Intelligence, dataanalyse og datamodellering? Vil du udvikle dine færdigheder i Power BI, SQL og Python i et ambitiøst konsulenthus? Så er du måske den helt rigtige til Human Engage!

 

HVAD ER DET FOR ET JOB?

Human Engage er et konsulenthus, der arbejder med kvantitative og kvalitative analyser for at skabe indsigt og forandring i organisationer. Vi har brug for en studentermedhjælper ca. 10-15 timer om ugen til at styrke vores arbejde med dataanalyse og visualisering. Din primære opgave vil være at udvikle og optimere vores BI-løsninger, herunder:

·       Udvikling af dashboards og rapporter i Power BI

·       Datahåndtering og analyse med Python (fx pandas/numpy)

·       Datamodellering med fokus på Star Schema




HVEM ER DU?

·       Du er i gang med en bachelor- eller kandidatuddannelse inden for business intelligence, data science, datalogi, økonomi med fokus på BI eller et beslægtet felt

·       Du har erfaring med Power BI, SQL og Python (pandas/numpy)

·       Du har gerne forståelse for datamodellering, herunder Star Schema

·       Du arbejder struktureret og analytisk

·       Du kan tage ansvar og arbejde selvstændigt samt indgå i et mindre team

·       Du har interesse for at omsætte data til indsigt og beslutningsgrundlag




HVEM ER VI?

Human Engage er et ambitiøst konsulenthus med et ønske om at skabe forandring og udvikling i organisationer – altid med udgangspunkt i valid viden og klar data. Gensidig respekt, ønsket om udvikling og tillid til hinanden er essentielt for os, og vi ser en stor værdi i forskellighed og rummelighed.  Vi er et mindre team på under ti personer fordelt på to kontorer i henholdsvis Odense (havnen) og Århus (Store Torv), hvor arbejdspladsen er præget af store ambitioner, gode relationer og ikke mindst højt humør!

 

HVOR OG HVORNÅR?

Din primære arbejdsplads vil være på et af vores kontorer – vi ønsker den bedste kandidat.  

Vi vurderer indkomne ansøgninger løbende, og forventer opstart snarest muligt.

 

Læs mere om os her: https://hnengage.com/om-os/  

 

KONTAKT OS:

Partner Henrik Kjærgaard Clausen

Tlf.: 28 10 11 80

Mail: hkc@hnengage.com

Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Student Analyst
Description:
Drive Meaningful Change

Are you ready to support an agile and dynamic BI team and grow your skills in data-driven decision-making? Join our team at Abacus Medicine Group, where you’ll play an integral part in shaping business intelligence solutions and contributing to impactful projects. You will be part of a fast-paced, collaborative environment, gaining hands-on experience while enhancing your technical capabilities.




Get a Glimpse of Our World

The Business Intelligence team is a young, diverse group of professionals who are passionate about data and always eager to learn. We work closely with various departments and stakeholders across the organization, ensuring that data insights are delivered in a meaningful way. We value curiosity, innovation, and collaboration within our team, making it an exciting place to grow both professionally and personally.

As a member of the BI team, you’ll find yourself working alongside experienced BI developers and supporting various business units, all while contributing to high-impact solutions. If you’re looking for a team that’s flexible, fast-moving, and always adapting to new challenges, this is the right fit for you.




Realize Your Opportunities as BI Student Analyst

The Business Intelligence Student Analyst will support the BI team by managing incoming tickets and tasks, ensuring they are resolved or assigned appropriately. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work with a variety of stakeholders, assist in developing BI solutions, and enhance the existing technical infrastructure. You will also gain hands-on experience working with Power BI and cloud technologies, while collaborating on projects and participating in data analyses.




Your main responsibilities include:

Managing incoming tickets for the BI team and ensuring tasks are resolved or assigned as appropriate
Building and maintaining relationships with internal stakeholders, representing the BI team’s interests
Monitoring and maintaining the BI Power BI platform
Contributing to the development of technical infrastructure, including cloud environments and front-end tools
Participating in ad-hoc analyses and assisting with analysis projects in coordination with the manager




Fuel for Your Success in the Role

We are looking for someone who is proactive, curious, self-driven, and reliable, with the ability to work both independently and as part of a team. You should be eager to learn and adapt in a dynamic environment, with a strong understanding of data fundamentals.

Furthermore, we hope the following points describe you:

You are in the final year of a Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Economics, Information Systems or a Data- related field.
You might already have some relevant student job experience.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, etc.).
Familiarity with BI tools such as Power BI.
Basic understanding of SQL and data modeling techniques.
Exposure to cloud platforms like Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud is a plus.
Initial experience or coursework in data integration tools (e.g., SSIS, Data Factory, or Talend).




Would you like to know more about us?

If you want to apply for the position, please follow the link and attach your CV and cover letter.




Interested?

Follow us on Instagram and LinkedIn and get an insight into everyday life at Abacus Medicine. For job openings, check our Career page.




Moving Healthcare. Moving You.

In Abacus Medicine Group, you’ll experience the power of Moving Healthcare. With our change mindset, we're moving the industry and improving healthcare as we broaden access to medicine.

But it's not just about moving healthcare, it's about Moving You. You’ll be part of a caring community of more than 1,500 people across the World. With us, you will be valued, empowered, and have a direct impact on driving change. Let's access the future of medicine and make a difference together. Your move.

Show more

Join our team at Abacus Medicine Group, where you’ll play an integral part in shaping business intelligence solutions and contributing to impactful projects. You will be part of a fast-paced, collaborative environment, gaining hands-on experience while enhancing your technical capabilities.


Get a Glimpse of Our World

The Business Intelligence team is a young, diverse group of professionals who are passionate about data and always eager to learn. We work closely with various departments and stakeholders across the organization, ensuring that data insights are delivered in a meaningful way. We value curiosity, innovation, and collaboration within our team, making it an exciting place to grow both professionally and personally.

As a member of the BI team, you’ll find yourself working alongside experienced BI developers and supporting various business units, all while contributing to high-impact solutions. If you’re looking for a team that’s flexible, fast-moving, and always adapting to new challenges, this is the right fit for you.


Realize Your Opportunities as BI Student Analyst

The Business Intelligence Student Analyst will support the BI team by managing incoming tickets and tasks, ensuring they are resolved or assigned appropriately. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work with a variety of stakeholders, assist in developing BI solutions, and enhance the existing technical infrastructure. You will also gain hands-on experience working with Power BI and cloud technologies, while collaborating on projects and participating in data analyses.


Your main responsibilities include:

  • Managing incoming tickets for the BI team and ensuring tasks are resolved or assigned as appropriate
  • Building and maintaining relationships with internal stakeholders, representing the BI team’s interests
  • Monitoring and maintaining the BI Power BI platform
  • Contributing to the development of technical infrastructure, including cloud environments and front-end tools
  • Participating in ad-hoc analyses and assisting with analysis projects in coordination with the manager


Fuel for Your Success in the Role

We are looking for someone who is proactive, curious, self-driven, and reliable, with the ability to work both independently and as part of a team. You should be eager to learn and adapt in a dynamic environment, with a strong understanding of data fundamentals.

Furthermore, we hope the following points describe you:

  • You are in the final year of a Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Economics, Information Systems or a Data- related field.
  • You might already have some relevant student job experience.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, etc.).
  • Familiarity with BI tools such as Power BI.
  • Basic understanding of SQL and data modeling techniques.
  • Exposure to cloud platforms like Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud is a plus.
  • Initial experience or coursework in data integration tools (e.g., SSIS, Data Factory, or Talend).


Would you like to know more about us?

If you want to apply for the position, please follow the link and attach your CV and cover letter.


Interested?

Follow us on Instagram and LinkedIn and get an insight into everyday life at Abacus Medicine. For job openings, check our Career page.


Moving Healthcare. Moving You.

In Abacus Medicine Group, you’ll experience the power of Moving Healthcare. With our change mindset, we're moving the industry and improving healthcare as we broaden access to medicine.

But it's not just about moving healthcare, it's about Moving You. You’ll be part of a caring community of more than 1,500 people across the World. With us, you will be valued, empowered, and have a direct impact on driving change. Let's access the future of medicine and make a difference together. Your move.

Title: Student assistant - Sustainability data specialist
Place: Gentofte, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join us in this role where you’ll be part of our dedicated team responsible for data validation, processing, and calculation of sustainability data (certification type, feedstock types etc.) including CO2 calculations. You'll play a key role in our internal procedures for checking sustainability data provided by our suppliers. Further you'll work closely with our Sustainability Data Specialist on maintaining but also developing our internal systems responsible for deliver real-time output data requested both for internal and external stakeholders.

Welcome to Welcome to Bio Markets

You’ll be part of a dedicated team in Bioenergy Sustainability, Fuel and Logistic where you, together with your colleagues, will play a key role in securing that documentation of all sustainability requirements are delivered by our suppliers of Biomass. Especially you'll be part of the process of collecting data and documentation as well as our internal processes for validation and control. This is the cornerstone of our internal IT- systems enabling us to maintain our chain of custody certification. Furthermore, you'll assist the Sustainability Data Specialist in the work with insightful data extraction and analysis. As a team, we work close together but with individual expertise and responsibilities. You are responsible for your own workday delivering into the continuously task and responsibilities.

You’ll play an important role in:


being responsible of collecting and controlling sustainability data provided by our suppliers and having the dialogue with biomass supplier regarding data and documentation
being responsible for upstreaming CO2 emissions- and total CO2 savings calculations
securing data documentation for maintaining our FSC, PEFC and SBP Chain of custody certification
assisting in the development of data models/our systems adapted to new requirements both internal and external i.e. new regulations, EUDR, RED III etc.
being part of developing our systems to continuously adapt to new requirements (like EUDR, RED III etc.) incl. translating numerous data points into commercial insights.


To succeed in the role, you:


need to demonstrate high attention to details both in data and systems
are an experienced excel-user, with interest in data handling and interested in learning
are a basic user of R-studio or similar programming language, e.g. Python
are currently enrolled in a bachelor’s degree program in the field of engineering, economics, or mathematics with a high focus on or strong interest in environmental and natural science, e.g. environmental engineering, environmental economics, natural resources or similar
have general understanding of the use of biomass for energy and interest in CO2 emission calculations.


Maybe you’ve read the above and can see you have some transferable skills, even though they don’t quite match all the points. If you think you can bring something to the team, we still encourage you to apply.

Shape the future with us

Send your application, CV and other relevant documents to us as soon as possible. We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we’ve found the right candidate.

As an applicant or employee, you may request reasonable work and position accommodation or adjustments via accommodation@orsted.com.

Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application via our online career pages and answer the screening questions relevant for your country. We don't take applications or inquiries from external recruiters or agencies into account for this position.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (Senior Foundations Analyst)
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious goal: to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together.

40% of all food produced in the world is wasted. And that has a huge impact on the health of our planet, with 10% of greenhouse gas emissions coming from food waste.

We’re more than an app: we are a certified B Corporation with a mission to empower everyone to take action against food waste, so alongside our marketplace app, we create educational tools, explore new business solutions - such as our Retail Technologies offering, and influence legislation to help reduce food waste.

We’re growing fast: Our community of 108 million registered users and 245,000 active partners across 19 countries, have together already prevented 395+ million meals from going to waste - avoiding over 1066.000 tonnes of CO2e!

Your mission

We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst (called "Senior Foundations Analyst" internally) to strengthen our use of data to inform our most business critical decisions. On a daily basis, you will be working with business leaders across various functional areas to inform how they measure success, how they use data to inform strategic decisions, and ensure they have the data visibility and tools they need to make progress on those strategies every day.

Your role


Support business leaders in identifying the right KPIs to drive business performance
Provide data-driven guidance to business leaders on key strategic decisions
Design and deliver self-service tools to various functional groups for operational excellence
Generate new ideas for how to leverage the data we have to drive business performance
Elevate data literacy across the organisation, with an eye toward consistency, ease of understanding, and educating on the right way to use data in each function
Elevate the Global Analytics team by sharing best practices and learnings and offering ad-hoc guidance to other team members on their projects


Requirements


You have previous experience in analytical roles overtime
You are strongly proficient in Looker
You are strongly proficient in SQL
You have a breadth of experience mapping business questions to data problems
You are a great communicator and storyteller - someone who enjoys helping non-technical audiences see what you see in the numbers!
You are driven by the “why” behind the work that you do, always eager to ask an extra question to make sure you’re solving for the right thing
You have experience managing multiple projects
You are passionate about data literacy
You have a proactive mindset and work well in a team environment


Our values


We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We believe in a #oneteam.
We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
We build a legacy: We’re proud of the change we’re driving.
We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.


What We Have To Offer


An opportunity to work in a global social-impact company and certified B Corporation! where you can see a real and tangible impact in your role.
To be an integral part of our Data & Analytics team. We are eager for you to make an impact and contribute to the role of analytics across key decisions and our solution processes. Your insights are valuable, and we are here to listen.
Work-life balance is important to us! Focus on the job to be done, not the hours spent, there is no need for overtime.
We trust in our employees and encourage an autonomous environment that provides several opportunities for employees to contribute, develop and take ownership of their work in a way that works for them.
To be part of an international company, with over 1,300+ colleagues across 19 countries that are on the same important mission.
An informal environment, working alongside 190+ passionate people within Tech & Product
We celebrate our differences and our successes and have a strong values-driven team culture.
We work in a hybrid set-up and value in office work weekly.
We may be able to support you with a working visa in Copenhagen, please be prepared to discuss this topic further as your first stage interview.


How To Apply


We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
Submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.


Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it’s only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we’re allowed to be ourselves, and we’re committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.


Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Azure Data Engineer




Som Data Engineer hos cVation bygger du dataplatforme, datawarehouses samt laver MLOps løsninger i skyen for vores kunder. Vi arbejder med en række spændende teknologier, herunder Databricks, Fabric, Azure Machine Learning, Data Factory, Azure Synapse og Spark, og laver ikke bare dataudtræk, men bygger ting, der skal i Prod. Vi leder derfor efter flere profiler med erfaring indenfor enten MLOps, datawarehouses eller dataplatforme, som har lyst til at bygge dataløsninger for vores kunder.




cVation er et dansk udviklings- og konsulenthus, som bygger avancerede cloudløsninger på Azure med afsæt i markedets hurtigste og mest agile metoder. Cvation blev stiftet i 2014, har modtaget tre Børsen Gazeller og vundet Microsofts Partner Award for App Innovation tre år i træk. Vi arbejder dedikeret med agile arbejdsmetoder, DevOps og Test Driven Development, og er på forkant med mange af de nye teknologier, herunder IoT. Vi sætter en ære i at levere software af den højeste kvalitet, og tager desuden principperne fra DevOps og software engineering med i vores dataprojekter, hvilket betyder, at tests, Infrastructure as Code og automatisering er i fokus.




Hvilken rolle får du?




Du kommer til at arbejde på et af vores dataprojekter med et projektteam bestående af arkitekter, software udviklere og DevOps specialister. Du vil have fuldt fokus på ét projekt og være tilknyttet ét team ad gangen.




Din rolle bliver at




rådgive om og bygge datamigrerings- og datamoderniseringsprojekter
rådgive om og bygge datawarehouse/dataplatformsløsninger i skyen
rådgive om og bygge løsninger indenfor MLOps
bidrage til design og implementering af den optimale Azure infrastruktur
sikre, at alt opsætning og provisionering sker som infrastructure as code
fuldautomatiseret overvågning og skalering af løsninger




Hvad forventer vi af dig?




Du har en videregående uddannelse i data engineering, data science, Human centered AI el lign. fra DTU, ITU eller KU
Du har enten fullstack MLOps erfaring og kan skrive Python - eller måske kommer du i stedet med erfaring i at bygge datawarehouse og dataplatforme. Vi skal nok lære dig det, du mangler på Azure, IaC, MLOps etc.
Du vil gerne arbejde med de nyeste teknologier i Azure
Infrastructure as code er måden du arbejder på, f.eks. Bicep eller Terraform
Du har erfaring med nogle - og vil gerne blive klogere på - flere af følgende teknologier: Data Factory - Databricks - Fabric - Azure Synapse - Azure Machine Learning - MLflow - Spark - Data Warehouse - Data platform - Python - Azure DevOps, Powershell, Azure CLI, ARM templates, YAML, Bicep, Terraform, Git
Du vil gerne indgå i et agilt setup, hvor krav og retning hurtigt kan ændres, men hvor medbestemmelse og frihed er i højsædet
Du er flydende i skrift og tale på dansk og engelsk, og trives med at have den daglige kontakt med kunden
Du har evnen til at omsætte kundebehov til handling




Det vil være en fordel, hvis:

Du er vant til at arbejde som konsulent i et udviklingsteam i tæt samarbejde med arkitekter og software udviklere




Som person er du selvstændig, ansvarsbevidst, initiativrig, eksekverende og serviceminded. Du er drevet af at lære nyt og vild med at holde dig ajour med de nyeste metoder og teknologier. Du er engageret og motiveret i alt hvad du foretager dig. Hvis du også er glad for at sparre med dygtige kollegaer og trives med at løfte i flok, vil du passe perfekt ind hos os.




Hvad tilbyder vi?




Du kommer til at indgå i vores voksende team, hvor høj faglighed, innovation og arbejdsglæde er i højsæde. Det høje faglige niveau blandt dine kollegaer giver en unik mulighed for at arbejde med de bedste, og vi tager din faglige udvikling alvorligt. Vi har en flad organisation med et minimum af administration, hvor ledelsens døre altid er åbne, og der er god plads til både bordfodbold, fredagsbar, frokost på kajen og et aktivt liv udenfor arbejdstid. Flere gange om året afholder vi hackathons, hvor vi i teams dykker ned i præcis de emner, som udviklerne finder interessante. En del af vores kultur er også, at vi gerne ser alle komme med input til hvordan vi kan optimere, udvikle og forbedre cVation.




Hvorfor vælge os som din nye arbejdsplads?




Vores fundament er løsninger bygget på Microsoft Azure Cloud. Alle vores medarbejdere mestrer cloud-native udvikling og DevOps. Vi arbejder i projekter og engagerer os hands-on i fælles teams med vores kunder for at sikre kvalitet og effektiv videndeling.




Vi er passionerede omkring at hjælpe vores kunder med at få det maksimale ud af cloudteknologien. For os er cloud ikke blot infrastruktur eller et nyt datacenter i skyen. Teknologien giver virksomheder mulighed for at skabe væsentligt mere værdi og arbejde med agilitet og innovation på en helt ny måde.




Vi har været med fra starten, da cloud blev udviklet og tilgængeligt. Vi tilbyder således vores årelange erfaring og dybe cloud ekspertise samt en værktøjskasse med alle vores best practices i form af accelerationsplatformen CADD. Den dækker over gennemprøvede værktøjer, rammeværk, effektive udviklingsmetoder og færdige automatiseringskomponenter. Alt dette for at sikre, at projekter kommer hurtigt og sikkert fra start.




Du vil blive en del af en virksomhed, som tror på, at alle har betydning, og at det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde hver dag. Du vil få kollegaer, der er interesseret i at lære og har ønske om at blive de bedste til det, de gør. Vi tilbyder derfor gode muligheder for at udvikle dig.




Interesseret?




Klik på Easy Apply knappen, hvis du vil arbejde med de nyeste teknologier. Vi behandler din ansøgning fortroligt og arrangerer løbende interviews.




Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, eller vil du høre mere om cVation, er du meget velkommen til at kontakte:




Maiken Pelby, Head of People & Culture, T/ 42612828, map@cvation.com




Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!

Flere gange om året afholder vi hackathons, hvor vi i teams dykker ned i præcis de emner, som udviklerne finder interessante. En del af vores kultur er også, at vi gerne ser alle komme med input til hvordan vi kan optimere, udvikle og forbedre cVation.


Hvorfor vælge os som din nye arbejdsplads?


Vores fundament er løsninger bygget på Microsoft Azure Cloud. Alle vores medarbejdere mestrer cloud-native udvikling og DevOps. Vi arbejder i projekter og engagerer os hands-on i fælles teams med vores kunder for at sikre kvalitet og effektiv videndeling.


Vi er passionerede omkring at hjælpe vores kunder med at få det maksimale ud af cloudteknologien. For os er cloud ikke blot infrastruktur eller et nyt datacenter i skyen. Teknologien giver virksomheder mulighed for at skabe væsentligt mere værdi og arbejde med agilitet og innovation på en helt ny måde.


Vi har været med fra starten, da cloud blev udviklet og tilgængeligt. Vi tilbyder således vores årelange erfaring og dybe cloud ekspertise samt en værktøjskasse med alle vores best practices i form af accelerationsplatformen CADD. Den dækker over gennemprøvede værktøjer, rammeværk, effektive udviklingsmetoder og færdige automatiseringskomponenter. Alt dette for at sikre, at projekter kommer hurtigt og sikkert fra start.


Du vil blive en del af en virksomhed, som tror på, at alle har betydning, og at det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde hver dag. Du vil få kollegaer, der er interesseret i at lære og har ønske om at blive de bedste til det, de gør. Vi tilbyder derfor gode muligheder for at udvikle dig.


Interesseret?


Klik på Easy Apply knappen, hvis du vil arbejde med de nyeste teknologier. Vi behandler din ansøgning fortroligt og arrangerer løbende interviews.


Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, eller vil du høre mere om cVation, er du meget velkommen til at kontakte:


Maiken Pelby, Head of People & Culture, T/ 42612828, map@cvation.com


Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!

Title: Commercial Business Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Copenhagen, Denmark

We are looking for a proactive and results-oriented Commercial Business Analyst to join our Digital Activation Analytics team under Group Commercial at Saxo Bank. In this role, you will play a key part in analyzing data to understand customer needs and suggesting improvements based on your findings as well as understanding and optimizing the impact of our TREA inspirational content, measuring what content strategies work and for which clients.

The ideal candidate will need to have a strong background in commercial operations, data analysis and cross-functional collaboration.

Key Responsibilities


Analyze data to identify trends and insights that can help improve our products and services.
Create and maintain dashboards to visualize data and track performance.
Track our digital engagement efforts such as how TREA inspirational content is impacting key KPIs: %Clients Active, %Multi-Asset and %NFC->NTC.
Identify, define, and quantify clients’ needs. Develop and maintain global and local “client buckets” clustering clients in similar situations and similar needs.
Collaborate with cross functional teams and local offices to identify successful strategies and areas for improvement. Share best practices and drive continuous improvement across all locations
Proactively suggest solutions based on data analysis to meet customer needs.
Identify which of our products, solutions and services address persona buckets’ needs in the most commercially viable way
Contribute to the strategy and advocate for automation of processes and tooling improvements.
Promote the adoption of a data-driven mindset and the benefits of A/B testing by educating our local offices and internal stakeholders.


Ideal Candidate


Experience in a commercial or business development role, preferably in a global context
Excellent skills in creating dashboards and visualizing data to support decision making
Ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams and multiple offices
Excellent collaboration and communication skills
Proactive and results-oriented mindset.
Familiarity with statistics and econometrics.
Experience with performance tracking and dashboard management
Knowledge of SQL, Power BI, Databricks, Adobe CDP, or Adobe Journey Optimizer is a plus.


Why Join Us

At Saxo Bank, we value innovation, collaboration, and a proactive approach to problem-solving. Join our team and help us shape the future of finance by providing valuable insights and solutions based on data.

Does this look good to you? Is there anything else you would like to add or change?

We get curious people invested in the world

When you work at Saxo, you become a Saxonian and part of a purpose-driven organisation, where good ideas are always taken seriously, and where you can make a true impact. We are invested in your development, and you can expect a robust career from day one when you join Saxo – no matter which role you take on.

You will join 2,500 other ambitious colleagues across 15 countries and become part of an international organisation. Working in Saxo, you will get to meet colleagues from many different cultures and backgrounds, and you should know that we value diversity and inclusion and see it as a genuine source of strength to drive growth, foster innovation and position us for long-term success.

We encourage an open feedback culture and supportive team environments enabling employees to grow and fulfil their career aspirations.

When you bring passion, curiosity, drive and team spirit, your learning journey will be dynamic and your career opportunities in Saxo will be immense.

At Saxo we don’t just offer a job – we offer an opportunity to invest in your future!

How To Apply

Click here to create an account and upload your resume and a short motivation. We look forward to getting to know you better!
