Title: Game Analytics Team Lead
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
It’s an exciting time to join Tactile. We're a diverse team of storytellers, puzzle enthusiasts and casual mobile game creators. Our story began in 2008 in the heart of beautiful Copenhagen, and since then we have experienced continuous growth, establishing ourselves as one of the largest gaming companies in Denmark. In more recent years, we have been scaling fast, in big part thanks to the success of a little game called Lily’s Garden. Now we’re on a mission to solidify our position as one of the leaders in creating out-of-the-ordinary casual puzzle games.

With more than 350 talented individuals, we are a mix of over 55 nationalities and 43% women. We truly appreciate the richness of different experiences and perspectives that Tactilers bring to the game. This is why we foster a lean organisational culture, in which each individual is encouraged to take responsibility, be open and grow in their own way. We pride ourselves in cultivating a studio environment that stays away from crunch, that fosters your skills no matter what your discipline is, and one that gives you a place to be creative alongside other passionate and invested storytellers.

🚀 Your Role & Impact

We are currently growing our Analytics team and are in the search for the Lead Game Analyst.

In this key role, you will be responsible for ensuring that the foundation of our data infrastructure for Lily's Garden game is solid and consistent (from as early on as possible), as well as contributing to a broader vision for our game analytics as a whole. You'll lead a team of game analysts, shape the vision for analytics, provide data-driven insights to senior leadership, and drive initiatives to improve processes and solutions across the company.

So if you have prior experience in data analytics, team leadership, along with a big interest in understanding how games work and what makes them successful, then you might just be our missing piece! 🧩

This role is based in our beautiful Copenhagen office, as we truly believe that when talented people work closely together, amazing things happen! We therefore offer full relocation support to those coming from outside of Denmark. Here’s what you'll do on the day-to-day:


You will uncover insights, identify challenges and opportunities and develop strategies for improving our games
Enhance our capabilities in detailed game analytics and operational reporting by shaping our data stack and platform
Managing one of our talented Data teams
You will be collaborating closely with the rest of the game team to establish, measure and track key metrics for success
Communicating key insights and findings to cross-functional teams
Keeping an up-to-date knowledge of project KPIs
Stay on top of the current industry trends and best practices, applying them where appropriate to enhance product insights capabilities


What we’re looking for:


Strong background in leading strategic data projects and mentoring a diverse team of data analysts
You have a proven track record of working in a senior capacity with multiple stakeholders in fast paced environments.
You have a strong background in data analytics and a good understanding of applied statistics (such as sampling, hypothesis testing and ab testing)
Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data and effectively communicate findings to all audiences to drive informed product decisions.
Strong technical skills, with proficiency in SQL and Python or other scripting languages
Experience with large data sets and data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Looker, PowerBI)


You'll make us extra excited if you also have:


Experience with casual mobile games and an understanding of today’s casual mobile games market


What’s in it for you?

🌆 Beautiful office space with probably the best view in Copenhagen

🩺 Pension and private health insurance

💻 A chance to work with the latest tools and technology

📚 Opportunities for individual growth with development talks as well as workshops, books and courses

🌮 Daily, healthy organic breakfast and lunch prepared by our professional chefs in-house

🥳 Social activities, including game nights, book club, Friday bar and more

✈️ Relocation package if you are coming from outside of Denmark

🔍 Free Danish lessons with our in-house Danish teacher

Our interview process

Submit your application via the fill-in form at the top of this page. This is the easiest and fastest way to get in touch with our recruiters. We foster an inclusive culture and accessible workplace and want to make sure we provide everyone with the same opportunities for success. This is why we encourage you to apply regardless of your gender, sexuality, age, nationality, neurodiversity or disability. We review applications based on competencies and experience, so please do tell us about your favourite projects and technologies.

After we review your application, you can expect to go through the following conversations: ☕ Introductory chat with your recruiter to make sure we’re aligned on the scope of the role and your skillset and to provide more context for you. 🤝 Chat with a Data analytics leadership member. 🧪 A test assignment, to see your skills in action. 🤝 In this final step, you’ll be meeting with the team to present your test solutions and discuss the more technical aspects of the role.

We are pretty thorough with our hiring process. It is important to us that we choose new Tactilers carefully - just as it is vital to ensure that we are the right place for you.‍

We want to ensure you have a great candidate experience whilst in our recruitment process. We will do everything we can within reason to make sure that your interview takes place in an environment that fairly and accurately assesses your skills. If you need assistance or accommodation, please let us know. We look forward to receiving your application! 👋
Show more

Title: Register in our candidate data base
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Veo is a global leader in AI-based sports camera technology. Our innovative, fully automatic camera solution enables sports teams to record matches and training sessions without a camera operator. We’re democratizing the world of sports by granting video analysis for teams on all levels—a privilege that used to be only for the few. More than 40,000 clubs in 90+ countries record their games every week.

Growing as fast as we do in Veo means that every day is different, exciting, and challenging, both on the front line and in the back office.

But that’s not the most remarkable thing about us.

The coolest thing is our people. We’ve attracted some of the brightest minds in the industry. They are the reason we can create a great product and do it while enjoying ourselves.

Does your dream job at Veo not appear on the list, then sign up in our candidate data base and we will get in contact with you if the right opportunity arises for you.

At Veo, you'll be part of a thriving work environment where every day brings new excitement. Our rapid growth ensures a diverse and ever-changing atmosphere. We believe in work-life balance and providing a positive culture that allows you to thrive personally and professionally.

Our Copenhagen office mirrors our innovative technology – with an indoor ball court, rooftop terrace, and well-equipped gym. We have created a facility that supports connecting disciplines across the business, facilitates creative thinking, and gives the space to engage with colleagues, our global partners, and the entire Veo community.

Diversity and differences are valuable assets for us. We value diversity and inclusion and welcome people from all backgrounds. If you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we still encourage you to apply.

We’re committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. And you may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Still interested? Join us at Veo and become a part of a team that delivers greatness and has a great time doing it.

We will invite for interviews continuously, so apply with LinkedIn or your resume as soon as possible.
Show more

Title: Principal Statistician
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Principal Statistician




Are you a skilled statistician looking to make a significant impact in biometrics?




Our client, a small-sized CRO specialized in statistics and data management, is seeking a talented Statistician to join their dedicated team.




Our client specializes in top-tier biometric services, including statistical consulting, data mapping, clinical data management, and data monitoring committee services. Their commitment to excellence and innovation has established them as a trusted partner in the industry.




Key Responsibilities:




Developing methods for gathering data from multiple sources.
Ensuring data accuracy and creating necessary documentation.
Managing projects, including stakeholder relationships.
Occasionally serving in a supervisory capacity for sponsors.




Why join the team?




Professional Growth: Be part of a small, dedicated team with a flat organizational structure, offering ample room for personal and professional development.
Work-Life Balance: Offering a 4-day, 30 hours, work week, they value work-life balance, ensuring a flexible work environment where teamwork and personal well-being go hand-in-hand.
Collaborative Culture: They prioritize chemistry and the desire to be part of a close-knit group of colleagues, welcoming both new and experienced candidates.







If you're ready to contribute to meaningful projects and grow with a company that values expertise and collaboration, we would love to hear from you.

Show more

If you're ready to contribute to meaningful projects and grow with a company that values expertise and collaboration, we would love to hear from you.

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Description:
At Gopuff, we’re not just delivering convenience—we’re redefining how the world shops. Since pioneering instant needs in 2013, we’ve empowered millions of customers across the U.S. and U.K. to reclaim their time through seamless, fast, and reliable delivery. Behind this transformative journey is our tech-first mindset, relentless obsession with customer experience and operational excellence.

To continue shaping the future of commerce, we’re looking for an exceptional Lead Data Analyst and this is not just a job—it’s a mission.

We are seeking a driven and analytical Lead Analyst who thrives on turning data into actionable insights that shape company-wide KPIs. You will work cross-functionally, delivering insights that empower our teams across Marketing, Finance, and Growth to make data-driven decisions.

With your expertise in SQL and dbt you will play a pivotal role in ensuring data is at the heart of our decision-making processes, helping Gopuff achieve its key performance goals.

We believe great work happens through collaboration, not competition. You foster a culture of curiosity, respect, and shared success, ensuring data is a tool for empowerment, not gatekeeping. No room for arrogance—just a commitment to helping others and making an impact together.

If you’re a high-performer who thrives in fast-paced, high-impact environments, this is your chance to build, innovate, and leave a lasting mark on one of the most disruptive industries in the world.

Are you ready to shape the future of commerce? Let’s go. 🚀

You Will:


Drive Business Efficiency: Analyse and enhance key metrics across customer acquisition, retention, and revenue generation. Your insights will directly influence how we improve processes, drive customer satisfaction, and optimise cost-efficiency.
Build Data Models for Strategic KPIs: Develop and maintain advanced data models using dbt to provide transparency and clarity into our core business performance metrics.
Deep Dive into Company Performance: Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure our KPIs are aligned with overall business objectives, identifying areas for improvement and efficiency.
Collaborate Across the Business: Partner with teams across Marketing, Growth, and Finance to ensure your data insights are not only clear but actionable for driving performance improvements.
Problem-Solve with Data: Tackle real-world challenges by using data to provide practical, strategic solutions that enhance how we operate and grow as a company.
Present Data Insights Effectively: Clearly communicate complex analyses and data insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, ensuring decisions are grounded in data.


You Have:


3+ Years in Data Analytics: Proven experience in a data-driven environment, ideally in a high-growth e-commerce or retail setting.
Expertise in SQL: Advanced skills in SQL for querying large datasets and developing complex reports. Knowledge of Python or R is a plus.
Tools Mastery: Familiarity with BI tools such as Looker, Tableau, or Power BI, with a strong ability to translate data into strategic insights.
Problem-Solver: A passion for tackling business challenges, with the ability to identify issues and propose actionable, data-driven solutions.
Strong Communicator: Ability to present data insights clearly and persuasively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Curiosity and Drive: A passion for problem-solving and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment. You’ll be excited to dive into our business performance data and uncover opportunities to drive growth.


Benefits:


A high-impact role where you’ll be directly involved in the company’s most critical operations.
Company RSU’s (Company Shares)
Private Medical + Dental cover
Annual performance appraisal and bonus
Employee Discount + FAM membership
Career growth opportunities


Company Summary & EEOC Statement:

At Gopuff, we know that life can be unpredictable. Sometimes you forget the milk at the store, run out of pet food for Fido, or just really need ice cream at 11 pm. We get it—stuff happens. But that’s where we come in, delivering all your wants and needs in just minutes.

And now, we’re assembling a team of motivated people to help us drive forward that vision to bring a new age of convenience and predictability to an unpredictable world.

Like what you’re hearing? Then join us on Team Blue.

Gopuff is an equal employment opportunity employer, committed to an inclusive workplace where we do not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, gender, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or familial status, age, ancestry, disability, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. We believe in diversity and encourage any qualified individual to apply.
Show more

  • Present Data Insights Effectively: Clearly communicate complex analyses and data insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, ensuring decisions are grounded in data.

You Have:

  • 3+ Years in Data Analytics: Proven experience in a data-driven environment, ideally in a high-growth e-commerce or retail setting.
  • Expertise in SQL: Advanced skills in SQL for querying large datasets and developing complex reports. Knowledge of Python or R is a plus.
  • Tools Mastery: Familiarity with BI tools such as Looker, Tableau, or Power BI, with a strong ability to translate data into strategic insights.
  • Problem-Solver: A passion for tackling business challenges, with the ability to identify issues and propose actionable, data-driven solutions.
  • Strong Communicator: Ability to present data insights clearly and persuasively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Curiosity and Drive: A passion for problem-solving and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment. You’ll be excited to dive into our business performance data and uncover opportunities to drive growth.

Benefits:

  • A high-impact role where you’ll be directly involved in the company’s most critical operations.
  • Company RSU’s (Company Shares)
  • Private Medical + Dental cover
  • Annual performance appraisal and bonus
  • Employee Discount + FAM membership
  • Career growth opportunities

Company Summary & EEOC Statement:

At Gopuff, we know that life can be unpredictable. Sometimes you forget the milk at the store, run out of pet food for Fido, or just really need ice cream at 11 pm. We get it—stuff happens. But that’s where we come in, delivering all your wants and needs in just minutes.

And now, we’re assembling a team of motivated people to help us drive forward that vision to bring a new age of convenience and predictability to an unpredictable world.

Like what you’re hearing? Then join us on Team Blue.

Gopuff is an equal employment opportunity employer, committed to an inclusive workplace where we do not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, gender, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or familial status, age, ancestry, disability, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. We believe in diversity and encourage any qualified individual to apply.

Title: Data Analyst - Dataiku
Description:
Headline Notes Before Application:

Hybrid Permanent Role In London - Salary £40-50k

**MUST have Dataiku / SQL & PYTHON Experience**

Sector: Financial Services

No Graduate Visa's / Sponsorship Offered




We are recruiting for a Data Analyst who will play a pivotal role in ensuring the seamless transition and efficient operation of data projects from the QA environment to production. In this role, you will be responsible for:




Issue Resolution & Escalation: Proactively resolving issues impacting critical data projects and escalating them when necessary.
Domain Expertise & Continuous Learning: Enhancing project outcomes through deep domain knowledge and fostering continuous learning within the team.
Service Monitoring & Data Insights: Utilising tools such as Dataiku, Alteryx, Tableau, and PowerBI to develop dashboards, monitor service metrics, and deliver actionable insights for informed decision-making.
Automation & Efficiency: Leveraging SQL, Python, and R to identify automation opportunities and streamline support and maintenance processes.
Documentation Management: Ensuring accurate and up-to-date documentation across processes, systems, and team structures.
Project Prioritisation & Promotion: Supporting project prioritisation and assisting in the controlled promotion of data projects from QA to production.
Backup & Disaster Recovery: Contributing to the development and implementation of robust backup and disaster recovery strategies.
Environment Health Checks: Conducting regular health checks on QA and production environments to guarantee system stability and optimal performance.

Knowledge and Experience

Experience with Alteryx: Essential for managing data workflows.
Software Delivery: Proven track record of delivering high-quality, unit-tested software within a commercial environment.
Design Principles: Practical experience in applying appropriate design patterns and principles.
Financial Sector Exposure: FX and broader financial knowledge is desirable, along with experience in financial systems.

Technical Skills

Data Engineering: Proficiency in using Alteryx and Dataiku
Data Visualisation: Experience with Tableau and PowerBI.
Programming: Strong coding skills in SQL, Python, and R.

Personal Attributes

Proactive: A self-starter with the ability to make an immediate and tangible impact.
Detail-Oriented: Meticulous in ensuring precision and quality.
Resourceful: Capable of navigating challenges with innovative solutions.
Collaborative: Thrives in a team-based environment.
Innovative: Continuously seeks new ways to enhance processes and drive success.




Additional Information

This is a full-time, permanent position offering a hybrid working arrangement within the IT team based in the London office. The successful candidate will join a dynamic team in a fast-paced environment, catering to a diverse mix of stakeholders and contributing to a rapidly evolving fintech landscape.




What You Get in Return

Along with a competitive salary, this role offers an attractive benefits package that includes private medical health insurance.

If you are ready to take on this exciting challenge and join a leading fintech bank on its growth journey, we encourage you to apply and be part of a company that is redefining the future of payments.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Opportunity

Are you passionate about data, and eager to start your career in Data Analysis?

Want to make a real impact in a fast-paced, high-growth company? To work in a dynamic environment where your insights drive strategy and performance?

If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you!

We are seeking a Data Analyst to work with our Sales and Marketing Directors across our European markets. You will help drive the execution of our go-to-market strategy through data-driven decision-making - ensuring Safetykleen continues to evolve and excel in meeting the future needs of our customers and supports our vision of making our planet Safer and Cleaner!

About You

You’re eager to make a real impact in a fast-paced, growing company, working on high-profile projects that drive business strategy. You thrive in environments that value innovation and data-driven insights, offering opportunities for career development and some international travel.

With a strong analytical mindset, you excel at transforming complex data into actionable insights. Experienced in SQL and BI tools like Power BI, you leverage technology to make informed decisions. Your attention to detail, problem-solving abilities, and exceptional communication skills makes you a strong collaborator, capable of working with diverse teams.

You’re ready for a role that offers professional growth, global exposure, and the chance to make a tangible impact.

About Us

Safetykleen is a leading provider of Parts Cleaning, Waste Collection and Environmental Advisory services to businesses across Europe. Safetykleen employs over 2,000 people and serves over 50,000 businesses in 14 countries. We deliver over 1 million services per year through our unparalleled branch network. Our headquarters are based in London, and we are backed by Apax, a leading Private Equity firm.

We are built on a strong business model, winning culture, and always putting the customer at the heart of everything we do. We have big ambitions with a strong strategy to succeed, all whilst making the planet Safer and Kleener.

The Package

£35,000 - £45,000 salary per annum.
30 days holiday plus Bank Holidays.
5% Contributory Pension scheme.
Family Life assurance of 3 times life cover salary.
Private healthcare scheme from day 1.
Enhanced maternity and paternity pay.
Cycle to work scheme.
We provide support and access to a range of internal and external courses to help and progress your career with us.
Employee recognition program.
Corporate discount scheme focussed on your wellbeing, including discounted Virgin Active Gym membership – and Gymflex.
Taste Card Membership discount.
Discount and cashback at many retailers.
Employee Assistance Program with 24/7 confidential helpline support for employees.

Into the Detail

Business Reporting & Insights:

Analyse and interpret data to provide actionable insights relating to our Portugal business
Focus on key areas such as: Sales and Marketing Performance Data, Customer Analysis (Industry Sectors), Retention Analysis
Develop dashboards, KPIs, and reports using Power BI
Automate and optimise recurring reports to enhance efficiency

Commercial Function Partnering:

Support the Portugal commercial function by understanding planning and data needs
Analyse targets, headcount, KPIs, and CRM usage to enhance business operations
Provide ad hoc analysis and deep dives into business trends

Data Extraction & Management:

Query and extract data from ERP, BI, and other sources to support business reporting
Ensure data integrity and accuracy, resolving inconsistencies with IT support
Align data management practices with Group Reporting and Analytics guidelines

We look forward to hearing you!

Show more

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Business Analyst - Data (Insurance)




A Global insurance company is looking for a Business Analyst to join their Data team. In this role, you’ll gather and analyse business needs, design data solutions, and support project delivery.




Essential skills of the: Business Analyst – Data




Expertise in business process mapping, data analysis, and requirements gathering.
Proficient in Azure, AWS, and data lake/data mesh concepts.
Skilled in Agile methodologies, Jira, and Confluence.
Strong communicator with excellent documentation skills.
Knowledge of GDPR, Solvency II, and data governance.




If this position is of interest, please don’t hesitate to apply. Joshua from Arthur will be in touch to discuss your application.




Salary: £50,000 – £65,000 per annum

Location: Central London, EC3A – 3 days per week

Start Date: ASAP (up to 3 months’ notice)

Title: Research Executive
Description:
Job Title: Research Associate

Location: West London with hybrid working 2-3 days in the office.

Salary: £28,000-36,000 per annum (depending on experience)




Are you passionate about data and market research? We’re seeking a Research Associate to join our dynamic research & consultancy business.




In this role, you’ll undertake international research, analyse data, and contribute to insightful reports across the banking, retail technology, and payments sectors. This is an excellent opportunity to grow your career in market intelligence.




What you’ll do:

Conduct primary and secondary research, including surveys and executive interviews
Analyse data and produce reports for industry leaders
Contribute to newsletters and consulting projects
Work independently and as part of larger teams on global projects
Take on project management responsibilities as you progress




What we’re looking for:

Minimum two years' post-degree experience (not necessarily in research)
Strong writing, communication, and numerical skills
Proficient in Microsoft Office, especially Excel
Language skills are a bonus in particular European languages




Why Join them?

This company are committed to supporting your professional development, offering a diverse and collaborative working environment. If you’re looking to develop a career in market intelligence, we’d love to hear from you!

Title: Associate Data Analyst, Revenue
Description:
Inclusion at Bumble Inc. 

Bumble Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and we strongly encourage people of all ages, colour, lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer and non-binary people, veterans, parents, people with disabilities, and neurodivergent people to apply. We're happy to make any reasonable adjustments that will help you feel more confident throughout the process, please don't hesitate to let us know how we can help.

In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her, he/him, they/them, etc).




We’re looking for curious analysts interested in being considered for a Data Analyst role in the Advanced Data Analytics team and who are buzzing to solve impactful questions for exciting products in the online dating industry and beyond.

In this role, you’ll support our stakeholders with data and insights related to a variety of business areas. You’ll be involved in experimentation design and planning, visualisations, trend diagnostics, dashboarding and much, much more. 




What you'll do:
You’ll have access to the most diverse, varied and complex data sets in the technology world right now (10’s of billions of data points per day!!)
You’ll be doing all the typical day-to-day tasks such as generating practical insights from the data, manipulating complex datasets, helping us understand how to improve and optimise our members experience to facilitate the creation of meaningful, equitable and healthy relationships
Unlock your potential by upskilling in SQL, Python and other essential tools, empowering you to expand your skill set and excel in your career
You will help uncover tactical and strategic insights and support experimentation in a range of areas such as revenue management, operations and strategy. For instance, you could work on testing and validating pricing and promotion based opportunities across our portfolio of apps. 
You will make contributions to the data model and could contribute to building out data pipelines
You’ll collaborate closely with several potential teams including Product Managers, strategists, operations managers, and Data Engineers PLUS, you’ll be building detailed, entrepreneurial and business-minded insights that directly contribute to the successful growth of Bumble Inc





You have confidence in the following:
You are a data analyst with expertise in SQL, data visualisation, A/B testing, statistical knowledge and storytelling, etc, is entrepreneurial, gets excited about building from scratch, and is relentlessly experimenting in pursuit of building a product that members love. 
Supporting experimentation analytics (e.g. A/B testing, user group testing): significance analysis, non-parametric methods, bootstrapping, causal inference
Manipulating complex datasets using a range of tools such as SQL and Hive
Building effective self serve tools and visualisations to help optimise decision making
Engaging and collaborating with key stakeholders such as developers, product managers, and senior management
Identifying issues and opportunities, translating business problems into analytical diagnoses and delivering insights that answer the most pressing questions
Supporting engineers and teammates in improving data quality, and specifying requirements for new data collection
Partnering with the wider analytics / data science team to solve business problems
Experience in Python is desirable but not required
Experience with data modelling and make domain-specific data models is a plus








About Us

Bumble Inc. is the parent company of Bumble, Badoo, Bumble For Friends, and Geneva. The Bumble platform enables people to build healthy and equitable relationships, through Kind Connections. Founded by Whitney Wolfe Herd in 2014, Bumble was one of the first dating apps built with women at the center and connects people across dating (Bumble Date), friendship (Bumble For Friends) and professional networking (Bumble Bizz). Badoo, which was founded in 2006, is one of the pioneers of web and mobile dating products. Bumble For Friends is a friendship app where people in all stages of life can meet people nearby and create meaningful platonic connections. Geneva is a group and community app for people to connect based on shared interests.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Data Analyst for a Teleco & Technology Organisation

Location: London (2-3 days hybrid working)

Salary: Competitive

________________________________________

Company Overview:




We are looking for a dynamic, private equity-backed business. As the company continues to grow, we are seeking a Data Analyst to contribute to our exciting journey of integrating new systems and enhancing data capabilities. As part of a dynamic team focused on system and customer migration, you'll play a pivotal role in maturing our business processes. With your expertise in data analysis, you will help drive data-driven decision-making across the organization. This role is ideal for professionals with a strong commercial mindset and proficiency in SQL who are ready to make a significant impact.

________________________________________




Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with the finance team to optimize data analysis and generate meaningful insights.
Engage in the migration process focusing on system improvement and data enhancement.
Play an active role in driving better decision-making through in-depth data insights.
Work closely with finance business partners to align data initiatives with commercial objectives.
Support the integration of HOBS (billing system) and DOMO (reporting tool) to enhance data management and reporting.

________________________________________




Required Experience:

Proven experience in data analysis with a strong commercial mindset.
Exceptional SQL skills and proficiency in working with databases.
Demonstrated ability to generate actionable insights from complex datasets.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to communicate complex information effectively.

________________________________________




Benefits and Opportunities

Opportunity to be at the forefront of system integration and process improvement.
Collaborate with a talented and dedicated finance team led by experienced professionals.
Be part of a structured organisation with a strategic vision for growth and innovation.
Potential for personal and professional growth by significantly impacting the company's data capabilities.

________________________________________




Candidate Profile:

Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills with a proven capacity to turn data into actionable insights.
Ability to work collaboratively across departments, particularly with finance and systems teams, to drive data-centric improvements.
Adept at balancing multiple projects and tasks while meeting deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Passionate about integrating new technologies and tools to enhance data handling and reporting.
Experience working in telecom or technology sectors is a plus, bringing industry-specific insights.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst




💰 £80,000-£100,000

🖥️ SQL, Snowflake, Data Visualisation

🌍 London, 3 days in office

📈 Sports market research & analytics for the gaming industry




We are partnered with a leading provider of analytics solutions in the sports gaming industry, who leverage real-time data and insights to enhance decision-making. They are looking for a Data Analyst to join the team to play in critical role in supporting data driven initiatives within this industry.




The role...

You will work with large datasets and create reports that drive business decisions. The ideal candidate will be proficient in SQL and Snowflake, with a strong understanding of the sports gaming landscape.




What you'll be doing...

You will analyse large datasets to identify trends, anomalies, and insights relevant to the sports gaming industry.
You will write SQL queries to extract and manipulate data from Snowflake.
You will develop dashboards and reports to provide actionable insights for internal teams and stakeholders.
You will optimise data processing performance within Snowflake.
You will work with cross-functional teams, including developers, product managers, and business intelligence teams, to support data-driven decision-making.
You will stay updated on the latest developments in data analytics and identify opportunities to automate data processing and reporting tasks.




What they're looking for...

Technical expertise with SQL.
Hands-on experience with Snowflake.
Familiarity with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, or Looker).
Experience with Python for data analysis and automation.
Experience in the sports gaming or betting industry is highly preferred.




If you are interested in finding out more, please apply or contact me directly!




📧 jordanf@burnssheehan.co.uk




Data Analyst




💰 £80,000-£100,000

🖥️ SQL, Snowflake, Data Visualisation

🌍 London, 3 days in office

📈 Sports market research & analytics for the gaming industry

HTML:
Data Analyst


💰 £80,000-£100,000

🖥️ SQL, Snowflake, Data Visualisation

🌍 London, 3 days in office

📈 Sports market research & analytics for the gaming industry


We are partnered with a leading provider of analytics solutions in the sports gaming industry, who leverage real-time data and insights to enhance decision-making. They are looking for a Data Analyst to join the team to play in critical role in supporting data driven initiatives within this industry.


The role...

You will work with large datasets and create reports that drive business decisions. The ideal candidate will be proficient in SQL and Snowflake, with a strong understanding of the sports gaming landscape.


What you'll be doing...

  • You will analyse large datasets to identify trends, anomalies, and insights relevant to the sports gaming industry.
  • You will write SQL queries to extract and manipulate data from Snowflake.
  • You will develop dashboards and reports to provide actionable insights for internal teams and stakeholders.
  • You will optimise data processing performance within Snowflake.
  • You will work with cross-functional teams, including developers, product managers, and business intelligence teams, to support data-driven decision-making.
  • You will stay updated on the latest developments in data analytics and identify opportunities to automate data processing and reporting tasks.


What they're looking for...

  • Technical expertise with SQL.
  • Hands-on experience with Snowflake.
  • Familiarity with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, or Looker).
  • Experience with Python for data analysis and automation.
  • Experience in the sports gaming or betting industry is highly preferred.


If you are interested in finding out more, please apply or contact me directly!


📧 jordanf@burnssheehan.co.uk

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (Data Vault) - Contract Opportunity (Outside IR35) - Fully Remote

Are you a detail-oriented data professional with a strong analytical mindset and expertise in Data Vault modelling, business intelligence, and stakeholder collaboration? We are supporting a leading energy solutions provider in their search for a Data Analyst to work on a contract basis outside IR35.

In this role, you will collaborate with business stakeholders to define data requirements, analyse datasets, and contribute to data modelling efforts, ensuring high-quality insights that drive decision-making.

Key Responsibilities:

Partner with stakeholders to define the data inputs of business processes and translate them into technical requirements and a Data Vault model.
Analyse and document data sets across business workflows and systems, identifying key insights.
Reverse-engineer SQL scripts to create technical and business specifications, as well as use cases.
Work closely with data engineers and IT teams to ensure thorough and accurate data documentation.
Act as a bridge between business units and data teams, ensuring smooth integration of data processes.

What We're Looking For:

Strong proficiency in SQL, Microsoft Excel, and BI tools such as Power BI or Tableau.
Ability to translate business rules into actionable data use cases.
Strong stakeholder management skills with the confidence to lead and facilitate workshops in a fast-paced, data-centric environment.
Experience in data modelling (Data Vault, Star/Snowflake) and presenting insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Skilled in Power BI data modelling and working with cloud-based data platforms, particularly Azure (Synapse Analytics).
Understanding of database structures, data warehousing, and ETL processes.
Knowledge of data governance principles and best practices.

This is an excellent opportunity to contribute to a high-impact data project with a leading organisation, offering full remote flexibility.

Interested? Apply now!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Opportunity: Data Analyst




My client is renowned publisher looking for a skilled Data Analyst to join their dynamic team. This role is pivotal in supporting both internal and external studio partners, focusing on data-driven strategies to enhance marketing and growth efforts for PC and Console titles.




Role Overview: You will be responsible for establishing robust data and reporting systems. By leveraging data and analytical expertise, the analyst will help shape marketing strategies, identify new opportunities, and address challenges. This role involves close collaboration with the marketing team, agency partners, and studios to provide actionable insights and recommendations.




Key Responsibilities:




Seamlessly integrate data from various systems to ensure accurate and consistent reporting.
Analyze the effectiveness of paid media campaigns and marketing initiatives to determine the most impactful tactics.
Create comprehensive reports and dashboards that offer insights into the success of growth and marketing efforts.
Ensure proper tracking mechanisms are in place for accurate attribution across PC and console platforms.
Transform raw data into meaningful insights and actionable recommendations.
Work with the marketing team to define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) and forecast objectives.
Support the development of marketing attribution models and media mix models to optimize budget allocations.




Key Skills & Experience:




Relevant education in marketing and/or data analysis.
Over 2 years of experience in a marketing analytics role, preferably within the games industry.
Proficient in using Web Analytics platforms (Adobe Analytics and/or Google Analytics).
Working knowledge of SQL and Python for data extraction and manipulation.
Advanced understanding of data integration from various sources, including CRM, web analytics, and paid media platforms.
Exceptional attention to detail to ensure consistent data quality across reports.
Proven ability to translate technical information into clear, actionable insights.
A passion for gaming and a strong understanding of industry trends and innovations.




Benefits:




Generous holiday allowance.
Comprehensive benefits package, including health/dental insurance and a pension plan.
Hybrid work setup with 2 days a week in the London office.




Equal Opportunities:




My client is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment. They welcome candidates from all backgrounds and are dedicated to creating a positive work culture that embraces diversity, equality, and inclusion. All candidates must have the legal right to work in the UK.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
My client, a HR and Payroll technology company who operate globally across multiple regions including UK, Ireland, Sweden, Netherlands, and the US are looking to hire a Data Analyst for the FP&A team.




Reporting to the FP&A Director, this role will support the UK, Ireland and Sweden organisation in delivering analytical information whilst making data more accessible.




Your analytical skills will help them uncover insights that drive business improvements and strategic initiatives.




This is a hybrid role with three days in the office in Staines.




Key Responsibilities




Create, maintain and improve Power BI dashboards for Revenue, Expenses, Headcount, and other operational metrics.
Provide analytical insights related to clients, including client industry trends, size, product utilisation, and payslip volumes.
Extracting, cleansing, and combining information from multiple data sets.
Driving upstream process improvements that result in more accurate reporting.
Training individuals on how to effectively use workbooks, reports and dashboards.
Using tools and techniques to visualise data in easy-to-understand formats.
Continuously monitoring data quality.
Engage with other departments to develop a deep understanding of their functions and available reporting.
Support on the preparation of the monthly leadership dashboard reporting, covering financial and operational performance
Providing general analytical support to the Finance team & business.




Requirements




Degree educated.
Power BI developer experience is a requirement.
Experience of financial systems such as Oracle (preferable) or SAP.
Advanced Excel experience.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.




If this is of interest please apply. Unfortunately, due to volume of applicants, we may not be able to respond to all applications.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
VPZ is a family-run business with 600+ staff. We have grown from just 1 store in Edinburgh to over 180 stores across the whole of the UK and we’re not stopping there. We are known for setting and driving the standards within the vape industry.




This is a great chance to join our growing Data team within our Head Office in Newbridge, Edinburgh.




About the role:




Covering day-to-day reporting along with ad hoc requests, providing verbal and written context to reports as well as taking the initiative to provide key insights based on your findings or from the wider team.




You will be responsible for updating and maintaining databases and day-to-day reporting, while troubleshooting issues that might arise within the reporting suite. Providing regular sales, product, and customer reports throughout the business and creating new reporting as and when required for stakeholders at all levels.




What you'll need:




Full understanding of data structuring, modelling, and cleansing.
Extensive experience building dashboards from the ground up using data visualization software (Power BI or Tableau preferably).
Strong Excel skills




Nice to have:




Experience of analyzing data within a retail environment.
Experience with SQL or Python.




Applicants must be 18 years old or above, any subsequent job offer is subject to pre employment screening checks.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst
Start Date: ASAP
Position: Permanent (12 Month FTC)  
Location / Remote Working: London / Hybrid (1 day on site per week)
Salary: 35 – 40K Annually
 
Summary

Trust in Soda has formed an exclusive partnership with a prominent finance company in search of a talented Data Analyst. The successful applicant will collaborate closely with the business to evaluate and gain deeper insights into their decision-making processes.
 
Essentials

Experience assessing effectiveness of Lead Generation and Marketing
Proven ability to manage extensive datasets and work with relational databases.
Advanced expertise in SQL, including crafting comprehensive procedures from the ground up.
Proficiency in using data visualization platforms like PowerBI and Tableau.
Skilled in leveraging Python for ETL processes and data analysis tasks.
In-depth knowledge of A/B testing and statistical significance methodologies to evaluate marketing effectiveness.
Established background as a Data Analyst or in an equivalent analytical role.
Strong capability to see how their contributions align with overarching business objectives.
Excel at fostering and maintaining robust relationships across the organization.
Competent in juggling multiple responsibilities while ensuring deadlines are met.
A passionate drive to enhance processes and uncover innovative opportunities through data exploration.
 
Key Responsibilities

Collaborate with key stakeholders to design and manage an extensive suite of dashboards.
Build and maintain integrations that support origination channels and initiatives.
Conduct and evaluate A/B testing to enhance marketing performance.
Assess lead opportunities, actions, and results to determine success potential and highlight areas for improvement.
Deliver analytical insights to key stakeholders in a straightforward and clear format to ensure easy comprehension.

Title: Data Analyst, Company Intelligence
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst - Company Intelligence

Employment Type: Full-time

Comp: Circa £35K Basic Salary +Bonus

Location: Fully remote

Company: STOIX




About Us: STOIX is a challenger brand within Finance Executive Search and Interim Management. We combine best-in-class RecTech and AI with top quality human talent to support our clients in making truly transformative hires. Our mission is simple: to redefine the search experience. We reject traditional and unimaginative methodologies that often yield disappointing outcomes. A certified B Corp, we believe that it is possible to do good business whilst behaving with integrity. We work in a smart and flexible way, providing our clients and candidates with a high quality service whilst maintaining a healthy balance that allows our team to live life to the fullest.




Role Overview: We are seeking a data driven individual to join our fast growing, dynamic team! The Data Analyst - Company Intelligence plays a crucial role in building out a new client service for STOIX. STOIX has been helping our clients grow by hiring best in class people, and we now also partner with select clients to support their decision making around potential acquisitions. Additionally this position is responsible for gathering, organizing, and interpreting complex data to provide strategic insights that inform candidate sourcing and client engagement.




Key Responsibilities:

Company Data Acquisition and Management:

Conduct comprehensive research to gather relevant data on target companies, including organizational structures, financial performance, industry trends, and competitive landscapes.
Maintain and update a robust database of company information, ensuring accuracy and completeness.
Utilize various data sources and tools to extract and compile information efficiently.

Data Analysis and Interpretation:

Analyze company data to identify key trends, patterns, and insights that are relevant to assignments.
Develop and generate reports and presentations that effectively communicate findings to internal stakeholders.
Create detailed organizational charts and company maps to visualize relationships and hierarchies.

Strategic Support:

Provide strategic insights by identifying potential candidate pools and target companies.
Assist in the development of client presentations and proposals by providing data-driven market intelligence.
Contribute to the development of best practices for data collection and analysis.

Data integrity:

Ensure that all data is kept up to date, and that data is entered in a correct way.
Work to make sure that any data that is collected is done so in a way that is compliant with data protection laws.




Qualifications:

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and software (e.g., Excel, databases).
Excellent research and information gathering abilities.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy.
Effective communication and presentation skills.
An interest in business and how companies work




Why us?:

Competitive salary and benefits package. However much we love the job, money matters and we have a compensation scheme that rewards our people for the hard work that they put in.
Flexibility. We love what we do, but we all have lives and responsibilities outside of work and we provide a working environment that supports that.
Culture. We are a diverse group of individuals that bring different skills and experience to the business and genuinely enjoy working together. Though driven and ambitious, we work as a team and believe that, by working collaboratively with each other, we all enjoy work more and get better results for our clients and our business.
Reputation. We are still a young firm but have a great reputation to maintain. Our clients love working with us and we maintain a 100% record of delivery on retained mandates.
We do things differently! We are constantly learning and growing and are keen to hire people with ideas to bring to the table. If you have best in class skills in the executive search industry and want to leverage them in a forward-thinking, collaborative and fast-growing business, then get in touch.




We’re passionate about creating an inclusive workplace that promotes and values diversity. Companies that are diverse in age, gender identity, race, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, ethnicity, and perspective are proven to be better companies. More importantly, creating an environment where everyone, from any background, can do their best work is the right thing to do

Title: Graduate Data Analyst - London
Description:
Job Position: Graduate Data Analyst (Engineer/Scientist) - via the Graduate Development Programme 

Locations: London

Starting Salary: £28,000  

Application Requirements:


Minimum 2:1 or above in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math) subject Experience in analysing data.
Right to work in the UK unsponsored for the duration of the programme.
Ability to work on site 5 days a week.



Grayce is not on the UK Border Agency's Sponsor Register and is unable to sponsor work visas for international applicants. 

Are you a curious, adaptable, and proactive problem solver with strong communication skills and a drive to make an impact? At Grayce, we're looking for ambitious graduates who are eager to learn, take ownership and build meaningful relationships while delivering excellence. If you have a keen attention to detail and accuracy, a knack for spotting trends and patterns and the ability to tell a compelling story using data, you'll thrive in our environment. We value resourcefulness, resilience, and a passion for driving change. Join us and be part of a community that cares, collaborates, and thrives together.

Understanding the types of roles available to a Graduate Data Analyst:

Data Analyst:Kick-start your career as a Data Analyst, where you'll transform complex data into actionable insights, create dynamic visualisations and drive business decisions. You'll work with cutting-edge tools, collaborate with stakeholders, and develop automated reports and dashboards, all while refining your technical expertise and problem-solving skills in a fast-paced environment.

Data Engineer:Launch your career as a Data Engineer, where you'll design and maintain data pipelines, integrate multiple data sources, and ensure data quality in a cloud-based environment. You'll write clean, testable code, automate data transformation processes, and collaborate with teams to build scalable, high-quality data solutions that drive business insights.

Data Scientist:Working as a Data Science Analyst, you'll support quantitative research and management teams by delivering high-quality data models and exploratory analysis. You'll leverage your analytical skills to extract insights from complex datasets, build robust data pipelines, and collaborate across teams to drive data-driven initiatives that enhance data ecosystems.

Why Grayce?

We specialise in driving change and transformation for some of the world's most ambitious organisations and for over a decade, we've partnered with FTSE 100 and 250 companies to deliver impactful results by developing and deploying high-performing talent in the UK and beyond.

Our accelerated development programme is designed to launch the careers of recent graduates eager to make an impact. We offer a fast-track route to expertise, allowing you to gain hands-on experience with one of our impressive clients in a variety of flexible roles.

Opportunity: You'll embark on a journey of continuous learning, gaining industry-accredited qualifications, whilst getting hands-on experience, working full time on site directly with prestigious FTSE100, 250, and 500 organisations.

Delivery: Typically will work for one client, delivering high quality outcomes during your Grayce tenure. The skills required for exceptional client delivery include natural curiosity, proactivity, adaptability, effective communication and problem solving.

Mentoring: Thrive under the guidance of our experienced Delivery Managers and Technical Trainers. They'll be your go-to, offering support, insights and sharing experiences.

Progression: Starting as an Analyst with the potential for significant salary progression, you will pick up invaluable skills and complete a minimum of 6 industry recognised accreditations during your time on the development programme.

What Makes a Great Grayce Analyst

2:1 Undergraduate Degree: An undergraduate degree with a minimum 2:1 within in a STEM field. A solid academic basis within data analysis and science through an additional MSc would be an advantage.

Data Tools: Previous experience with tools such as Excel, R, SQL or Python are an essential for this role. If you have utilised visualisation programmes such as Tableau or Power BI in projects before, we are also keen to hear from you.

Analytical Problem Solving: We're looking for analytical minds that can spot patterns and think creatively. Whether it's dissecting complex issues or finding fresh angles, we highly value critical thinking skills and their application.

Soft Skills: From effective communication styles to planning, organisation and a learning development mindset, Grayce is committed to building core consultancy skills. Stakeholder and time management are core skills we utilise every day and we look for examples of those through our interview process.

Why work for us?

Competitive Salary: Starting at £28,000 with potential for significant growth

Industry Recognition: We help you embark on your journey with fully funded, industry-recognised qualifications designed to maximise your experience and put you in control of your career

Mentors and Coaches: Access a network of mentors and coaches dedicated to you, your experiences and development at Grayce

Wellness Support: We are here for you 24/7 with our Employee Assistance Programme, offering confidential assistance ranging from financial and legal support to health and wellbeing.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst




My client is looking for a Data Analyst to join their team. You'll analyze business performance, product features, and customer behavior, helping to shape data-driven decisions.




Key Responsibilities:

Analyze customer, product, onboarding, and payment data to identify trends.
Conduct deep dives into product performance and user behavior.
Build reports and dashboards (Tableau or similar) to enable self-serve insights.
Work with Data Engineers to enhance data analytics capabilities.
Support A/B testing and experimentation for product improvements.




Key Skills & Experience:

Strong SQL skills (Redshift, MSSQL).
Experience handling large, complex datasets to generate insights.
Data visualization skills.
Passion for turning data into actionable business insights.




Desirable:

Experience with Python, R, or other statistical tools.




If you’re looking for an exciting role in a fast-paced, data-driven environment, let’s chat!

Title: Graduate Data Analyst - Leeds
Description:
Job Position: Graduate Data Analyst - via the Graduate Development Programme 

Locations: Leeds

Starting Salary: £25,000  

Application Requirements:


Minimum 2:1 degree in Mathematics, Economics, Finance, Accounting, Business Management, or another numerically focused subject
Right to work in the UK unsponsored for the duration of the programme.
Ability to work on site 5 days a week.



Grayce is not on the UK Border Agency's Sponsor Register and is unable to sponsor work visas for international applicants. 

Are you a recent graduate with a strong numerical background and an interest in Finance processes and transformation? Are you eager to launch your career in data analysis and reconciliations? At Grayce, we're looking for ambitious individuals with a keen eye for detail, problem-solving skills, effective communication skills and a passion for working with data.

This is an exciting opportunity for curious and proactive graduates who are immediately available to join our team as a Graduate Data Analyst in Leeds. You'll play a key role in data reconciliation, migration, and cleansing, helping to resolve transaction discrepancies and ensure accurate financial records.

If you have a keen attention to detail and accuracy, a knack for spotting trends and patterns and the ability to tell a compelling story using data, you'll thrive in our environment. We value resourcefulness, resilience and a passion for driving change. Join us and be part of a community that cares, collaborates, and thrives together.

What You'll Be Doing:


Analysing mathematical and financial data
Cleansing and migrating data to a new system
Identifying and resolving discrepancies in financial transactions
Using Excel and data analysis tools to provide insights and solutions
Collaborating with stakeholders to ensure a smooth transition of data
Working on-site in Leeds (with flexible office-based requirements



What We're Looking For:


Strong Excel and data analysis skills
A problem-solving mindset with great attention to detail
Strong communication and stakeholder management skills
A willingness to learn and adapt in a fast-paced, analytical environment
The ability to start immediately



Why Grayce?

We specialise in driving change and transformation for some of the world's leading organisations. Our Graduate Development Programme provides hands-on experience, industry-recognised qualifications, and a fast-track route to building a successful career in data and financial analytics.


Competitive Salary: £25,000 starting salary with progression opportunities
Industry Accreditation: Fully funded qualifications to enhance your expertise
Career Growth: Opportunity to work with FTSE 100, 250, and 500 companies
Mentorship & Support: Access to experienced coaches and technical trainers
Flexibility: Possibility of relocation to Manchester for future opportunities



Start Your Career with Grayce

If you're ready to apply your numerical skills in a dynamic, problem-solving role and want to kickstart your career immediately, we'd love to hear from you.

Apply now and take the first step toward a rewarding future in data analysis and reconciliation.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst - Customer Data

Salary up to £50,000

Hybrid

Brighton and Hove




Talent Hub are looking for an experienced Customer Data Analyst to join a thriving business based in Central Brighton. You will play a key part of their Customer Data strategy at an exciting time for this successful company.




Key responsibilities for this Senior Data Analyst job include:




Lead the reporting, insight and analytics for the organisation, focusing on customer data and story telling, providing pro-active reporting and actionable insights. With a strong emphasis on customer acquisition and engagement and optimising lifetime member value.
Regular monitoring and reporting on key customer data metrics.
Support and provide guidance on the development of campaign and overall performance reporting, actionable insight and data-driven models for use across the customer lifecycle (e.g. engagement, attrition, life-time value, segmentation and recommendations/next best action modelling).
Produce data visualizations to help support and communicate important learning.
Where possible, incorporate qualitative findings into quantitative reporting.




What you will need for this Senior Data Analyst job:




At least 4 years experience in a Data Analytics and Customer insight position.
Membership or Customer Services, B2C, Travel or Leisure sector background.
Experience of working with CRM's.
Strong oral and written communication skills, with experience presenting data interpretation and insights to non-technical audiences.
Experience in using data storytelling techniques.
Knowledge of other data platforms such Microsoft Customer Insights, Microsoft Customer Data, Microsoft Fabric, social marketing insights, and email marketing analytics would be beneficial.
Experience in SQL, SAS, Python, or R programming.
Knowledge of web analytics tools would be helpful but not essentail.
Some exposure to AI tools such as Co Pilot.
Line management or mentoring skills.




Benefits include:

2 days office based
24 days holiday plus bank holidays,
healthcare,
hybrid working
plus lots of other perks!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst Location: Hybrid Salary & Benefits: Up to 50k




The Company

Our client is an innovative and data-driven organization that empowers decision-making across multiple business functions. They leverage cutting-edge technology to optimize efficiency and drive strategic initiatives.




Work with a fast-growing company that values data-driven decision-making.
Exposure to multiple business functions, including Finance, Operations, and Product.
Opportunities to work with modern analytics tools, including SQL, Python, and Looker Studio.
A collaborative, learning-focused environment with room for career growth in analytics, data engineering, or data science.
Flexible working arrangements, including remote options.




The Role

As a Data Analyst, you’ll play a crucial role in transforming raw data into actionable insights that drive business decisions. Working closely with stakeholders, you’ll build automated reports, perform deep-dive analysis, and enhance data processes.




Develop and maintain automated reports and dashboards for key business functions.
Ensure data accuracy and consistency across the organization.
Perform deep-dive analysis to uncover trends and opportunities in Finance, Operations, and Product.
Optimize SQL queries and support scalable data processes.
Gain exposure to engineering workflows and the opportunity to grow into analytics engineering or data science.




Your Experience

We’re looking for a self-driven, analytical individual who enjoys solving business challenges with data. If you’re passionate about turning numbers into insights and working with modern tools, this role is for you.

Experience with Looker Studio or similar BI tools for reporting and visualization.
Strong proficiency in SQL for data extraction and transformation.
Basic knowledge of Python for data manipulation and analysis.
Strong Excel skills for quick data analysis.
A proactive, problem-solving mindset with excellent communication skills.







Note

This role does not provide sponsorship.




Next Steps

This Data Analyst role is in high demand and won’t be available for long! If you're interested, hit the apply button or reach out for more information.

Title: JUNIOR INSIGHT ANALYST
Description:
Job Description

JUNIOR INSIGHT ANALYST

Oxford/Hybrid - Customer Success Team

About This Job

Our Analysts are vital to NielsenIQ’s success. They work every day with our client base, which includes most of the major brands you see in the supermarket. We also work with most of the supermarkets and other retailers where you’ll find these products. If you saw it the last time you did your weekly shop, they’re probably a NielsenIQ client, as is the shop. They all rely on our people.

Our clients come to us with challenges and questions ranging from deciding on new product development, designing a new price strategy, and much more! NielsenIQ’s Analysts work with our clients to create and present analyses based on the world’s best datasets. Our insights team support clients in Health and Beauty, Beers, Wine and Spirits or Grocery.

Our staff are confident and capable crafters of compelling insights, deliver clear and actionable recommendations to our clients helping them grow their business.  

A successful candidate for this role will be someone who can establish strong relationships with both our clients and our colleagues. You will quickly become a trusted partner, working with many of our clients’ teams, including marketing, sales, category, and many more. You will be expected to understand our clients’ needs and then create and present solutions that help achieve their strategic and tactical goals.

If telling stories through data excites you but you’re uncertain whether you have the data knowledge: get in touch. We have an excellent training program, ensuring you understand all our products and how we create analyses.

Responsibilities


Have a strong working knowledge of the client business priorities and the role we can play in supporting these goals (e.g., participating in business cycles such as brand planning & range reviews etc.)
Understand the impact we can have on personal objectives of individuals at our clients
Responsible for setting up client onboarding for analytics & insights services and conducting tactical client training for Guided Analytics & NielsenIQ tools such as Connect Express and Discover
Responsible for identifying opportunities through day-to-day engagements with our clients, handing off opportunities to Account Development to pursue


Qualifications


Excellent time management and prioritization skills with a proven track record of delivering projects on time
Confident numerically
Ability to analyse data confidently
Problem solving and solutions orientated
Performs work accurately and effectively with attention to detail
Engaging presenter
Good at building relationships, internally and with clients
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Experience of working in an analytical environment
An understanding of the FMCG industry and trends
Capable of leveraging tools such as Microsoft excel and PowerPoint


What We Can Offer

We provide the most complete and trusted view of consumers and markets in 90 countries covering 90% of the world’s populations. Focusing on consumer-packaged goods manufacturers and retailers, we combine unparalleled datasets, pioneering technology, and the industry’s top talent to create insights that unlock innovation and redefine what’s possible.

Working with our Customer Success team gives you access to:


Our amazing 'people first' culture with plenty of flexibility
Career & Learning development
Making an impact on biggest FMCG manufacturers' growth
Becoming an expert in categories that shape UK retail
Joining a market leader where you’ll gain a broad perspective – a market overview of different categories and products. A truly global and diverse organisation with global opportunities.
Access to first-class analytical tools which is a great way to gain understanding of CPG market in general
Great deal of autonomy in performing your role
Exposure to major players on the market such as: P&G, Coca-cola, Unilever, Nestle


Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

HTML:
Job Description

JUNIOR INSIGHT ANALYST

Oxford/Hybrid - Customer Success Team

About This Job

Our Analysts are vital to NielsenIQ’s success. They work every day with our client base, which includes most of the major brands you see in the supermarket. We also work with most of the supermarkets and other retailers where you’ll find these products. If you saw it the last time you did your weekly shop, they’re probably a NielsenIQ client, as is the shop. They all rely on our people.

Our clients come to us with challenges and questions ranging from deciding on new product development, designing a new price strategy, and much more! NielsenIQ’s Analysts work with our clients to create and present analyses based on the world’s best datasets. Our insights team support clients in Health and Beauty, Beers, Wine and Spirits or Grocery.

Our staff are confident and capable crafters of compelling insights, deliver clear and actionable recommendations to our clients helping them grow their business.  

A successful candidate for this role will be someone who can establish strong relationships with both our clients and our colleagues. You will quickly become a trusted partner, working with many of our clients’ teams, including marketing, sales, category, and many more. You will be expected to understand our clients’ needs and then create and present solutions that help achieve their strategic and tactical goals.

If telling stories through data excites you but you’re uncertain whether you have the data knowledge: get in touch. We have an excellent training program, ensuring you understand all our products and how we create analyses.

Responsibilities

  • Have a strong working knowledge of the client business priorities and the role we can play in supporting these goals (e.g., participating in business cycles such as brand planning & range reviews etc.)
  • Understand the impact we can have on personal objectives of individuals at our clients
  • Responsible for setting up client onboarding for analytics & insights services and conducting tactical client training for Guided Analytics & NielsenIQ tools such as Connect Express and Discover
  • Responsible for identifying opportunities through day-to-day engagements with our clients, handing off opportunities to Account Development to pursue

Qualifications

  • Excellent time management and prioritization skills with a proven track record of delivering projects on time
  • Confident numerically
  • Ability to analyse data confidently
  • Problem solving and solutions orientated
  • Performs work accurately and effectively with attention to detail
  • Engaging presenter
  • Good at building relationships, internally and with clients
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills

  • An understanding of the FMCG industry and trends

What We Can Offer

We provide the most complete and trusted view of consumers and markets in 90 countries covering 90% of the world’s populations. Focusing on consumer-packaged goods manufacturers and retailers, we combine unparalleled datasets, pioneering technology, and the industry’s top talent to create insights that unlock innovation and redefine what’s possible.

Working with our Customer Success team gives you access to:

  • Our amazing 'people first' culture with plenty of flexibility

  • Making an impact on biggest FMCG manufacturers' growth
  • Becoming an expert in categories that shape UK retail
  • Joining a market leader where you’ll gain a broad perspective – a market overview of different categories and products. A truly global and diverse organisation with global opportunities.
  • Access to first-class analytical tools which is a great way to gain understanding of CPG market in general
  • Great deal of autonomy in performing your role
  • Exposure to major players on the market such as: P&G, Coca-cola, Unilever, Nestle

Our Benefits

  • Flexible working environment
  • Volunteer time off
  • LinkedIn Learning

With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – AI & Ad Performance Insights

£45,000 - £55,000 base

‼️Location: Office-based (4 days per week near Liverpool St, London), with flexibility for customer and prospect meetings.




An innovative AI-driven SaaS company is looking for a Junior Data Analyst to join their team and play a key role in transforming digital advertising. This is a unique opportunity to work at the intersection of data, AI, and product strategy, with a clear path to Product Ownership.




What You'll Do

Automate and enhance prospect account analysis to accelerate deal cycles
Assess digital advertising accounts using commercial, industry, and AI adoption insights
Develop Python-based analytics to measure performance and AI effectiveness
Standardise key metrics for paid media efficiency, AI scoring, and industry benchmarking
Build automation pipelines to reduce manual analysis and surface insights instantly
Work with engineers to productise automated performance assessments
Engage with sales and customers to translate data insights into business impact
Influence product direction by identifying AI automation and reporting opportunities




What We’re Looking For

1 year+ technical Skills: Python, SQL, data visualisation (they use Shiny, but open to Looker, Tablaeau, matplotlib)
Communication: Ability to present insights and bridge technical analysis with commercial goals - storytelling and gravitas.
Ad-Tech & Analytics: Experience with Google Ads APIs, marketing automation - must have

Added bonus for:

AI & Product Thinking: Passion for AI-driven decision-making and structured analytical models
SaaS B2B start up exposure.




Why Join

Pathway to Product Ownership – grow from data analyst to AI-driven product leader
Hands-on exposure to cutting-edge automation and decision intelligence
Work across Product, Sales, and Engineering in a hybrid, high-impact role
Join a fast-growing, dynamic environment where innovation and collaboration drive success




If you're passionate about AI, analytics, and automation, apply now and be part of the future of AI-driven advertising.

Show more
